Active glucocorticoids (GCS), such as cortisol or corticosterone, are a prerequisite for the induction of surfactant synthesis in the fetal lung.	0.572216483039696
In fetal serum, biologically inactive metabolites (cortisone or 11-dehydrocorticosterone) outweigh the active forms.	0.31555481960603765
In this study we demonstrate with organoid cultures of fetal rat lungs that the reductive side of 11-hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase (11-HSD) regulates the intracellular activation of GCS.	0.6106694175654013
The inhibition of 11-HSD by the licorice extract glycyrrhetinic acid completely inhibits this central metabolism.	0.3854290769134276
On the other hand, GCS induce the reductive activity of 11-HSD and, therefore, they increase their own activation by positive feedback.	0.4947669822552844
In a community sample of 394 eldery aged 61 years and older from East and West Germany, diseases, contacts with general practitioners and specialists, the use of medicine, attitudes regarding health and illness, the subjective health, psychic problems, social support, social integration, social burden, and socio-demographic variables were assessed.	0.6680570918762059
Based on these data the determinants for the contact of physicians and the use of medicine were analyzed.	0.532230467717715
The results confirmed the frequency of multimorbidity in the elderly; on average we found three different diseases at the same time for each person.	0.6937863761198516
In nearly 10% of the sample we found seven diagnoses existing at the same time.	0.5774218685165159
88% had contact with a general practitioner at least once a year, 97% had contact either with a general practitioner or with a specialist once a year.	0.7773276676414798
55.8% took at least one medicine each day.	0.4979395253007841
The number of diseases existing at the same time was the most determining variable for the contact of physicians and the use of medicine.	0.5796826230626082
Furthermore, the elderly had more contact with physicians and took more medicine if they thought they were susceptible to diseases in a high degree, and if they rated their own health as poor.	0.6800922634566219
Fewer contacts with physicians and a lower use of medicine were found in those elderly that rated health behavior as little useful, that had low control beliefs regarding their own health, and that experienced only a low degree of health-related limitations in their everyday life.	0.6966228142281364
Furthermore, we found a higher use of medicine if there was little social support.	0.7927327804810708
There were no significant age-related or sex-related differences regarding the contact of practitioners or the use of medicine.	0.6971687148507655
Inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD: Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis) are chronic inflammatory and frequently relapsing diseases of the gut that ultimately lead to destruction of the intestinal tissue.	0.5706098429473246
Recent evidence suggests that a pathologic activation of the mucosal immune system in response to antigens is a key factor in the pathogenesis of IBD.	0.6077947216126943
Furthermore, changes in cell migration and cytokine production appear to contribute to the perpetuation of IBD and the postoperative recurrence of Crohn's disease.	0.5103236270588428
Based on recent advances in our understanding of the pathogenesis of IBD, several new therapeutic strategies are currently being tested in clinical practice, including recombinant anti-inflammatory cytokines (IFN-, IL-10, IL-11) and inhibitors of cell adhesion molecules (ICAM), proinflammatory cytokines (TNF, IL-12) and their receptors (TNF, IL-6R).	0.7017976054744731
Dysregulation of apoptosis may play a major role in the pathogenesis of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).	0.4444929203278734
A defective clearance of apoptotic cells or inappropriately high rates of apoptosis may lead to a pathologic accumulation of abnormal cell material with a secondary autoimmune response.	0.476216592081936
Experimental findings in apoptotic keratinocytes and C1q knock-out mice suggest an important role of C1q in the clearance of apoptotic cell material.	0.4999367602643505
In addition, there are several links between C1q and SLE: Most the patients with C1q deficiency develop a SLE-like syndrome.	0.6358434850712862
SLE itself often causes secondary C1q deficiency and autoantibodies to C1q are detected in almost all patients with active lupus nephritis.	0.5341219030516636
These observations suggest a central role of C1q in apoptosis and in the pathogenesis of SLE.	0.6017115346235988

A prospective randomized clinical trial was performed to evaluate the use of self-reinforced absorbable composites (Biofix) in the fixation of ankle fractures.	0.840096243547528
The aim of this study was to demonstrate that fixation with Biofix rods and screws is as good as the standard A. O. fixation.	0.5972133028489794
The benefits of Biofix rods and screws are: a reduction in costs since no secondary operation is needed, prevention of stress-shielding and thereby diminishing the risk of bone porosity.	0.5949961646277351
Patients aged between 16 and 75 years old with closed, non-comminuted fractures of the lateral and/or medial malleolus and dislocation of the fracture fragments greater thean 2 mm were included in the study.	0.6532765407837793
22 patients were treated with Biofix rods and screws and the control group of 19 patients with a standard technique.	0.8586279869483368
After 3, 6 and 12 months, rontgenograms were taken.	0.6607836386259314
At the same time functional results were evaluated following the criteria of Olerud and Molander.	0.6689946365020737
Two patients were withdrawn from the trial for non-medical reasons.	0.5959532852383173
22 patients (12 from the Biofix group, 10 from the AO group) operated two or more years ago were contacted to see if any complications had occured since they were last seen.	0.5777848088333963
In 4 cases a Biofix screw broke down just beneath the head during insertion.	0.3934497019767458
This did not result in an insufficient fixation of the fracture.	0.6715867392037267
There were no early post-operative complications.	0.6503241271184463
The functional and rontgenological results in both groups were equal.	0.701737099491496
In three cases a sterile sinus developed at the site of screw insertion.	0.506804635121994
Biofix rods and screws, made of polylactic acid, are a good alternative for the fixation of fractures of the ankle.	0.8441430381222699
The use of resorbable fracture fixation material has the advantage that a second operation to remove osteosynthesis material is not necessary.	0.5647882522556515
The long term results are good.	0.7222035173760817
There is, however, a possibility of development of tissue reaction to the resorbable material.	0.593474628232373
In current textbooks of dermatology, lichen amyloidosus is said to be a papular, intensely pruritic type of amyloidosis of unknown aetiology.	0.5466424874738937
When this concept was developed, there was no way of discriminating between the different types of amyloid.	0.6215719296716526
It is now known that amyloid in lichen amyloidosus is not derived from immunoglobulins or serum proteins, as it is in systemic amyloidoses, but from keratin peptides of necrotic keratinocytes.	0.6515272796962285
Even several years ago, chronic scratching was invoked as a possible cause of damage to keratinocytes in lichen amyloidosus.	0.49730942164744724
In support of this hypothesis, four cases are presented.	0.5583745100064482
Apart from amyloid in the papillary layer, all biopsy specimens revealed histopathological signs of chronic scratching (epithelial hyperplasia with hypergranulosis and compact orthokeratosis, coarse collagen in vertical streaks in the stratum papillare), such as are also found in prurigo nodularis and lichen simplex chronicus.	0.43521818120978056
Lichen amyloidosus is considered to be a variant of these conditions.	0.7018316150157388
Just as in prurigo nodularis and lichen simplex chronicus, pruritus seems to be the cause and not a symptom of the papular skin lesions.	0.5845334773803914
Consequently, treatment of lichen amyloidosus should not be directed at removing amyloid, but at improving the pruritus.	0.6910931604611394

To answer this question we compared mean slow-phase velocity (SPV) using three different recording techniques: electro-oculography (EOG), video-oculography (VOG) and infra-red oculography (IROG) during four different types of examinations.	0.5280414201946542
The examinations were the eye target tracking test (ETT), horizontal and vertical optokinetic nystagmus (OKN) tests and the rotating chair test of the horizontal vestibulo-ocular reflex (HVOR).	0.4117250085423233
For the ETT tests the VOG provided consistently higher mean SPV values with low variance, presumably because of the accuracy and stability of the calibration.	0.51276215502446
For the horizontal OKN and VOR rotating chair tests no significant differences were found between the mean SPV obtained with the different recording techniques, although the IROG recordings were associated with a larger variance.	0.70452400887625
Vertical OKN mean SPV was consistently lower with IROG and VOG techniques presumably because of non-linearities and resolution limitations inherent in these techniques.	0.3574403337196917
These results indicate that the EOG technique despite its disadvantages of noise, time to apply and variability of calibration still provides an inexpensive, reliable and accurate means of measuring slow-phase eye movements.	0.5741341670189888

Aim of this study is to investigate the microvasculature of the quadriceps tendon by injection techniques and immunohistochemical methods (antibodies against laminin) with regard to the pathogenesis of tendon degeneration.	0.720156570081721
The blood supply of the quadriceps tendon arises from descending branches of the lateral circumflex femoral artery, by branches of the descending geniculate artery and by branches of the medial and lateral superior geniculate arteries.	0.6798652594892141
Blood vessels penetrate the tendon from the surrounding connective tissue and anastomose with a longitudinally orientated intraligamentous network.	0.3757999239376741
Compared to the surrounding synovial layer, the amount of vessels in the tendon substance is greatly reduced.	0.6000028009660945
The distribution of blood vessels within the quadriceps tendon is not homogenous.	0.5534824673509503
The anterior or superficial part of the tendon has a complete vascular network that extends from the musculo-tendinous junction to the patella.	0.49650446811976245

30 mm in length and app.	0.29447668730081933
Within this area the immunohistochemical proof of laminin is negative.	0.3522662067359856

Lesions of the acetabular labrum should be treated by correcting the causes.	0.7905606162947849
In a steep acetabulum where the femoral head brings the acetabular labrum under tension and traction, the acetabulum should be rotated by triple pelvic osteotomy to slightly overcorrected acetabular measurements.	0.48302829218700444
Severely diminished acetabular and femoral anteversion can also lead to tears and impingement of the labrum.	0.3840139653632088
Then rotation of the femoral neck and/or rotations of the acetabulum by triple osteotomy to 15-20  ° of anteversion are indicated.	0.7273679312993073
Our triple osteotomy technique differs from that of others mainly in the ischial osteotomy.	0.4202343290103926
It is performed from the posterior approach between the sciatic notch next to the ischial spine and the obturator foramen and is directed 20-30  ° anteriorly from the frontal (coronal) plane.	0.5309289322241335
The osteotomies therefore are placed close enough to the acetabulum to allow free rotation, but they do not interfere with the circulation of the acetabulum, and the ligaments between the sacrum and ischium are left in normal tension.	0.6345228281087602
Our normal values of the acetabular position were tested by correlating the measurements with the absence of pain.	0.5705951619897285
The optimum is reached with a CE angle and a VCA angle of 30-35  °, an angle of the weight-bearing zone of +5 to -5  ° and a migration index of 10-15 %.	0.6873124090895195
Overcorrections again caused pain and should be avoided.	0.3710374597614259
Diminished anteversion of femur and acetabulum towards 0  ° also caused pain and should be corrected by triple and femoral osteotomy to 15-20  ° of anteversion.	0.5508749061653722
In earlier follow-ups of 216 hips 5-10 years postoperatively, 82.3 % of the joints showed no change in the degree of osteoarthrosis.	0.7543658269009155
Survival rate curves regarding the absence of pain demonstrated that pain was experienced again when joints were corrected insufficiently or overcorrected, while in good corrections the joints were free of pain in about 75 %.	0.5850458483280956

With an incidence of 1-3 %, mortality of 20 % it and permanent disability for another 20 % is a clinically relevant disorder.	0.7640062833939918

Differences from the previous method are (1) removal of stabilizer from the MMA monomer before its application, (2) the use of a different starter, (3) avoidance of O2 influence during polymerization by means of vacuum exchange with N2, and (4) polymerisation in a water bath to draw off residual heat.	0.6321322389609012
After this procedure, all immunohistochemical reactions are possible provided that the previous fixation is adequate.	0.5694333395858305

Technically, this plastic embedding can be performed at least as rapidly as the classic paraffin embedding after decalcification.	0.6636942241443192
The advantages over the latter method are: (1) the cells can be better differentiated because semi-thin sections can be made; (2) the immunoreactions can also be performed on the basis of semi-thin sections, which means they can be interpreted more easily; (3) morphometric analyses yield more reliable results because of the constant thickness of sections; (4) osteological examination of bone trabeculae, especially the search for mineralisation deficiencies, is possible; (5) the plastic embedding procedure is less dependent on individual instabilities in the quality of performance of the staff members involved.	0.7257060481756443

Between 1981 and 1994 at the Bergmannsheil Ruhr University Hospital in Bochum, Germany, we treated 145 patients with femoral diaphyseal nonunions following initial operative treatment.	0.5370845911482245
Of these patients, 138 received this initial operative treatment at an outside institution.	0.5048610062491306
The primary reconstructions for the fractures utilized plates in 112 cases, reamed nails in 24 cases and external fixators in 9 cases.	0.4435095247431565
The average age of the patients was 35 years and the mean time from the initial operative treatment was 2 years.	0.9933718968068898
Twenty-seven patients (19 %) presented with a hypertrophic nonunion and 118 (81 %) with an atrophic nonunion.	0.7841056361139691
There was a significant correlation between primary "classic" plating and development of an atrophic nonunion (2-test: P < 0.01).	0.6781726696831691
We observed 34 wound infections (23 %) with no significant correlation to the type of primary osteosynthesis.	0.8443264246325128
We determined that 73 of the pseudarthroses were due to improper osteosynthesis techniques.	0.2843035732309472
Of these cases, 41 % involved the use of plates, 83 % involved the use of reamed nails, and 78 % involved the use of external fixators.	0.6843898239589827
Fracture location near the diaphyseal-metaphyseal junctions was common in this problematic group.	0.2967499631241136
Ninety-two percent of all plates led to atrophic nonunions.	0.38714746646125503
There were 21 open fractures and of these 90 % (n = 19) developed an atrophic pseudarthrosis and 29 % (n = 6) developed a wound infection.	0.6977762931301549
Fifty-seven (39 %) of all patients had additional injuries, but we found that did not increase the risk of disturbed bone healing.	0.8475172130358238
Our revision operations focused on the elimination of wound infections, refreshment of bone healing, and improvement in fragment stability.	0.559391665319977
Only 28 % of all "classic" plates and 11 % of all external fixators were changed to an intramedullary implant at the time of the first revision surgery.	0.7775058592296596
Hypertrophic nonunions required a mean of 1.3 revision operations to achieve bone healing whereas a mean of 2 revision operations were necessary to fuse atrophic bone ends (P < 0.05).	0.5682227380112973
In cases of diaphyseal pseudarthrosis healing time was not affected by the type of osteosynthesis used for primary reconstructions.	0.5153672939367382

Results: Recurrences were diagnosed after R0 resection in a mean time of 13  +/-  6.8 months.	0.6886055701808146

Objective: To study the influence of dopexamine on pulmonary shunt and hypoxic pulmonary vasoconstriction during major thoracic surgery with one-lung ventilation (OLV).	0.49499115859082726
Design: Prospective, randomised, placebo-controlled study.	0.5933373791024815
Patients: Twenty adult patients undergoing elective pulmonary resection.	0.45597826449905854
Anaesthesia: General anaesthesia was performed using propofol, fentanyl, N2O and vecuronium.Volume-controlled ventilation was performed to maintain normocapnia over the whole investigation period.	0.6309534372336087
During OLV, the tidal volume was reduced and the respiratory rate was increased to avoid a peak airway pressure exceeding 40 cm H2O.	0.5691018288666
Furthermore the FiO2 was increased to 1,0 and the external PEEP was removed during OLV.	0.63302978289122
Interventions: The patients received either dopexamine at 2 µg/kg/min (group A, n=10) or 0,9% saline as control (group B, n=10) after assessing the baseline values.	0.8352548589213472
Measurement and results: The following cardiorespiratory variables were recorded: Heart rate, mean arterial pressure and mean pulmonary arterial pressure.	0.6501376950667844
Cardiac output was measured by thermodilution using a continuous cardiac output thermodilution catheter.	0.4777056798673919
Arterial and mixed venous blood gas analysis were measured from simultaneously drawn samples.	0.5215604680320174
Cardiac index (CI), systemic vascular resistance index, pulmonary vascular resistance index, oxygen delivery index (DO2I), oxygen consumption index and the venous admixture were calculated using standard formula.	0.6068719216315139
Furthermore, pressure-flow-curves were constructed to analyse flow independent changes in the pulmonary vascular resistance.	0.5996185114266533
Data were recorded at the following times: After induction of anaesthesia in stable haemodynamics during two-lung ventilation (baseline values, T0), intraoperatively during one-lung ventilation (T1) and postoperatively after re-establishing two-lung ventilation (T2).	0.505694505706859
Patients characteristics, data from the preoperative lung function testing and surgical procedures did not differ significantly between the groups.	0.7865712545405642
CI increased in the dopexamine group from 2,5 +/- 1,2 l - min-1 - m-2 (T0) to 3,6 +/- 0,9 l - min-1 - m-2 (T1) and 4,0 +/- 1,3 l - min-1 -  m-2 (T2).	0.8383454647864691
The course of the intrapulmonary right-to-left shunting did not differ between the groups.	0.6204407417166868
In the dopexamine-treated group the DO2I increased from 430 +/- 143 ml - min - m-2 (T0) to 652 +/- 255 ml - min - m-2 (T1) and 653 +/- 207 ml - min - m-2 (T2).	0.6123212813493012
Regarding the pressure-flow-curves there was no difference during OLV between the two groups indicating no major blocking effect of dopexamine on hypoxic pulmonary vasoconstriction.	0.5976227879996597
Conclusion: It is concluded that dopexamine can be used to improve haemodynamics and oxygen delivery during thoracic surgery without increasing venous admixture during one-lung ventilation.	0.6179235984751796

The deformity in severe spondylolisthesis consists of two components: the parallel anterocaudad slip of the spondylolisthetic vertebra, and its tilt into kyphotic malposition.	0.5313266573872765
The influence of the two components is very different: the anterocaudad slippage has not much impact on the sagittal profile of the spine and is easily compensated for by a slight increase in lumbar lordosis.	0.7156347809656998
The kyphotic deformity has a high impact on trunk imbalance and the sagittal profile.	0.45823777944975047
There are two compensation mechanisms: hyperlordosis of the lumbar spine to its anatomical extremes and - if that is not sufficient - verticalisation of the sacral bone, performed by contracture of the hamstrings and uprighting of the pelvis around the hip joints.	0.6016670862799746
The latter mechanism is followed by functional disadvantages.	0.40009188879164664
Therefore, correction of the kyphosis of L5 may be considered during operative treatment if the lumbosacral kyphosis (angle delta) is less than 85  ° and the sacral inclination less than 35  °.	0.6156335243804397

Evidence of reproducibility and accuracy is a prerequisite for useful interpretation of the results.	0.5004349658436805

Aims: The predominant cause of death due to oral cancer is the failure to control local tumor due to regional tumor recurrence.	0.6270825814176691
The sequelae of surgical resection and high-dose irradiation cause substantial changes in head and neck anatomy, leading to considerable problems in the early morphological detection of recurrent disease.	0.7176573110632367
Therefore, this study evaluates the verification of cancer recurrence by means of its pathologic glucose metabolism.	0.6593392063470794
Materials and methods: We reviewed a total of 50 [18F]-2-fluordeoxyglucose positron emission tomography (18FDG-PET) investigations performed in 44 patients who had undergone surgical resection of oral cancer.	0.75442945569929
In 23 cases, re-staging (group A) was indicated due to suspicion of recurrent or secondary tumor manifestation.	0.6499119422241246
In 27 cases, PET served as a screening procedure (group B).	0.6840002394252421
Statistic evaluation included sensitivity, specifity, positive/negative predictive value and accuracy of 18FDG-PET for the detection of tumor manifestation.	0.5119135022644515
Results: 18FDG-PET correctly identified 23 of 26 tumor sites (88%) in the re-staging group and 9 of 10 tumor sites (90%) in the screening group.	0.7316113577257284
We encountered a total number of 16 false-positive foci with an increased 18FDG-uptake.	0.5447396860506207
In six patients, 18FDG-PET detected tumor recurrence several months before a morphological correlative could be identified.	0.4678924710223034
In 5 of these 6 patients, the PET findings for the latter tumor sites determined the patient's fate.	0.6699258608021017
Specificity was 63% for local recurrence, 97% for secondary lymph node involvement and 90% for distant metastasis.	0.8220848952892397
Conclusion: According to these data, 18FDG-PET is the most effective diagnostic tool in the follow-up of oral cancer patients to date.	0.7913040599566533
Due to the high prevalence of recurrent disease in the follow-up of oral cancer, either the detection of early recurrence or the identification of additional, incurable tumors may add substantially to a rational therapeutic management.	0.7399124290635144
We therefore recommend 18FDG-PET for screening and re-staging of recurrent oral cancer.	0.5076184686577945

Failures of the antireflux procedure are mainly due to disruption or displacement of the wrap with the telescope phenomenon.	0.35719776788047447

We report a patient with a malignant choroid melanoma in whom waves I and II of the brainstem auditory evoked potentials (BAEP) disappeared during surgery under controlled arterial hypotension and hypothermia (31.1 ° C).	0.6048397837085416
The waves could be recorded again immediately after the mean arterial pressure was increased from 48 to 77 mmHg.	0.5406937976151766
The oesophageal temperature had dropped by 0.3 ° C at this time.	0.527388092736778
The 2-channel electroencephalogram (EEG) showed no irregularities during this time period.	0.6500056174502566
A bilateral, reversible, apparently blood-pressure-dependent loss of waves I and II during arterial hypotension despite a normal EEG has to our knowledge not been previously described in the literature.	0.5514335746544655
The isolated loss of waves I and II with maintenance of waves III, IV, and V is unusual.	0.5928474953895543
The literature contains reports of acoustic neurinoma patients in whom only wave V could be recorded.	0.5631301315649231
This is regarded as an indication of continued impulse conduction despite the loss of waves I to IV.	0.5178263778110337
Others have observed a patient with temporary and reversible loss of BAEP wave I due to vasospasm of the internal auditory artery that apparently occurred during or shortly after manipulation of the internal auditory meatus.	0.5358582026935524
Assuming anatomic peculiarities in the blood supply to the generators of the BAEP waves, a stenosis of the basilar artery could be considered as the cause of the bilateral reversible loss of waves I and II.	0.6633155004384148
Another potential source could be the induced hypothermia, but this does not seem very likely because the patient's temperature was 0.3 ° C lower at the return of the waves than at their loss.	0.7663441525502704
In the syndrome arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia cardiomyopathy, little is known to date about the mechanism for the development of arrhythmias.	0.5284330035864453
In a group of 54 patients with documented ventricular tachycardia during longterm ECG recordings, the determinants for the development of VT and the relationship between signal-averaged ECG and the morphological characteristics of the disease are investigated.	0.7093924807181143
The analysis of the long-term electrocardiographic data includes the measurement of RR-intervals 30, 15, 5, 1min and immediately before onset of the VT, the determination of the morphology of the previous ventricular premature beats, and the frequency of the atrial arrhythmias.	0.7669522308970117
Normal values for the analysis of late potentials in the ECG signal accquisition with bidirectional filters between 40 and 300Hz were defined a maximum of 113ms for a QRS width, LAS of 38ms, and RMS40 of 16uV.	0.5415519173223724
The analysis of the long-term ECG produced monomorphic VT in all cases without previous atrial arrhythmia and in only 4 cases with previous polymorphic ventricular premature beats.	0.618111499701546
A long-short phenomenon could only be proven in 4VT episodes.	0.5566640861491347
In 84% of all tachycardias, no arrhythmia were found immediately before onset of the arrhythmic event.	0.6917878493228258
According to the circadian clock, two peaks, mornings between 6 and 9h and evenings between 6 and 9h, could be determined.	0.5776871971514603
In patients, who were recently diagnosed with ARVD, a significant shortening of the RR intervals before the onset of VT as an indication of an acceleration of the sinus rhythm was observed.	0.7518220485541937
This effect could not be observed in patients with a past medical history of AVRD.	0.7702359599228724
Late potentials were determined with a prevalence of 74% overall.	0.5667773472827504
Increasingly, late potentials were observed with morphologically diffuse forms of the ARVD.	0.6133014634411105
A correlation to the severity of spontaneous arrhythmias (ventricular, sustained or not sustained VT) could not be established.	0.5987622271594032
In comparison to the origin of VT in coronary heart disease, previous arrhythmias play a less important role in arrhymogenic right ventricular dysplasia cardiomyopathy.	0.5828606180610495
Most importantly, an intensified sympathetic tone before onset of VT and an increased prevalence of positive late potentials are observed.	0.5972697031377612

The results of our favored transfer of the trapezius muscle to compensate paralysis of the deltoid muscle will be presented.	0.6028650673316691
Preoperatively radiological, clinical and electromyographic examinations are necessary.	0.5706976175081899
Our results are based upon the clinical and radiological check ups and the subjective assessment of the patients.	0.8398826352225485
Thirty-one patients (7 female, 24 male) underwent a trapezius transfer between March 1994 and December 1996.	0.7350152986805832
The average age was 29 years (range 18-46 years).	0.7367900314766079
We performed the operations using a modification of Saha's technique.	0.3684068237758218
With the patient in lateral decubitus position and protection of the opposite plexus, a sagital skin incision is the first step, followed by the preparation of trapezius and deltoid muscle as well as the bony parts of the shoulder (acromion, clavicle, scapular spine).	0.7084742883975303
The deltoid origin is cut from the lateral third of the clavicle, the acromion and the lateral half of the scapular spine.	0.6367483662840578
The next step is transection of the root of the acromion and the lateral clavicle.	0.578550074718125
After elevation of the remaining trapezius insertions from the clavicle and scapular spine, the proximal humerus is exposured by splitting the partly detached deltoid muscle longitudinally.	0.5368740699489388
Then the acromion fragment and humerus are prepared for the bone-to-bone contact.	0.5210290638058865
In 90  ° of abduction the acromion fragment with its trapezius insertion is transferred and fixed to the humerus with two 4.5-mm screws.	0.6667647116809462
Finally the deltoid is sutured on the top of the trapezius and the skin is closed over two suction drains.	0.5124564134350164
Postoperatively we immobilize the operated arm in an abduction support for 6 weeks.	0.36583266430637407
The physiotherapy program starts on the first postoperative day with active training of elbow, hand and fingers and electrostimulation of the transferred trapezius muscle.	0.4902479514007502
Six weeks after the procedure we take an X-ray and start with progressive adduction of the arm.	0.7113913231606809
The preoperative subluxation of the humeral head was abolished in all cases.	0.4850956341956908
We achieved an average increase of active abduction from 7.3  ° (range 0-45  °) preoperatively to 39.2  ° (range 25  °-80  °) 1 year after the operation; the increase of forward flexion was from 20  ° (range 0  °-85  °) to 43  ° (range 20  °-90  °).	0.8720223397101968
All patients were satisfied with the improvement of stability and function of the operated shoulder.	0.7595588123245095
Finally we can conclude that the trapezius transfer for flail shoulder gives a satisfactory outcome regarding shoulder function and stability as well as the subjective situation of the patients.	0.5695846006957928
We analyzed psychiatric and criminological data from 103 arsonists.	0.2803623922548447
The following criticisms of the definition of pyromania according to DSM-III-R and IDC-10 seem appropriate.	0.44137363653819456
First, the categoric exclusion of aggressive motives does not seem very promising, since approximately one fourth of arsonists whose firesetting is based on motives quoted in DSM-III-R may also have an aggressive motive.	0.5622261389467659
Second, ICD-10 gives being drunk and alcoholism as a criterion for the exclusion of pyromania.	0.3736759878786838
This seems untenable, since the behavior classed as pyromania is largely a product of alcohol misuse.	0.484919140677704
Repeated firesetting, resulting from being fascinated by fire etc., may be less a disturbance of impulse control but rather the manifestation of a psychoinfantilism, which, supported by alcohol abuse, extends into older age.	0.6052605193799239
The mean age of such arsonists is slightly above 20 years.	0.49361237188708257
The tendency for relapses after imprisonment seems to be low; this tendency probably decreases spontaneously in older age.	0.5106897762785904
The mean age of arsonists with aggressive motives is a little below 30 years, those setting fire with suicidal motives have a mean age of 35, deluded arsonists have a mean age of 40 years.	0.6166242735443349
Concrete sexual motives are relatively rare.	0.27031603607104043
Approximately 50 % of arsonists have a purely aggressive motive.	0.5915438980505298
Retaliation is a rare cause, however, since most of them do not even know the victims.	0.7198831090762268
One third of these persons set the fire in their own homes.	0.49960644742217547
Most arsonists show a personality disorder, with insecurity and narcissism predominating.	0.5101284841529081
Data on firesetting are to be treated with caution, since two thirds of all cases are newer resolved; one fourth of cases concern minors, and in Central Europe arsonists with rational motives are hardly ever referred to psychiatrists.	0.7238373484558289

An in vitro investigation was performed to eval-uate the influence of topical corticosteroids and antihistamines on the ciliary beat frequency of human nasal mucosa.	0.5913598843400059

All tests were performed on cell cultures of human nasal mucosa during constant conditions.	0.48684466392411835
Three of the four nasal sprays tested contained benzalkonium chloride as preservative.	0.4246314102555243

The nasal spray containing budesonide was benzalkonium chloride-free and caused minor but fully reversible decreases in ciliary beat frequency after 20 min.	0.40038511975448815
As benzalkonium chloride can cause complete standstill of ciliary beat frequency in vitro in human nasal mucosa, we recommend that this preservative should not be used anymore in topical nasal medications.	0.596655661154818

The usual method of surgery for this is to lift the bladder neck towards cranial and ventral.	0.4897567075340784

However, the continence rate of the Stamey patients deteriorated after 6 weeks down to 78.3 % and after more than 2 years only 28.6 % of these patients were still completely continent (mean follow-up 40.4 mths), whereas deterioration in the Burch patients was only 87 % (mean follow-up 44.25 mths).	0.8382043998798363
The disappointing results with the Stamey technique did not correlate with the degree of initial continence.	0.48818031664048245

These concepts are considered to be one pathway by which the mechanisms to disease may occur.	0.5474232277403548
A short review of empirical findings and analytic approaches show the complexity of these mechanisms requiering further research not only because of analytic deficiences but also because of social change.	0.43832449087142805

It is well known that alterations to the oral cavity caused by dental prostheses may affect speech articulation, although influences on the voice are not assumed.	0.5874080184538524
In addition to the vocal fundamental frequency, vibrations of the vocal chords generate overtones.	0.5463267475435377
Through the shape of the larynx and the upper airway, resonances and antiresonances are formed, and in this way overtones are amplified to a variable extent.	0.7531232902609548
Nozzle changes caused by a dental prosthesis in the oral cavity may possibly influence overtones but influences on the vocal fundamental frequency seem unlikely.	0.46901394650397243
The influence of dental prostheses on the voice is demonstrated in a patient who owned two different dental prostheses.	0.7015175827714091
The fundamental frequency rose by up to five semitones during speech and his vocal range increased by up to four semitones when a thin denture was used instead of a normal denture.	0.45302898126771196
When the position of the mandible was checked by intraoral needle point placement, a more rostral position of the mandible was recorded with the thin denture than with the normal denture.	0.7220563293964676
Sagittal magnetic resonance tomography imaging also showed that the larynx was in a more cranial position.	0.5985499746892732
This change was presumed to be due to an upward movement of the larynx induced by the tongue, which itself was found to be in a more cranial position with the thin denture.	0.7218168489484799
In this situation, increased tension of the laryngeal muscles were believed to induce a rise in fundamental frequency, shifting the voice range toward higher frequencies.	0.5707128998598407
These findings show that dental prostheses can cause vocal changes in individual cases.	0.4067088598467656
The etiology of this occurrence is still not clear.	0.6459156156956614
Its consequences, however, should be known to the dentist, ENT surgeon and phoniatrist if patients notice changes in their voice after having altered or replaced their dentures.	0.4224457551444955
Cytokine blood levels are found to be moderately elevated in chronic heart failure, as a function of severity of disease.	0.699039642406212
The source of these cytokines and the trigger mechanisms stimulating cytokine release are a matter of intense research.	0.4434851394981843

It has its roots in the bio-psycho-social model of medicine developed by George Engel in the U.S.A. and it has a long tradition in the German psychosomatic medicine.	0.6217699575397014

The basic is a systemic view of illness and health.	0.482974073899284

In the ancient times, Aristotle, Herophilos, and Galen discovered basic anatomical structures.	0.41969025311641667
Paul von Aegina, in the seventh century a. c., had the idea of a nerve suture, which was first performed in an animal 1000 years later by the Italian surgeon Gabriele Ferrara.	0.7026524678329721
Systematic investigations on nerve crossing date to the beginning of the nineteenth century and were conducted by Jean Pierre Flourens.	0.38228760810727713
Within 1 week in summer 1864, two French surgeons (Laugier and Nélaton) independently carried out the first nerve sutures in humans.	0.41530455625253493
Their observations of an immediate functional recovery of the appropriate muscles after suturing were discussed controversially in scientific circles.	0.42946443874278223
Purpose: To analyze the value of electrophysiologic testing according to standards of the International Society for Clinical Electrophysiology of Vision (ISCEV) in infants less than 10 years of age.	0.6797630288068041
Aggressive angiomyxoma (AAM) is a tumor of the soft tissues predominantely occurring in the genital and pelvic area with a strong propensity to local recurrences.	0.6147556932952839
The entity was first described in 1983.	0.37912572442773124
The tumor is regarded as low-grade sarcoma by some authors; its cause and pathogenesis are presently unknown.	0.5917075871075526
This is a case report on a 27-year-old man who underwent 4 surgical procedures of the left lower extremity because of a recurrent soft tissue neoplasm, initially (August 1993) diagnosed as a myxolipoma.	0.7979992937559826
The patient suffered from recurrences in February 1995, September 1996 and February 1998.	0.4282497433981629
The diagnosis was revised at the time of the latest recurrence.	0.6605183921608421
A palliative resection with macroscopic residuals left was performed in February 1998, followed by a radiation therapy with 56 Gy total dose and a concomitant administration of the radiosensitizer razoxane per os.	0.5283801331308593
The single radiation doses were 200 cGy 5 times a week.	0.30002126739154267
The small residuals of the tumor obviously regressed although an objective response could not be shown because the lesion was not clearly measurable.	0.627465559380513
A follow-up 2 years after the radiation treatment revealed no recurrence.	0.6279095411799928
The time of the local control achieved as yet is already longer than any former time to regrowth between the surgical procedures.	0.6114501840552542
This is, to our knowledge, the first description of a therapeutic irradiation of a recurrent aggressive angiomyxoma.	0.832939079990468
Radiation therapy combined with the sensitizer razoxane is able to control a recurrent AAM for an unknown time.	0.4687524730839586
It remains open whether a radiation treatment alone would have had a similar effect.	0.4385675340440738
Micronervereconstruction of motor and sensitive nerves in the head and neck area today has an established range of indications.	0.48694095461589637
Surgical procedures of external and internal neurolyses, nerve coaptation and nerve transplantation techniques are well standardized.	0.46007406822214175
With microneurosurgery of motor nerves, satisfying or good results can be generally obtained.	0.4215122802387989
Success rates exceeding 50% following sensitive nerve reconstructions justify the performance of the procedures, more so because of the subjective improvements for the individual patient.	0.6786272412978805
Perspectives can be seen in further simplification of surgical methods of harvesting nerve grafts, e.g., by development of minimally invasive, eventually endoscopically guided procedures.	0.5459971316873947
Allogenic nerve grafts may also be applied.	0.5145736678101228

Objective: The acceptance of fibromyalgia as a disease entity and its definitive diagnosis have been hampered by a dearth of knowledge concerning the underlying pathophysiology of this disease and the lack of specific biochemical markers applicable to its diagnosis.	0.648730192403845
To determine whether abnormal collagen metabolism is a characteristic of fibromyalgia, we have analyzed collagen metabolites in the urine and serum of patients with fibromyalgia.	0.8103198157749855
Methods: The diagnosis of fibromyalgia was made according to the American College of Rheumatology criteria.	0.5850038591957083
Urine and serum were collected under standardized conditions from 39 patients and 55 age- and sex-matched controls.	0.6111388957032697
Pyridinoline (Pyd) and deoxypyridinoline (Dpyd), which represent products of lysyl oxidase-mediated cross-linking in collagen and are indicators of connective tissue and bone degradation, respectively, were analyzed by ion-paired and gradient HPLC method with fluorescence detection (HPLC).	0.5748875513266005
Levels of hydroxypyroline (Hyp), a collagen turnover marker, were also measured.	0.6131877437061001
The findings were related to creatinine levels and the Pyd/Dpyd ratio determined.	0.42588402816969484
The Pyd/Dpyd ratios in the urine and serum and the Hyp in the urine were significantly lower in patients with fibromyalgia than in healthy controls.	0.6043200180273758
Conclusion: Decreased levels of collagen cross-linking may contribute to remodeling of the extracellular matrix and collagen deposition around the nerve fibers in fibromyalgia and contribute to the lower pain threshold at the tender points.	0.4823014712421934
Analysis of altered collagen metabolism either by histologic examination on biopsy or, preferably, by HPLC analysis of collagen metabolites in urine or serum may aid to understand more about the pathogenesis of fibromyalgia.	0.5280587608583253
Background: The dynamic radionuclide nephrography (Tc99m-MAG3) is an important method in the evaluation of obstruction of the upper urinary tract.	0.7827384730290778
The aim of the present study was to assess whether radionuclid nephrography under standardized conditions with adequate hydration and Furosemid induced diuresis can reliably detect a significant obstruction at the pelvi-ureteric junction.	0.5216798001206343
We therefore tested whether minimal tracer washout (10-25%) in the presence of normal renal function could justity a non-operative managment.	0.6539297235754957
The lateral decubitus position is the standard position for nephrectomies.	0.5436519128824181
There is a lack of data about the effects of this extreme position upon respiratory mechanics and gas exchange.	0.5498881754153182
In 20 patients undergoing surgery in the nephrectomy position, we compared a new closed-loop-controlled ventilation algorithm, adaptive lung ventilation (ALV), which adapts the breathing pattern automatically, to the respiratory mechanics with conventionally controlled mandatory ventilation (CMV).	0.7239712125873604
The aims of our study were (1) to describe positioning effects on respiratory mechanics and gas exchange, (2) to compary ventilatory parameters selected by the ALV controller with traditional settings of CMV, and (3) to assess the individual adaptation of the ventilatory parameters by the ALV controller.	0.6878769987906805
The respirator used was a modified Amadeus ventilator, which is controlled by an external computer and possesses an integrated lung function analyzer.	0.5643505572109355
In a first set of measurements, we compared parameters of respiratory mechanics and gas exchange in the horizontal supine position and 20 min after changing to the nephrectomy position.	0.6710585573774865
In a second set of measurements, patients were ventilated with ALV and CMV using a randomized crossover design.	0.6216038179868697
The CMV settings were a tidal volume of 10 ml/kg body weight, a respiratory rate of 10 breaths/min, an I:E ratio of 1:1.5, and an end-inspiratory pause of 30% of inspiratory time.	0.7467588314815244
With both ventilation modes FiO2 was set to 0.5 and PEEP to 3 cm H2O.	0.6323272054004815
During ALV a desired alveolar ventilation of 70 ml/kg KG - min was preset.	0.5859677937583112
All other ventilatory parameters were determined by the ALV controller according to the instantaneously measured respiratory parameters.	0.5490828221966458
Positioning induced a reduction of compliance from 61.6 to 47.9 ml/cm H2O; the respiratory time constant shortened from 1.2 to 1.08 s, whereas physiological dead space increased from 158.9 to 207.5 ml.	0.7509930516064918
On average, the ventilatory parameters selected by the ALV controller resembled very closely those used with CMV.	0.4136663663035775
However, an adaptation to individual respiratory mechanics was clearly evident with ALV.	0.5042185003874473
In conclusion, we found that the effects of positioning for nephrectomy are minor and may give rise to problems only in patients with restrictive lung disease.	0.6900723619773109
The novel ALV controller automatically selects ventilatory parameters that are clinically sound and are better adapted to the respiratory mechanics of ventilated patients than the standardized settings of CMV are.	0.46542544639130523

described a new variant of perilymphatic fistula: the "superior canal dehiscence syndrome".	0.43325643560500116

The position of Freud is that of the basically traumatic character of human experience.	0.5415436612497424

This paper reports the results of the Austrian ultrasound hip screening program, in which all Austrian babies undergo hip sonography twice: at the birth clinic during the 1st week of life and at an age of 12-16 weeks.	0.7696938504567148
Data from all public health insurance companies since 1985 and all ICD data about children hospitalized because of CDH in Austria were collected and analyzed.	0.43796367948804615
The rate of sonographically pathological hips was 6.57 % (1994).	0.5718185294166712
The treatment rate before introduction of hip sonography was 13.16 % (1985).	0.6578371906680883
The rate of open reduction went down to 0.24 per 1000 newborns, including a high number of unscreened children born abroad and also children with teratological dislocation of the hip.	0.6207136150705719
Hip sonography screening proved to be effective in detecting true instability of the hip joint as well as dysplasia.	0.5935528204779712
The optimal time for sonographic screening does not seem to be immediately after birth when only "high risk" hips (clinical instability, positive family history, breech delivery) should undergo hip sonography, but at an age between 4 and 6 weeks when the hip has already shown its true nature.	0.6655118031065955
Since one sonographic scan appears to be sufficient for screening, a further reduction of costs could be accomplished.	0.6579224619125441

Clinical presentation and chest x-ray findings are non-characteristic.	0.4527614332279537

Introduction: Postoperative delirium is a common psychic disturbance occurring acutely after various surgical procedures and typically presenting with a fluctuating course.	0.6109000954409604
These patients' recovery takes longer.	0.2721747194770017
In this study we analyze the incidence of postoperative delirium in patients undergoing vascular surgery and try to identify risk factors for its development.	0.8066413612189153
Methods: Patients undergoing elective arterial operations were included.	0.5708208132698711
Their medical history, the specific vascular diagnosis and operation performed, the medication and laboratory data were monitored.	0.6794105149141252
Additionally the patients were preoperatively interviewed by a psychiatrist.	0.5691284704194262
Intraoperatively the drugs, infusions, possible transfusions, blood gases and pressures were monitored, as were the times of surgery and anesthesia.	0.7170430661055927
Postoperatively patients were seen daily by the psychiatrist and the surgeon for at least 7 days.	0.44825887655491353
Postoperative delirium was diagnosed according to DSM IV criteria, and mild, moderate and severe delirium were distinguished.	0.601041119626067
Results: Fifty-four patients entered the study.	0.4713701232562151
Twenty-one (38.9 %) developed postoperative delirium (11 mild, 2 moderate, 8 severe).	0.8270847859035741
Patients with aortic operations developed delirium more frequently than those with non-aortic procedures(55.5 vs 22.2 %, n = 27 each).	0.5840097471302875
Some preexisting diseases (hearing disturbance) increased the probability of postoperative delirium, while age was not identified as a risk factor.	0.6707155681092206
General psychopathological and depressive disturbances increased the likelihood of postoperative delirium.	0.3797289945393085
Patients who had a severe intraoperative course developed postoperative delirium more frequently.	0.5811365181916395
This was not seen in the absolute time of surgery or anesthesia nor in the intraoperative development of blood pressure or intraarterial gases, which did not differ between patients with and without postoperative delirium.	0.7215608097943814
More reliable parameters were an increased intraoperative need for crystalloid volume, intra - or postoperatively decreased hemoglobin values (Hb < 10 g/dl) and the development of acidosis that had to be treated.	0.8420288294488135
Patients with delirium had serious complications more often (8/21 = 38.1 % vs 6/33 = 18.2 %) and needed Intensive Care treatment longer (2.7 vs 2.1 days, only aortic surgery 3.2 vs 2.4 days).	0.8528128979264253
Conclusions: Postoperative delirium after vascular surgery is frequent.	0.4997613724659447
Patients undergoing aortic surgery, with specific concomittant medical disease, psychopathological disturbances and a severe intraoperative course, are at risk of developing postoperative delirium.	0.6556338819411137

The perspectives for active hearing implants lie in the treatment of patients with sensorineural hearing loss (SNHL).	0.4316706293291748
The majority of patients with SNHL suffer from a cochlea amplifier (CA) failure which is discernible by a positive recruitment and loss of otoacoustic emissions (OAE).	0.5029639799169914
Therefore, the electronic implant is expected to partially replace functions of the CA.	0.6179242359193955
Thus, the implant is thought to function as a CAI (cochlea amplifier implant).	0.6211845938283894

Juvenile myoclonic epilepsy (JME) was de-scribed electroclinically by Janz and Christian in 1957 and consists of myoclonic jerks in  varying combination with the absence of seizures and generalized tonic-clonic seizures, a typical circadian distribution on awakening, sleep deprivation, alcohol consumption and flickering stimuli as characteristic precipitating factors, typical EEG abnormalities with generalized epileptiform discharges, normal physical and neuroradiological findings, and often a family history of epilepsy.	0.5361429849087437
Although the misdiagnosis of this well-classified and easily treatable syndrome is supposed to occur rarely in Germany, we retrospectively investigated how often the wrong initial classification had been made among patients who were finally treated in our outpatient epilepsy unit.	0.6118852931618487

In all patients, localization-related epilepsy had been classified, although regional EEG abnormalities were rare (n=5).	0.5503186472257318

The present study was performed to investigate mortality and complications in multiple trauma patients aged 65 years or more.	0.8074848193829055

Older patients were injured as pedestrians in most cases (69%), while younger patients were more frequently injured as car and drivers passengers (41%).	0.6036430075188769
ISS was comparable in both groups (Y 28 +/- 1, O 27 +/- 1).	0.8475444342363896
During ICU-therapy incidence of ARDS (Y 10%, O 11%), multiple organ dysfunction syndrome (MOF; Y 6%, O 9%) and pneumonia (Y 17%, O 21%) were comparable.	0.7429508517227499
In contrast, septic complications were more frequent in older patients (Y 19%, O 27%).	0.6958839078839536
Length of ICU stay (Y 19 +/- 2, O 18 +/- 1) and ventilation time (Y 14 +/- 2, O 17 +/- 1) were comparable.	0.8347737146602603
Mortality was significantly higher in older patients (Y 15%, O 53%).	0.6797976804011275

It is caused by dysregulation of the vascular tone between vasocontrictive and vasodilatory influences.	0.452788479200888
Early damage to the vascular endothelium and the activation of platelets lead to the release of vasoactive substances.	0.5682944094752964

Due to the limited efficacy of drug therapy in atrial fibrillation and the high rate of recurrence, strong efforts were made to find non-pharmacological strategies.	0.6854943999126138
For three years now, the implantable atrial defibrillator Metrix from InControl has been available as an alternative therapy.	0.5906953940881698
From October 1995 to the present the atrial defibrillator was implanted in 179 patients worldwide.	0.5317465820803273
The sensitivity of the system and its algorithms to detect atrial fibrillation is 90%; the specifity to detect sinus rhythm is 100%.	0.6769960379479184
In 121 of 179 patients, 748 episodes of spontaneous atrial fibrillation were treated with 2.4 shocks per episode.	0.5746353699018694
No proarrhythmic event or stroke was seen.	0.16806579593692023
A cardioversion to sinus rhythm could be achieved in 95% of patients; the overall clinical success rate was 88%.	0.8285795736586613
In 7% of all patients, early recurrence of atrial fibrillation (ERAF) occurred that could not be converted into stable sinus rhythm after further cardioversions and antiarrhythmic therapy.	0.6979410885818971
In 4.1% there were lead-related complications, in 4 patients the device had to be explanted because of ineffective therapy, and in 3 patients the device had to be changed because of loss of telemetry or early depletion of battery.	0.7343150110066446
In 8 patients, postoperative complications were seen (infections, pneumothorax and thrombosis of the subclavian vein).	0.7173207216578009
Overall, the implantable atrial defibrillator Metrix is an effective and safe alternative in treating atrial fibrillation.	0.7362205570632514

The somatosensory system of preterms and newborns differs substantially from adults.	0.2968986143420146
These differences are of considerable preclinical and clinical interest.	0.38382193302503964
Maturation of A- and C-fibre synaptic connections in the dorsal horn and development of descending inhibition from the brainstem all take place postnatally in the rat.	0.5730739035866714
In early stages of development there is no definite spatial sepraration in the dorsal horn between the nociceptive and the non-nociceptive system.	0.6069495372435447
In preterms but not in adults non-noxious stimuli can induce central sensitization.	0.4034620280759446
Many neurotransmitters and signalling molecules involved in pain pathways are expressed early in the developing nervous system but do not reach adult levels for a considerable period.	0.41153212481101037
More important, receptors are frequently transiently overexpressed or expressed in areas during development where they are not seen in the adult and may have a different functional profile.	0.5686133127368929
The descending pain inhibitory system that provides an important protection against central sensitization developes later than the ascending nociceptive system.	0.4012448314884872
Thus, during a critical period of time the immature nociceptive system is highly vulnerable.	0.752408481412373
For example, neonatal circumcision in the absence of analgesia results in increased pain responses during subsequent routine vaccination months later.	0.3628716392421178

In 27 cases closure of the ECA, CCA or ECA and STA was carried out as an emergency procedure for acute hemorrhage following completed primary treatment (operation, primary or postoperative radiation or radiochemotherapy).	0.5873377933992155
There was no postoperative hemorrhage after prophylactic ligature of the ECA.	0.5262505156975629

In addition there were much less unfavourable courses in the sequence of prophylactic closure of the ECA than observed after ligating the CCA or ECA and STA in an emergency situation.	0.5258992719506895

During the past decade, the molecular mechanisms in the process of tumor progression, including metastasis and angiogenesis, have become better understood.	0.8171882602668753
Cancer metastasis consists of multiple, complex interacting steps.	0.3985616836241244
Each of these steps is crucial and limiting, since a failure to complete any one prevents the tumor cell from producing a metastasis.	0.5463251806156715
Detachment from the solid tumor by loosening the intercellular junctions and proteolysis of the extracellular matrix enables tumor cells to enter blood- and lymph vessels.	0.4787393045504763
The intravasation into the circulation is supported by the secretion of angiogenic factors, which induce degradation of the basal membran in blood vessels.	0.6227834518213443
Adhesion to endothelial cells, extravasation from the circulation, and induction of angiogenesis are further essential steps for completing the metastatic process.	0.48127549132829517
Furthermore, it is well known that once a tumor cell has entered circulation, it will survive only by evasion of the immune system.	0.6604866581349039
The systematic identification of tumor antigens opens up new possibilities for immunotherapeutic approaches.	0.31020169648510665

The patient had no complaints apart from excessive daytime sleepiness.	0.5480774701254331

We report a truck driver with severe soft tissue contusion of both legs who developed atypical heparin-induced thrombocytopenia (HIT) after a thrombosis prophylaxis with unfractionated heparin; despite a thrombosis the patient showed a systemic allergic reaction to heparin in combination with elevation of thrombocytes and positive heparin-dependent antibodies.	0.6177185613190783
Six days after the initial trauma deep vein thrombosis of the left lower leg was diagnosed and fasciotomy was performed, preventing an imminent compartment syndrome.	0.7211130899579643
Another 5 days later the patient developed exanthema of the trunk and upper extremities and urticaria on his face, as well as severe headache.	0.6739388666825876
His platelet count increased from 134 000/µl to 258 000/µl.	0.31942262449574665
After exclusion of other causes for these symptoms, a reaction to heparin-dependent antibodies (heparin-platelet-factor 4 complex) was demonstrated 2 days later.	0.696869856962512
Thrombosis prophylaxis was changed to hirudin (Refludan) and elevation of thrombocytes to 445 000/µl was noted.	0.49465726022735795
Shortly after rinsing of an intravenous line with less than 50 IE unfractionated heparin at day 36 after trauma the patient developed an anaphylactic shock, which could be managed with cortisone.	0.6416012054101655
We suggest that in HIT the thrombocytopenia may represent only one form of an allergic reaction to heparin.	0.5261633861029067
The cause of the thrombembolic event is an antigen-antibody reaction to heparin taking place on the surface of the thrombocyte.	0.5706047580540851
This is similar in all forms of systemic reaction to heparin application, even though the symptoms may vary.	0.7097962289016939
As thrombocytopenia may not be the main symptom of a heparin-induced antibody reaction - in our hospital only 5 of 10 patients with HIT - the disease should rather be named "heparin allergy".	0.8516697514599698
We suggest a new classification of different pattern of heparin allergy types I-IV.	0.5416427380700186
The new types I and II are similar to HIT types I and II.	0.45900913204816773
Type III is the reaction of antibodies without decrease of thrombocytes, and type IV the reaction of antibodies associated with systemic allergic symptoms.	0.5570011740129192

One patient did not want the laparoscopic technique.	0.3895466973430075

Median operative time was 114 (65-180) min.	0.6084661669976918
With the exception of three wound infections no immediate postoperative complications were noticed.	0.4281718414842324

One patient developed later a clinically significant anastomotic stricture which needed endoscopic dilatation.	0.4158826393288183

Postoperative morbidity is low, duration of hospitalisation short, convalescence fast.	0.449138798376153

Recently, two new halogenated volatile anaesthetics, sevoflurane and desflurane, have been approved for clinical use in Germany.	0.7274367298967291
Their low solubility in blood is the most important common property, and this represents the most obvious difference from the inhalational anaesthetics currently used.	0.6873427148752043
Extensive clinical and experimental evaluations have confirmed the superior pharmacokinetic properties predicted.	0.45686407601095974
Both sevoflurane and desflurane provide more rapid emergence from anaesthesia, permit easier titration of the anaesthetic dose during maintenance and offer more rapid recovery from anaesthesia.	0.3917662669090129
For sevoflurane, there are additional advantages: a pleasant odor, negligible airway irritation, and excellent pharmacodynamic characteristics that even provide cardiovascular stability comparable to isoflurane.	0.556093411618432
A certain disadvantage and source of potential nephrotoxicity result from the metabolism of sevoflurane (2-5%) to anorganic fluoride and degradation to compound A in carbon dioxide absorbents.	0.6324268444844698
The extensive clinical data reported to date have revealed no evidence that sevoflurane has adverse renal effects.	0.5823595097976464
New insight into the pathomechanism of nephrotoxicity associated with either production of fluoride or compound A may well support clinical experience.	0.38839853503442967
Desflurane strongly resists in vivo metabolism and because of this it appears to be devoid of toxicity.	0.38724956162182717
Nevertheless, potential side-effects may result from degradation in dry absorbents and subsequent release of CO, from its extreme pungency and irritating airway effects.	0.5212133928671012
Thus, desflurane is not recommended for induction of anaesthesia, especially in children.	0.7089441037236658

The doctor in charge, who is generally the medical director, is liable if patients suffer harm through organizational faults within his or her department.	0.5628312275609609
Even the suspicion that an error has arisen as the result of defective organization is enough for the person responsible - that is to say the medical director - to be liable.	0.7018060445544623
For this reason, the doctor in charge must be in a position to recognize structural defects in organization and to correct these by means of staff training.	0.5725840444275915
Every training measure must guarantee specialist standards; this means that the work of doctors with no specialist training and those still in training and working under supervision is guaranteed to be of the same standard and performed with the same degree of meticulous care as that of a qualified specialist.	0.661233396899852
A legally valid consent from the patient and documentation of the patient information must be accessible at all times.	0.7097317269780858
Operations carried out by doctors in training must be supervised by a qualified specialist; otherwise the doctor in charge is guilty of a defect in organization.	0.4919928775971693

There must be no friction when cooperation with other disciplines concerned is needed.	0.33443397953915976
Each sector must know its own area of responsibility.	0.25762603767863823

Uniform guidelines will make it possible for the medical director to train his/her staff and prevent systematic organizational defects.	0.48882372915417044

In a period of 4 years between March 1994 and March 1998, 143 patients with gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) underwent laparoscopic antireflux surgery.	0.5610019853424344
According to manometric studies 76 patients had a short-floppy Nissen fundoplication, patients with impaired motility or paraesophageal hernias received a hemifundoplication (Toupet = 42, Dor/Thal = 25).	0.49328527075183703
Recurrent reflux symptoms appeared in 6,3 % after mean 16,7 months follow-up (Nissen = 2.6 %, Toupet = 2.3 %, Dor/Thal = 24 %, P < 0.01).	0.5916150987894329
Persistent dysphagia with reoperation occurred in 2.1 % (Nissen = 2.6 %, Toupet = 2.3 %, Dor/Thal = 0 %, n. s.).	0.6220199432205421
The assessment of Visick's score at the latest control showed the following: Visick I = 63.6 %, Visick II = 30.1 %, Visick III = 6.3 %, Visick IV = 0 %.	0.5686301127804932
The outcome of the operation was rated "excellent" or "good" by 91.6 % of the patients.	0.7076159189458867
In contrast to auditory brainstem potentials (ABR), a more apically defined generation of middle latency evoked potentials (MLR) can be assumed due to the longer integration time present.	0.6139492017948903
To date, the effect of stimulus frequency spectra on MLR has not been completely known.	0.5152854698463419
By using masking with high-pass filtered white noise in 12 normal-hearing adults, we measured the dependence of amplitude and latency of ABR and MLR on filter frequency.	0.5458119729522749
No differences were found between the masking effects for ABR and MLR evoked by tone bursts of 0.5 and 2 kHz.	0.6814555081652002
The high-pass masking of click stimuli showed a greater influence on the amplitude and latency of the ABR than on MLR.	0.6038531850272569
These different qualities have to be considered clinically when evaluating the methods and results of hearing testing with acoustic evoked potentials.	0.6445749585824709
Our findings show that MLR evoked by tone bursts should be used for the frequency selective diagnosis of hearing thresholds, especially in low- frequency ranges.	0.6903369707366573
Objectives: To clarify the incidence of sudden arrythmic death and associated risk factors in patients after orthotopic heart transplantation (HTx).	0.6569806286935593
Background: Some reports indicate a significant rate of sudden death in heart transplant recipients limiting long-term success of the operation.	0.7137155475014626
Incidence, underlying risk factors, etiologies, and methods for prediction or prevention of sudden death are poorly defined.	0.5658556090435187
Methods: Retrospective analysis of our cohort of 120 cardiac allograft recipients surviving the perioperative phase out of a total of 142HTx patients of the years 1984-1999.	0.5593937135129866
Clinical events (death, mode of death, Re-HTx, resuscitation) were noted and analyzed by the Kaplan-Meier method and related to the patients' characteristics by multivariate analysis.	0.7142239074509767
Sudden death in or out of hospital was defined as death within one hour of symptoms or unwittnessed death.	0.560782578804516
Clinical and postmortem findings (autopsies are available in 12/18 sudden death patients) were correlated to the mode of death.	0.6598328549145346
Results: During a mean follow-up interval of 4.6 +/- 3.5 years, 45 patients died (38%).	0.8806589181044091
The mode of death was non-sudden in 27 inpatients.	0.5513616593673394
18 deaths were sudden, 14 of these out of hospital.	0.48892637412700257
In addition there were three cardiac arrests with successful resuscitations, one of those patients died three month later suddenly, giving a number of a total of 21 cardiac arrests in 20HTx patients.	0.6154362232331788
The actuarial risk of cardiac arrest was 20% after 6 and 40% after 12 years.	0.9062455259001749
Based on postmortem analysis the etiologies of the events were attributed to transplant vasculopathy in 15 patients, rejection in 5 patients (International Society for Heart and Lung Transplantation grade >3A), and to unknown reasons in one.	0.6097078767723744
All three patients successfully resuscitated from cardiac arrest had documented bradycardic events (2xtotal AV block, 1xsinus arrest).	0.3629333348587968
Pacemakers were implanted in these patients.	0.39311405678184
One of those died suddenly 2 months later.	0.4545930094356603
Significantly more HTx patients dying suddenly are smokers, had a lower left ventricular ejection fraction, and worse hemodynamics.	0.5867001555941386
QRS width and PR interval were significantly broadened in patients with transplant vasculopathy and cardiac arrest.	0.38463418909762553
In three cases, a decrease in heart rate variability, the occurence of sustained VT, and ST segment depressions prior to the cardiac arrest could be demonstrated.	0.7347492201070436
Conclusions: Sudden death occurs at a substantial rate after HTx.	0.4148625109846369
As HTx patient numbers are rising constantly, sudden cardiac death in this population will represent a significant problem.	0.5688198980204044
In our patients about 75% of the arrests can be attributed to graft-vasculopathy and one quarter to acute rejection.	0.5946469197283941
Diagnostic strategies have to be developed to detect patients at risk.	0.6412523372081319
Interestingly, some events may be caused from bradyarrhythmic rhythm disturbances.	0.553564005949413

The desmoplastic type of the squamous cell carcinoma (DSCC) of the skin is an entity which is readily distinguished by light microscopy.	0.730982958887369
The DSCC has fine branches surrounded by a desmoplastic stroma and shows in some cases typical perineural, perivascular and widespread intradermal invasion (maximum 6 cm!).	0.46075816386112595
This type accounts for 8.2% (n=44) of our collective of 594 squamous cell carcinomas (SCC) of the skin and vermilion border.	0.7678285004973372
Clinically DSCC look like other malignant epithelial tumors of the skin.	0.5069336530537996
All tumors were followed up for at least 3 years (maximum 10 years).	0.689598006173791
The local recurrence rate was high (24.3%) even though micrographic surgery was carried out.	0.7683050279861579
The rate of local or regional metastasis was also very high (22.7%).	0.6604697040121532
In comparison the recurrence rate and the rate of metatasis of the remaining common 91.8% SCC's (n=550) was low: 2.6% and 3.8%, respectively.	0.7566303490263664
The DSCC seems to be identical with the so called neurotropic SCC, the fine stranded SCC or the SCC with perineural invasion which have a high rate of local recurrence and metastasis as well, but DSCC is a better generic histopathologic term for the entire group.	0.5918026573458638
The DSCC is best treated with micrographic surgery and wider safety margins than any other type and should be followed up very frequently.	0.524156619357883

Extracorporeal photophoresis (ECP), a therapeutic modality that has been under investigation for some years, is based on separation of a leucocyte/lymphocyte-enriched cell fraction from the peripheral blood, extracorporeal treatment of the cells with 8-MOP/UVA and subsequent reinfusion of the cells in the patient.	0.7166372702265161
Its main effects seem to consist in changes to the immunologic behaviour of the photoinactivated/modulated cells.	0.3751726667713251
The immune response of the host is obviously stimulated by this treatment.	0.497662120733544
ECP is normally performed for 4 h per day on 2 consecutive days every 4 weeks.	0.4566381479116277
The treatment is well tolerated and causes few side effects.	0.6184003328446521

These patients included 21 with cutaneous T-cell lymphoma (CTCL), 10 with progressive systemic scleroderma, 4 with chronic graft-versus-host disease and 1 each with pemphigus vulgaris, epidermolysis bullosa acquisita, lupus erythematosus and cutaneous mucinosis.	0.5371074233963561
Patients with erythroderma and preserved immunocompetence achieved the best responses of all patients with CTCL.	0.5756128218006743
A treatment combining ECP with rlFN-, PUVA and/or radiation was also successful in patients with tumour-stage CTCL and lymph node involvement.	0.5207395683710971
Progressive systemic scleroderma responded in more than 50% of our cases.	0.7238201415108436

Hemangiomas of the skull base are rare neoplasms and are easily misdiagnosed as acoustic neuromas when occurring in the internal auditory canal.	0.5773928704495267
Among these tumors, ossifying hemangiomas are characterized histologically be newly formed bone tissue within their substance.	0.32892585363175203
We describe a 26-year old female patient who presented with left-sided sensorineural hearing loss and tinnitus.	0.7532385164658671
T2-weighted magnetic resonance imaging demonstrated a bright space-occupying lesion of the internal auditory canal with extension to the geniculate ganglion.	0.5306550485452367
Bony erosions of the internal auditory canal were proved by high-resolution computed tomography.	0.5862912475994749
A hemangioma was suspected preoperatively and was resected via a middle cranial fossa approach.	0.40961775371909237
Histologically, new bone formations were found in a cavernous hemangioma.	0.788050295375174
In general, radiologic findings can suggest a hemangioma of the internal auditory canal and help to differentiate it from acoustic neuroma.	0.477542559981666
Based on the histological findings of intratumoral bone formation, the hemangioma in our patient was classified as an ossifying hemangioma.	0.7224438834401394

Myocardial ischemia results in myocardial dysfunction.	0.31134621524404305
Recovery may be delayed ("stunning"), or persistent if perfusion remains reduced ("hibernation") and ischemia may go on to necrosis, thus, contributing to chronic heart failure.	0.63067998690338
In addition, myocardium not directly affected by ischemia may undergo adaptive processes like hypertrophy and dilatation, which may result in chronic left heart failure.	0.5916982570683877
This process is characterized by hemodynamic, neurohumoral, and progressive morphologic changes of the heart which are closely interrelated.	0.6459055164210856
Hemodynamic changes basically consist of an increase in left ventricular filling pressure and a decrease in global ejection fraction, and, in most cases years after myocardial infarction, in an increase in systemic vascular resistance and right atrial pressure.	0.7257768709179577
Neurohumoral changes consist of an increase in plasma catecholamines, atrial natriuretic factor and vasopressin, and in an activation of the renin-angiotensin-system.	0.6828134146103991
Plasma endothelin-1 was recently reported to be increased in patients with heart failure, and prognosis was related to endothelin levels.	0.6148399305036218
Diminished response of vessels to endothelium (EDRF/NO) dependent vasodilatation suggests impairment of vascular endothelium in heart failure.	0.4170036705915237
Local changes of cardiac neurohumoral systems could contribute to structural changes of the heart, e.g., systemic activation to hemodynamic changes.	0.5921437369382404
Structural changes of the heart are characterized by an increase in volume and thickness of surviving myocardium and an expansion of ischemic and necrotic myocardium.	0.6324494663016413
Molecular control of these processes which include various cell types, such as cardiomyocytes and cardiofibroblasts, are currently an issue of intense research and could result in specific therapeutic importance.	0.5005191731459723
Postoperative infection in the locomotor system may lead to malpractice suits.	0.4191917594501881
The aim of the study was to determine the success rate of these claims and the type of expert-confirmed medical negligence so that strategies for avoiding such negligence can be offered.	0.5895490808732213
A total of 261 decrees concerning suspected malpractice after postoperative infection in the locomotor system were retrospectively evaluated.	0.399133028294581
Of these, 43.7 % claims were successful.	0.5552707911721916
The most frequent type of negligence was late diagnosis (34.2 %), followed by inconsistant treatment (27.2 %) and insufficient surgical revision (5.3 %).	0.7305146251646627
In 33.3 %, combined types of negligence were found.	0.5629752560103429
Most frequently, negligence was suspected after infection following hand surgery and internal fixation of long bones.	0.5434379335940323
The highest success rate of claims was seen after puncture of joints (69.2 %).	0.5798904953513587
Insufficient documentation was confirmed in 15.3 %.	0.4620525486281149

Abstract   Patient satisfaction plays an increasing part in the analysis of the outcome of medical treatment.	0.7949830401966004
The aim of the study was to compare health-related quality of life in patients with abdominal aortic aneurysm after endovascular or conventional surgery.	0.7561056559738011
A total of 40 patients were included (20 treated by endovascular and 20 by conventional surgery).	0.7257174398342142
A questionnaire with 28 items similar to the SF-36 was answered during scheduled appointments.	0.4783172632665348
On the third postoperative day, the conventionally treated patients were more frequently confined to bed (80% vs. 32%) and complained of intervention-related pain (90% vs. 42%) and incisional pain (26% vs. 15%); 55% of the patients suffered from obstipation (vs. 5% of the endovascular group).	0.7331601161843093
Furthermore, the preoperative psychological stress seemed to be intensified.	0.6269565021921555
In comparable percentage, both the endovascular and conventionally treated patients were limited in social activities perioperatively.	0.5307014970084822
Sexual dysfunction was more frequent in the conventional group (33% vs. 13% three months postoperative).	0.6494846908651218
In addition, the conventionally treated patients were more limited in their physical activities (25% vs. 40%) and had more fear of ambulation (35% vs. 6%).	0.6441224034133995
The patients treated by an endovascular approach complained about frequent examinations (39% vs. 5%) that were often related to X-ray exposure (67% vs. 20%).	0.6838377836348005
All of the conventionally operated patients had a sense of improvement (vs. 89% of the endovascular group); nevertheless only 28% felt completely healthy, compared to 11% of the endovascular treated patients.	0.68264990142817
Advantages of the endovascular treated patients were "short hospital stay", "decreased pain", "smaller scars", and a "shorter confinement to bed".	0.781025468289527
After intervention the conventionally treated patients were more limited in almost all quality-of-life aspects.	0.5255519260461669
After 3 months, differences between the groups decreased except for sexual dysfunction and limited physical activities.	0.5919625786540855
The patients treated by endovascular surgery complained more about frequent X-ray examinations than the conventionally treated group.	0.5539904943543927
