Hemoglobin solutions and fluorocarbon emulsions are evaluated as artificial oxygen carriers.	0.32201510765506697
The efficacy of hemoglobin solutions with respect to O2 transport and especially the effective O2 release to tissues has been demonstrated in a number of situations, such as extreme hemodilution and hemorrhagic shock.	0.5502082544189629
The hemoglobin molecule could be stabilized by genetic and chemical modifications.	0.36895231350798574
This results in a clinically utilizable intravascular half-life of about 8-24 h, an adequate O2 affinity, and a lack of nephrotoxicity.	0.8251059884611825
A degree of vasoconstriction must be mentioned as the persistent side effect of the hemoglobin solutions evaluated here.	0.5051438745009977
In spite of this, hemoglobin solutions are also well tolerated in humans.	0.5673772101596526

The capacity for the release of O2 to the tissues is especially excellent.	0.44803953004916686
This was demonstrated under extreme hemodilution, during extracorporeal circulation and also under reanimation.	0.5302250854275066

The rigidity of varicose veins was higher than that of normal veins; there was no difference between the varicose vein above a competent valve and the "normal" vein below this competent valve.	0.5664584528994202
The matrix proteins demonstrated an increase in total fibres, whereas the elastic fibres were reduced and fragmented, explained the rigidity of varices.	0.5830475582391854

Guanine nucleotide-binding proteins (G proteins) function as transducers of information across the cell membrane by coupling receptors to effectors.	0.516025365173814
A large number of G protein-linked receptors funnel extra-cellular signals as diverse as hormones, growth factors, neurotransmitters, and primary sensory stimuli through a set of G proteins to a small number of second-messenger systems.	0.4746529938934189
The G proteins act as molecular switches with an "on" and "off" state governed by a GTPase cycle.	0.5818131084981478
By virtue of its high affinity and specificity for guanine nucleotide binding and its intrinsic GTPase activity, the -subunit of the G protein (G) plays the critical role in regulation of the effectors by their corresponding G protein.	0.5859648101964514
Mutations of G may result in either constitutive activation or loss of expression mutations.	0.39229126228543393
Given the variety of functions subserved by G protein-coupled signal transduction, it is not surprising that abnormalities in G protein-coupled pathways can lead to diseases with manifestations as dissimilar as blindness, hormone resistance, precocious puberty and neoplasia.	0.4936264846555329
For a given defect in a G protein-coupled pathway, the extent of the manifestations will also be determined by the cellular distribution of the affected component.	0.7475356835818406
Defects in components expressed exclusively in a single cell type will cause more a focal disorder than defects in a widely expressed component, particularly in germline mutations (e.g., Albright's hereditary osteodystrophy), whereas somatic mutations of genes encoding even an ubiquitously expressed component can cause focal disease when the somatic mutation itself is focal (e.g., McCune-Albright syndrome).	0.45157471284962875

Reperfusion injury has become a scientific problem of increasing importance, in part because of recent developments of thrombolytic therapy.	0.7027616351079119
The mechanisms of reperfusion injury following focal cerebral ischemia, however, are not known in detail.	0.6869440795063373
Recent studies strongly suggest that reactive oxygen species (ROS) and calcium overload play an important role in reperfusion injury and that pharmacological interventions against calcium- or free radical-mediated damage could extend the therapeutic window in cerebral ischemia/reperfusion.	0.553450939665205
The mediators involved are known to induce a mitochondrial permeability transition (PT) during the reperfusion period, which is associated with uncoupling of mitochondrial respiration, loss of mitochondrial membrane potential, and a burst production of ROS, leading to cellular death.	0.665689436846243
The mitochondrial PT is considered to be a key process in reperfusion injury following cerebral ischemia, as also observed in other organs such as heart and liver.	0.6812763210202833

25 of 27 patients with SCCH showed a characteristic high bullhorn-like uptake of the sternocostoclavicular region with the manubrium sterni representing the skull and the inflamed sternocostoclavicular joints corresponding to the horns (=bullhorn-sign).	0.4352028644839968

PADAM stands for partial androgen deficiency in the aging male, and it is currently diagnosed with a testosterone level below 3 ng/ml (300 ng/dl or 12 nmol/l), and with symptoms varying according to the individual.	0.6785353046513519
The symptoms are a reduction or even loss of libido, a decline in muscle mass and strength, enhancement of visceral fatty tissue-padding, dryness of the skin, apathy, tiredness and distortion of mood right up to depression, and ostalgia due to osteoporosis.	0.5416709628111191

In the adjacent keratinocytes large melanosomes did not aggregate into complexes.	0.3468604813659086

Results: Preoperatively, we found a low general GIQLI score (mean 92.7 points), which increased 6 weeks postoperatively (116.8 points), 3 months (124.8) and 1 year (mean 123.9 points) significantly and is now comparable to the healthy population (122.6 points).	0.840981626679193

Methods: We report our experience in the diagnosis and surgical treatment of 12 patients with these tumors.	1.058676192457606
Results: Between October 1993 and December 1998, 41 patients with cystic tumors of the pancreas underwent surgical resection; in 12 cases (11 women, 1 man) a serous cystadenoma (10 micrcocystic, 2 oligomacrocystic) was found.	0.861158350166675
Only 6 (50 %) patients had symptoms.	0.849372984609189
The mean tumor size was 4.8 (2.7-10) cm.	0.9685603087175311
Ultrasound, CT and MRT usually could detect the mass, but differentiation with other cystic lesions was not reliable.	0.6528121242712747
All tumors were resected: 4 Whipple procedures, 7 distal pancreatectomies and 1 segmental resection were performed.	0.48850784589771123
No patient died after surgery and none had to be reoperated on.	0.5306131843879386
Conclusions: Because of the difficulty in reliably differentiating benign and malignant lesions of the pancreas, we believe that cystic tumors of the pancreas should be resected.	0.7454881207356848
We examined the prevalence of HIV-associated cutaneous disorders as well as the frequency and efficiency of UV-radiation in HIV-infected patients by evaluating the clinical records of 1310 patients seen between and 1994 and 1996.	0.7123430772755945
41 patients were treated with UVB-radiation and 4 patients with UVA1-radiation, while three patients received PUVA-therapy.	0.6524286480790628
UV-radiation proved to be efficient and safe in the treatment of pruritic papular eruption, atopic dermatitis and psoriasis.	0.5270074481977044
Although some in vitro studies and studies with transgenic mice have suggested a negative impact of UV radiation on the immunosystem of HIV-positive patients, no progression of the HIV infection due to phototherapy has been proven.	0.6370792628354297
The staff at interventional radiological procedures is exposed to high levels of ionizing radiation.	0.4373399557754509
This applies especially to measures at cardiac catheterization laboratories.	0.2860742847407458
In this study the annual radiation exposure to the staff was estimated by measuring the dose rate under characteristic conditions.	0.6474046809302275
It could be shown that the resulting radiation exposure was strongly dependent on the radiation protection measures and is also dependent on the operation conditions of the x-ray tube.	0.6947466756077382
The effective dose for the physician wearing a lead apron and thyroid shield was detremined to about 1.7 mSva.	0.5467902976272093
Without a thyroid shield an effective dose of about 3.5 mSva resulted.	0.5522192615532063
This corresponds to approximately the natural background radiation of about 2.4 mSva in the Federal Republic of Germany.	0.5054344500448607
From the number of procedures performed we could derive an effective dose of approximately 1-2 µSv per application for the physician, averaged over all types of procedures.	0.5718005077850326
Further, it could be shown that the readings of the film badges, usually worn by the staff, underestimate the effective dose by approximately a factor of two.	0.6491972824388581
This is because the film badges do not include the contribution of the unshielded parts of the body to effective dose.	0.6000649060754226
From the estimated annual effective dose, a lifetime dose of 68 mSv was estimated for a 40-year working career.	0.5009989746013035
The corresponding lifetime risk for induced fatal cancer due to radiation exposure was determined to 0.3% applying the ICRP risk factor of 4  -  10-2 Sv-1.	0.6455614327116097
Considering the NCRP recommendations for a safe occupation, working in a cardiac catheterization laboratory can be considered as safe when applying all radiation protection measures.	0.5863702917276157
However, changing the protection measures and modifying the parameters of the x-ray-tube can lead to strong changes of the radiation exposure and the resulting risk estimation.	0.6873036988538317
Treatment of pulmonary hypertension is an important issue in intensive care.	0.6902364138750317
One therapeutic regimen involves the intravenous administration of prostacyclin (PGI2).	0.3034574906538623
This, however, is accompanied by diminished hypoxic pulmonary vasoconstriction, reduced arterial oxygenation, and systemic vasodilation.	0.6794786772732505
Thus, its clinical usefulness is limited.	0.5868333544073427
However, the inhalation of vasodilators such as nitric oxide (NO) or nebulized PGI2 causes a selective pulmonary vasodilation in ventilated alveoli and improved gas exchange, without any systemic vasodilation.	0.5658256567327432
It has therefore gained importance for the treatment of pulmonary failure associated with high shunt fractions.	0.6479892971280934
However, the inhalation of vasodilators may have adverse effects: in the case of NO, toxic side effects are predominant (MetHb, NOx), whereas in the case of PGI2, technical problems in terms of dosing and administration safety are of major interest.	0.6688643582659726
Furthermore, some patients do not respond to the treatment.	0.7224924385630378
In some individuals a reduction in pulmonary hypertension can be seen, while others lack even pulmonary vasodilation.	0.6182578279778126
The exact pathophysiological mechanisms remain to be investigated.	0.3446912370199768
The treatment of infrarenal aortic aneurysms by means of transluminally placed endovascular prostheses reflects significant progress in the field of vascular surgery.	0.4652549419791097
In the case of infrarenal aortic aneurysm it is possible to achieve technically successful implantation of such a prosthesis in well over 90 % of cases.	0.6712111664061912
The rate of clinical success, meaning lasting effective exclusion of the aortic aneurysm, cannot (yet) be definitively determined, since no long-term results are so far available.	0.6783730798897387
Secondary leaks are observed in at least 10 % of all patients, making a further therapy necessary (endorepair, conversion, embolization).	0.6872788306578953
Further development of endovascular prostheses will include optimization of the aortal/iliac attachment of the prostheses, a better configuration and the development of long-lasting materials that can be used for endovascular prostheses.	0.7281055373181784
The frequency of postspinal headaches after accidental puncture of the subarachnoid space with 16 - 18 G Tuohy needles is reported at 59 - 85%.	0.5618596009335571
A case of postspinal headache syndrome persisting over a period of 6 weeks following epidural anaesthesia during labour is described.	0.4756712835217036
A 30-year-old women had severe postspinal headache for 6 weeks after epidural anaesthesia during labour.	0.5923613560023706
Conservative therapy for 3 days and 4 days of bedrest followed by cristalloid infusions during a 3-week hospital stay and a subsequent 3-week period of bedrest at home did not lead to lasting pain relief.	0.5685048952317949
Intracranial haematoma and other abnormal processes were excluded by CCT.	0.3063623702925131
A pathologic EEG was not confirmed by cranial MRT.	0.29325693297747907
A lumbar epidural blood patch of 15 ml of autologous blood was performed at L3/4.	0.589716483715754
The patient stayed in bed for 12 h. After 3 h free of pain the patient complained of recurring headache.	0.6418651232836706
After a further 48 h of bedrest she had recovered.	0.3912140446493881
Because of lumbar pain 4 days after the epidural blood patch a MRT was performed, which showed the blood at L4 to S3 in the epidural space.	0.6103165027964895
The diagnosis of a cerebrospinal fluid leakage was based on the history and the main symptom of postspinal headache: the pain onset in the supine position.	0.8100560712946736
Such possible treatments as diminishing subarachnoidal pressure by bedrest, increasing cerebrospinal fluid production by infusions, increasing epidural pressure by epidural infusions and closing the cerebrospinal fluid leakage by epidural blood patch are discussed.	0.43762513305421574
The average success rate with the epidural blood patch is 93%.	0.4222544274963989
Volumes ranging from 5 to 20 ml are discussed for the autologous blood.	0.4335102153909469
We chose 15 ml of blood, to take account of the possibility that blood might settle in the wide sacral space.	0.6093706242624702
We were able to document the position of the blood patch as L4 to S3 on MR tomography (the injection site was L3/4).	0.6564284009839206
Most patients are free of headache 1 h after epidural blood patch.	0.492502850420727
Our patient had to be confined to bed for another 48 h because of recurring headache.	0.4546710896195116
The blood patch alone was not immediately sufficient to prevent all further cerebrospinal fluid leakage.	0.4892863703299608
Probably more than one subarachnoidal puncture had been made during the difficult epidural anesthetic procedure.	0.5063989478478628
On the other hand, the leak was probably only diminished because of the blood patch descending down to the wide sacral space.	0.6015895379315672
The combination of the large-volume blood patch, which diminished the leakage, and conservative treatment, which narrowed the transdural pressure difference, was successful: the 6-week postspinal headache was cured.	0.7705008485791307
Prolonged postspinal headache should be treated by epidural blood patch.	0.5170192457055106
The use of over 10 ml cannot be generally recommended, although in this case most of the blood patch of 15 ml was localized caudally.	0.7476170307493791
Careful monitoring for side effects is necessary with blood volumes larger than 10 ml.	0.41908712125516273
If there is no immediate relief, conservative therapy with 24 - 48 h of bedrest is recommended.	0.6754255068356606
If the headache persists a second blood patch should be performed, with the volume and the probable caudal spreading of the first taken into account.	0.7634101073342208

The primary study end-point was the time until confirmed progression of the disease as signified by a one point increase of the EDSS value (for initial EDSS values between 3.0 and 5.5) or 0.5 point increase when the initial EDSS value was between 6.0 and 6.5.	0.8059890984751849

1 IfSG = Infection Prevention Act).	0.18201512203872683

Nasopharyngeal carcinomas (NPC) belong to the most frequent malignant tumours in certain parts of the world, e. g., south-east Asia, while they occur infrequently in western  Europe.	0.5745126160219816
The association of NPCs with Epstein-Barr virus (EBV), a transforming human herpes virus, is well established.	0.5806417907695358
The current WHO classification recognises two major NPC histotypes, non-keratinising NPC and squamous cell NPC.	0.3803838825867089
EBV is invariably present in non-keratinising NPCs and the viral oncoprotein LMP-1 (latent membrane protein-1) is expressed in some cases.	0.6143168724934694
The tumour cells of non-keratinising NPCs show phenotypic features which are inducible by LMP-1 in  vitro.	0.443109741275039
These may contribute to the development of the lymphoid stroma which is characteristic of this tumour type.	0.6267231304491594
Furthermore, the virus is detectable in nasopharyngeal carcinoma in situ.	0.4930877249422192
Thus, the virus is likely to be involved in the pathogenesis of  non-keratinising NPCs.	0.7705820764160392
By contrast, the association of squamous cell NPCs with EBV  displays a geographical variability.	0.5926690214946232
It appears, therefore, that squamous cell NPCs are a heterogenous group of tumours distinct from non-keratinising NPCs.	0.4993545625555546

Sixty-seven patients were treated immediately following surgery, 10 patients with tumor progression.	0.9549525417002369
The influence of various factors including histology, gender, age, seizures, duration of symptoms (<= 6 weeks vs > 6 weeks), CT pattern (enhancement vs no enhancement), type of surgery, total radiotherapy dose and timing of radiotherapy on relapse-free survival and overall survival was investigated.	0.6993792552354512
The median overall survival time was 81 month, the 5- and 10-year survival rates were 54% and 31%, respectively.	0.8922636578205132
The median time to progression was 56 months, while the 5- and 10-year progression-free survival rates were 45% and 24%.	0.888997515799604

Since systemic treatment of neuropathic plantar ulcers in diabetics (DNPU) has so far been rather ineffective, recent reports of successful management of DNPU by short-term retrograde transvenous leg perfusions (RVP) by South American angiologists encouraged us to apply this treatment method in diabetics suffering from chronic DNPU.	0.538398212674485
Hence, in a prospective comparative clinical trial started in 1989 we have treated 45 male diabetics suffering from DNPU with the same daily doses of netilmycin, administered either in systemic venous infusions (SVI: n=21, three times/day) or in RVP (n=24, once/day).	0.6724137512107679
After 10 consecutive days of treatment, ulcers had closed in 8 of the 24 patients treated with RVP, as against 3 of the 21 treated with SVI.	0.6248404202000795
Diminution of the ulcer area by >30% including full debridement was achieved in 10/24 of the RVP cases (SVI: 4/21).	0.606031408976671
During 6 months of follow-up, amputation of toes or forefoot was necessary in only 1 patient in the RVP group, but in 4 in the SVI group.	0.7281613874295478
Partial restitution of osteolytic damage was observed in some cases after RVP.	0.5439388636943241
Our results show that regional netilmycin therapy given by the RVP procedure is clearly superior to equal netilmycin doses administered by SVI for the treatment of DNPU.	0.4021778942931715
RVP can be recommended in DNPU, particularly when the ulcers are complicated by infections.	0.6634484244711427

The topics involved in this conflict cover a broad spectrum, ranging from in vitro fertilization with subsequent implantation of the embryo through the problems of multiple pregnancy and selective feticide, the many questions raised by assisted fertilization, and especially by anonymous sperm donation, and the controversial techniques of preimplantation diagnosis and cryopreservation, to the legal aspects of prenatal diagnosis, some of which have already been the subjects of cases decided in the supreme courts.	0.7052636682165602
In a good many of these sectors it is difficult to reconcile what doctors can do and what it is admissible for them to do, so that it is hardly surprising that there is often no general consensus.	0.5140063989616651
Against this backdrop objective discussion is all the more important, and the notes in this paper, which necessarily touch on only some of the matters at issue, are intended to stimulate such discussion.	0.6479728959833969
In MR-imaging, similar to computed tomography, diagnosis of metastatic lymph-node disease is based on lymph-node sizes, and thereby it is non-specific.	0.7482654194603172
Superparamagnetic iron oxide as a potential contrast medium for MR-lymphography accumulate in normal lymph node tissue after endolymphatic, interstitial and, in case of very small particles, after intravenous injection.	0.6045618974205976
No accumulation occures in lymph node metastases.	0.41840426575643114
Lymph-node metastases can be detected by all three injection techniques.	0.6669966177750525
It has been shown experimentally, that in particular small metastases can be detected in normal sized lymph nodes.	0.8159945268270654

In 1993, we adopted conventional thoracic and abdominal prosthetic grafting and tailored aortoplasty (TAP) of the thoraco-abdominal aortic segment III/IV in chronic-expanding type B aortic dissection (CEAD) to achieve 2 primary goals: 1. reduction of renal/visceral and spinal cord ischemic time; 2. safe and secure reperfusion of all critical aortic branches for prevention of major complications, i. e. paraplegia, kidney failure, and intestinal infarction.	0.666000791851974

Selection criteria are: 1.	0.3883446612099028
CEAD- >5 cm 2. expansion rate >=5 mm/6 months 3. involvement of the critical aortic segment III/IV.	0.7054393963778105
TAP consists of: 1. left posterolateral aortotomy from Th 8 - L 2, 2. excision of the intraaortic dissection membrane(s) 3. aortic closure to a diameter of 3 cm to reduce wall tension.	0.7465393591970714
All 5 patients survived without any major complications, particularly no paraplegia.	0.5414390653567436
Mean cross-clamping was 43 min.	0.34645185091736885

After mean follow-up of 2.4 years, CT-angiography revealed a stable TAP segment (mean aortic- 3.2 cm) in 4 patients and one re-expanded TAP segment (from 4 cm after 24 months up to 7 cm) without signs of re-dissection.	0.8715256996901164

All optically active molecules have at least one asymmetric atom in common which is attached to four ligands, that can have different three dimensional positions.	0.5454178037292581
Therefore it can be concluded that the resulting isomers are chemically identical in all respects except for the direction with which they rotate plane-polarized light.	0.5060716527434164
When the isomer and its corresponding enantiomer are present in equal proportions, they are called racemic mixture, a mixture that does not rotate polarized light, since the optical activities of the two isomers cancel each other.	0.6225996757018817
Although the isomers are chemically identical other optically active molecules can interact with these isomers in a geometrically specific way termed stereoselectivity.	0.3570472693643932
The human body comprises a chiral environment due to optically active proteins; thus it is not surprising that enantiomeric drugs exhibit different pharmacological properties, when used as pure optical isomers.	0.5658301980128452
Till today most modern anaesthetics have been optical isomers, which are mainly used as racemic mixture (1:1 mixture).	0.739149045235531
For financial reasons pure isomers were only used for research purposes, but nowadays the wide clinical use of pure isomers is financially feasible due to new production techniques.	0.512437570828322
The terms eutomer and distomer were chosen to indicate the more or less potent form of the drug.	0.5531554883332627
The clinical use of pure isomers is only of advisable, if there are significant differences between eutomer and distomer in desired or side effects.	0.6343535690933955
Among the modern anaesthetics ketamine, isoflurane, bupivacaine and atracurium exhibit an asymmetric carbon.	0.3631115246281096
For most drugs the separation in pure isomers will reduce side effects.	0.3033963966361667
For volatile anaesthetics this question is still unanswered, since experimental and clinical results are inconsistent so far.	0.542657234425831

Consequently, the brain serotonin content and also cerebral serotonin function are decreased.	0.5055604242705136
This method provides a paradigm to study the role of serotonin in the pathobiology of depressive disorders and their treatment modalities.	0.4695096396399385
Untreated depressed patients show few behavioral effects during tryptophan depletion.	0.2703138300895671
In depressed patients during an antidepressant or light-therapy-induced stable remission, a transient depressive relapse was induced by tryptophan depletion.	0.5285631564046851
Healthy subjects with a genetic risk for affective disorder show worsening of their condition induced by tryptophan depletion.	0.4675218261847148
These findings indicate the relevance of altered brain serotonin function in the pathophysiology of affective disorders and strengthen the importance of serotonin in the mechanism of action of antidepressants.	0.5604457476981053
Since recently published studies revealed some evidence that the serotonergic system is directly involved in the pathophysiology of various psychiatric syndromes besides depression, it seems to be reasonable to evaluate the validity of the tryptophan depletion test also in non-depressed patients.	0.634368439321538

Since the skin dose becomes the limiting factor while deciding the tumorcidal dose, the detailed analysis of dose distribution in the build-up region is necessary for high-energy photon beams.	0.5904771405189718
In this study the beam characteriwstics affecting the build-up and skin dose for 6- and 18-MV photons are analyzed.	0.7497282923674403
Measurements were made with 6- and 18-MV photons using a PTW parallel-plate ionization chamber (B23344-036) and a RDM-1F electrometer.	0.6377175091849362
Build-up ionization measurements were made with the chamber fitted into a 25 x 25 x 25 cm polystyrene phantom with a fixed SSD of 100 cm.	0.439324157797886
The entrance and buildup dose measurements were made with a polycarbonate and a mesh type metallic shielding tray and a 45 ° wedge.	0.38614292973944675
Exit dose measurements were carried out for the graphite patient supporting assembly table top, 1.0 cm thick piece of wood and the 1.0 cm thick patient supporting perspex base frame for head and neck treatments.	0.5819857200930071
It was observed that the dmax decreased slightly with field size as with other accelerators.	0.43982232604320115
For both photon energies the surface dose was observed to increase with increase in field size.	0.5304352079642198
It was also noticed that the dose in the build-up region increases slightly when the polycarbonate secondary blocking tray is introduced with the increase in surface dose.	0.5587214876087905
The data show that the tray pertubation factor (TPF) at surface decreases steadily with tray-surface distance for both photon beams for all field sizes.	0.5203092965978324
It was noted that the TPF was more when the polycarbonate tray was introduced at shorter tray-surface distances for both energies.	0.41844058896693603
At tray-surface distances above 60 cm the TPF almost remained close to unity for 6-MV photons for all field sizes, whereas the continuous decrease in TPF could be noted for 18-MV photon beams even after the TPF rewached unity.	0.5238782611818233
The increase in surface dose with field size for both photon energies is due to the electron scattering from the intervening materials.	0.5061496430415378
The use of wedge filters absorbs low-energy scattered electrons siginificantly and hence, the relative surface dose (RSD) is always less than unity.	0.5673504857900112
The increase in dose enhancement percentage with graphite compared to perspex supporting assembly indicates that the electron backscatter is proportional to the atomic number of the medium.	0.39375459029213095

It was the aim of this initial study to assess the efficiency of the tube in animals, healthy volunteers and patients.	0.7418489982052386
With the approval of the Animal Ethics Committee, a total of 16 anaesthetised pigs were used for the animal experiments.	0.6595612490948599
Balloon occlusion of the cardia was performed in 10 pigs.	0.7243288018106928
Six further pigs with an unblocked cardia served as controls.	0.24055123411391008

After termination of the occlusion of the cardia, reflux was able to be induced by 14 of the 16 volunteers.	0.6131094307758435

The basic assumption is: pathogenic beliefs that are based on traumatic childhood experiences prevent normal desirable goals.	0.3863099587502753

We evaluated changes in brain tissue oxygen pressure (ptiO2) and global cerebral blood flow (CBF) during cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB) with deep hypothermic circulatory arrest (DHCA) in ten anesthetized New Zealand White rabbits (body weight 2.5 +/- 0.5 kg).	0.6323940958125548
CBF [hydrogen desaturation (clearance)-technique) and ptiO2 (Licox-microsensor) right frontoparietal cortex] were determined.	0.5575617702831256
After median sternotomy, the animals were placed on CPB (standard roller pump, nonpulsatile, -stat acid-base management, perfusion flow of 180-200 mL/kg/min, right atrial and aortic cannulation) for induction of DHCA by cooling to 15 °C rectal temperature (1 °C per minute).	0.631286395727504
Rewarming period was started after 60 minutes of circulatory arrest and the rabbits were weaned from CPB without the use of any inotropic or vasoactive support.	0.43667303637549615
Under baseline conditions, ptiO2 was 38 +/- 5 mmHg and did not change significantly before DHCA.	0.5026692824430644
During DHCA the ptiO2 decreased within 15 minutes to 14 +/- 5 mmHg, after 30 minutes to 5 +/- 1 mmHg and after 40 minutes to zero.	0.5860275410843857
Neither the ptiO2 nor CBF recovered fully following restoration of bypass flow and reperfusion: ptiO2 (25 +/- 4 mmHg vs. baseline: 38 +/- 5 mmHg, p<0.05) and CBF (43 +/- 8 vs. baseline: 68 +/- 11 ml/100 g/min, p<0.05) were significantly reduced.	0.6661625078104287

These data demonstrate significantly decreased levels of ptiO2 (brain tissue oxygenation) and CBF (oxygen supply) during and after rewarming from DHCA.	0.5723507259429401
The induced impairment of recovery persists after rewarming and generates a temporary low-flow situation with delayed brain tissue reoxygenation on the cellular/mitochondrial level.	0.46043965908992657
Thus, a direct influence on brain functional recovery by the active cooling and rewarming process about the bloodstream during CPB, resulting in disturbed tissue blood redistribution, mitochondrial dysfunction and/or excessive cerebral oxygen consumption (compensation of an oxygen debt) is a possible explanation.	0.5904160410180921
While initially advocated primarily for intrasurgical visualization (e. g., craniotomy), interventional MRI rapidly evolved into roles in image-guided localization for needle-based procedures, minimally invasive neurosurgical procedures, and thermal ablation of cancer.	0.44857824551772235
In this contest, MRI pulse sequences and scanning methods serve one of four primary roles: (1) speed improvement, (2) device localization, (3) anatomy/lesion differentiation and (4) temperature sensitivity.	0.6153273401648571
A 74-years old patient is admitted to the hospital with a over a period of 4 years growing, scrotal, ulcerated tumor.	0.6506513534503873
There is no connection to the testicle or the epididymis palpable.	0.4693647642912954
All laboratory findings including the tumorparameters are normal.	0.24605232055789328
The scrotal sonography shows a solid tumor, that is filled with vessels in the Doppler sonography.	0.6097490971681686
The complete tumor resection with histological examination leads to the diagnosis of a scrotal leiomyoma.	0.6503304380716747
This rare, benign tumor is a differential diagnosis to paratesticular or non-germinal tumors.	0.5592986233936138
This review summarizes vascular tumours of skin and soft tissues that have been characterised in recent years.	0.6458671280688929
Although most of them are very rare, knowledge about their reproducible clinicopathological features is important to avoid diagnostic pitfalls.	0.6987976745587037
These lesions include: bacillary angiomatosis, a vasoproliferative, pseudoneoplastic infection of immunocompromised patients caused by Rochalimaea henselae; tufted angioma, a variant of lobular capillary haemangioma characterised by a "cannon-ball" distribution of multiple lobules composed of packed capillaries and pericytes; microvenular haemangioma, a cutaneous haemangioma composed of thin-walled and irregularly branching blood vessels which dissect dermal collagen; sinusoidal haemangioma, a distinctive variant of cavernous haemangioma which may be located in the subcutaneous breast tissue and then may be confused with well-differentiated angiosarcoma; "hobnail haemangioma" (targetoid haemosiderotic haemangioma), a benign vascular tumour with a distinctive clinical targetoid appearance and a hobnail cytomorphology of the prominent endothelial tumour cells; retiform haemangioendothelioma, a very recently characterised low-grade angiosarcoma occurring most commonly in the extremities of adolescents which is characterised by arborising blood vessels arranged in a retiform pattern and lined by hobnail-like prominent endothelial cells; Kaposi-like infantile haemangioendothelioma, a borderline malignant tumour of infants mimicking Kaposi's sarcoma histologically; epithelioid angiosarcoma, a highly aggressive tumour in the spectrum of epithelioid vascular lesions which stains positively for endothelial and epithelial immunohistological markers; benign lymph-angioendothelioma (progressive lymphangioma), a benign, slowly growing macule or plaque which has to be distinguished from well-differentiated angiosarcoma and Kaposi's sarcoma; and lymphangiomatosis of the limbs, a poorly recognised angiomatosis occurring in young patients and limited mainly to the limbs with a favourable prognosis.	0.5342007184904412
Cardial features of the oculocerebrorenal syndrome of Lowe (OCRL) are congenital cataract, mental retardation, hypotonia and renal tubular dysfunction.	0.5304216280341905
The primary biochemical defect remains unknown.	0.2186918626468439
An inborn error of the inositol phosphate metabolism as a result of mutations within the OCRL gene localized on the X-chromosome is discussed.	0.43723378487772935
Experimental animal models of ventricular arrhythmias have been developed to investigate the mechanisms of arrhythmogenesis in man.	0.7752213223371665
Ventricular arrhythmias associated with ischaemia and infarction often cannot be elucidated by clinical studies on patients because those arrhythmias are potentially lifethreatening and their occurrence is unpredictable.	0.48504540378301847
Because of additional experimental procedures and techniques that can be used in the animal laboratory, such as microelectrode recording of transmembrane action potentials and high-density optical and electrical activation mapping, animal models have provided information that cannot be obtained from clinical studies.	0.6490532681748314
Studies on animal models have provided new ideas and hypotheses that have been tested in clinical studies and that have been found to be true for clinical arrhythmias.	0.7260913088147535
Animal models have enabled the mechanisms of fibrillation and defibrillation to be understood and new therapeutic concepts to be developed.	0.5862091514096778
The purpose of this article is to briefly review some animal models of ventricular tachycardia and fibrillation.	0.6230252554334809
Some contributions that these animal studies have made to our understanding of ventricular tachyarrhythmias will be discussed.	0.5024383981518984
Because of the clinical importance of coronary artery disease this article concentrates on those arrhythmias caused by myocardial ischaemia and infarction.	0.7106540392407145
The authors report a rare, recently diagnosed and atypical mishap during one-lung ventilation (OLV) via a double lumen tube (DLT) and left-sided thoracotomy: an ipsilateral pneumothorax during ventilation of the right lung.	0.663314247252965
This occurred in a 63-year-old patient with chronic obstructive airway disease who was scheduled for urgent repair of a descending thoracic aortic aneurysm.	0.5938574478653137
Anaesthesia and surgery were uneventful until aortic cross-clamping release.	0.4468849907126873
The common presentation of increased intrathoracic extrapleural pressure owing to a pneumothorax in patients with mechanically ventilated lungs is a rapid decrease in oxygen saturation, followed or paralleled by haemodynamic deterioration.	0.5117123240315986
Although the above presentation could be seen in this case, the diagnosis of a tension pneumothorax was delayed twice.	0.8132422548061303
First, symptoms were initially obscured by haemodynamic changes resulting from a head-down tilt and aortic declamping.	0.49882653090699014
Second, since the lack of consolidation after aortic declamping focused attention on the airway problems, complications resulting from the use of a DLT were primarily considered.	0.7021433951745992
In particular, since breathing sounds were detectable initially, malposition or torsion of the DLT had to be excluded by fibre-optic bronchoscopy, which involved a further delay.	0.5678270062855253
Finally, two observations led to the diagnosis of a right-sided tension pneumothorax: (1) bullae of the contralateral lung, detected during thoracotomy; (2) the finding that ventilation of both lungs and the left lung subsequently increased arterial (SaO2) and mixed venous oxygen saturation (SvO2) and the circulatory status, but ventilation of the right lung caused a deterioration.	0.7955280634787385
Chest radiography and insertion of a chest tube with drainage of air, thereafter, validated our hypothesis.	0.43729620164398353
The time course of oxygen desaturation during OLV and tension pneumothorax was as severe as expected; the time course of haemodynamic deterioration, however, appeared quicker and had more impact than expected.	0.5075449106270928
Assuming that mediastinal deviation was not hindered by contralateral intrathoracic pressure during thoracotomy, we believed that circulation should be depressed later or to a lesser extent in patients with an intraoperative pneumothorax.	0.577662845826223
Yet, during thoracotomy, decrease in cardiac filling and output during tension pneumothorax in OLV obviously results primarily from the immovability of the mediastinum owing to mediastinal fixation and is at least as decisive as the contralateral intrathoracic pressure in closed-chest patients.	0.5413115596981878
In summary, a tension pneumothorax during one-lung ventilation and thoracotomy is a rare, but disastrous complication during the use of a DLT, which has not, to our knowledge, been reported previously.	0.7795718893078518
We recommend that tension pneumothorax be added to the list of complications and problems during OLV by the use of a DLT, especially in patients with structural lung diseases.	0.6825622119132502

96 % of the patients showed very good and good results after operation.	0.9083815554444673
The average stay in hospital for patients with femoral shaft fractures was 14.4 days.	0.6249322563890649
17 weeks after operation the intramedullary nails were removed.	0.4569359733305986

Introduction: The goal of this study was to compare contrast-enhanced T1-weighted Flash and Turbo-Flash sequences with conventional spin-echo sequences as a basis for planning high-precision radiotherapy.	0.587197349279673
Methods: A total of 25 consecutive patients with different intracranial tumors and a disrupted blood-brain barrier were studied.	0.6019625507551342
T1-weighted Flash, Turbo-Flash and conventional spin-echo images were evaluated after controlled 30-s infusion of 0.1 mmol/kg body weight of Gd-DTPA.	0.5462237120764177
The evaluation of the three sequences included the measurement of the signal- and contrast-to-noise ratios, the visual inspection of the tumors and artifacts, and the measurement of tumor size.	0.8461166085161487
Results: The signal- and contrast-to-noise ratios were significantly (P < 0.05-0.01) lower for Flash and Turbo-Flash than for conventional spin-echo sequences.	0.6266853450004751
However, visual inspection of the contrast-enhancing tumors revealed in 23 and 24 of 25 lesions on Flash and Tu-rbo-Flash images, respectively, good or very good tumor visibility when compared with conventional spin-echo images with a reduction of imaging time by a factor of 7-8.	0.6122073388202985
Flash and Turbo-Flash sequences were more prone to susceptibility artifacts, conventional spin-echo sequences more to pulsation artifacts in the posterior fossa.	0.4709221713187955
Tumor sizes were comparable in all three techniques.	0.5786027068105618
Conclusion: At present, conventional spin-echo images are superior to fast Flash and ultrafast Turbo-Flash sequences as a basis for accurate target volume definition in high-precision radiotherapy.	0.5208552585922763
However, fast Flash and Turbo-Flash images may be a practicable alternative to conventional spin-echo images for tumors in the posterior fossa or in patients unable to tolerate a stereotactic fixation device.	0.5881105892607631
Despite some limitations, Turbo-Flash sequences enable fast dynamic MR imaging combined with an acceptable morphology, which may be sufficient for target volume planning in high-precision radiotherapy.	0.6223764775263373

Nucleotides are low molecular weight biological compounds that play major roles in almost all-biological processes.	0.3692287345450966
Cell nucleic acids and nucleotides are continuously synthesised, degraded and salvaged.	0.24775589526791733
The body's pools derive from three potential sources: synthesis de novo, salvage (recycling of preformed bases) and the diet.	0.47481926579443534
It is generally accepted that de novo synthesis of both purines and pyrimidines from amino acid precursors is capable of supporting the cellular needs for nucleic acid synthesis.	0.3635433295027266
When protein intake is decreased or in situations in which there are a high demand of nucleotides synthesis (after gut injury, after surgical trauma, sepsis, rapid growth: pregnancy or newborn infants, etc.)	0.5499687591976121
some tissues with a rapid turnover (gut and immune system) may increase the salvage of exogenous nucleotides coming from the diet.	0.5063387963881587
Therefore, nucleotides may become conditionally essential nutrients.	0.3155592733295338
This article discusses the possible beneficial effects of dietary nucleotides on small intestine (maturation and recovery) and gut microflora, lipid and hepatic metabolism and on the immune system.	0.5627687306677468
Human milk is the best source of nucleotides for young infants and the nucleotide/nucleoside profile of it shows a substantial predominance for pyrimidines as compared to purines.	0.520973480220336
Moreover, pyrimidine nucleotides seem to be better preserved in breast milk during storage in the breast and during digestion in the small intestine and they are more absorbed and incorporated into tissue RNA, as compared to purine ones.	0.5966576058408436
Additional research should be done to improve the design of nucleotides supplemented infant formulas.	0.6613834074156064
This includes: 1) to investigate in vivo if the incorporation of dietary nucleotides in tissue RNA is enhanced in situations of stress or rapid growth and 2) to study the biological effects of individually administered purine and pyrimidine nucleotides.	0.6540002693655699

Objectives: Due to its unique pharmacokinetics, the new esterase-metabolised opioid remifentanil results in rapid post-anaesthesia recovery.	0.5409744498424327
The aim of this clinical investigation was to compare recovery times after remifentanil anaesthesia in combination with hypnotic concentrations of either propofol or isoflurane.	0.6736938407788129
Dosages used in the study protocol were based on recommendations by the pharmaceutical manufacturer.	0.7029981086123915
Methods: Patients (ASA status I-II) scheduled for elective arthroscopy were included in this trial.	0.6620034629860546
Without premedication in the morning, anaesthesia was induced identically in both groups: remifentanil bolus (1 µg/kg), start of remifentanil-infusion (0.5 µg/kg/min), followed immediately by propofol (ca.	0.677720507705553
For maintenance of anaesthesia remifentanil (0.25 µg/kg/min) was combined with either a propofol infusion of 0.1 mg/kg/min or 0.5 MAC isoflurane (=0.6 vol.%) in O2/air.	0.7306736269074446
Anaesthetic delivery was discontinued simultaneously with termination of surgery and recovery times were recorded.	0.4855761226106978
Results: A total of 40 patients were studied at random in two groups of 20 each with comparable demographic data and anaesthetic technique (Tables 1 and 2).	0.6533668434861388
In both groups emergence was very rapid.	0.5730548771495282
Recovery times were significantly shorter for remifentanil-isoflurane than for remifentanil-propofol (Table 3): spontaneous ventilation 5.1 vs 8.1 min (P<0.05), extubation 5.5 vs. 8.6 min (P<0.02), post-anaesthesia recovery score >=9 of 10 points 6.2 vs 11.3 min (P<0.01), and arrival at PACU 16.2 vs 19.2 min (P<0.01).	0.6532954201544432
Mild to moderate shivering was noted in 40% of all patients (9 cases following isoflurane, 7 following propofol).	0.7706245457873865
Conclusions: Using the manufacturer's recommended dosages, emergence after remifentanil anaesthesia is more rapid with 0.5 MAC isoflurane than with 0.1 mg/kg/min propofol.	0.7087154027001641
These results are most probably due to the different pharmacological properties of both co-anaesthetics, especially the applied dosages, and to different interactions with remifentanil.	0.8507063380573809
Present clinical experience suggests that a further dose reduction, especially for propofol, is possible.	0.8107517796950903
For both remifentanil groups emergence was remarkably rapid between return of consciousness and the awake state (on-off phenomenon), which might contribute to post-anaesthesia safety.	0.5983456660075859

The aim of this prospective and randomized study was to evaluate the safety and efficacy of a reduced shock strength in transvenous implantable defibrillator therapy.	0.7481037685368517
So far clinical data concerning the safety margin of the shock energy in ICD therapy do not exist.	0.49277587263129885
The shock energy tested during long-term follow-up in this study was twice the intraoperatively measured defibrillation threshold (DFT).	0.672525008375249
A total number of 176 consecutive patients representing a typical cohort of ICD patients were evaluated.	0.49515984964883514
All patients received a non-thoracotomy lead system (CPI, Endotak 0070, 0090) and a biphasic cardioverter-defibrillator with the ability to store episodes (Cardiac Pacemakers Inc., Ventac TM PRx II, PRx III).	0.5473259928511276
The intraoperative defibrillation threshold (DFT) was evaluated in a step-down protocol (15, 10, 8, 5 J) and hat to be <=15 J for inclusion into the study.	0.7750287380940591
The lowest effective energy terminating induced ventricular fibrillation had to be confirmed and was defined as DFT+ augmented defibrillation threshold.	0.5101197286327666
The DFT+ value was tested immediately after successful implantation, at discharge, and after a follow-up period of one year.	0.8282845465735886
Prior to implantation the patients were randomized into two groups.	0.6553450390131178
The energy of the first shock in the study group was programmed at twice DFT+ and in the control group at the maximum energy output (34 J).	0.8084770761715553
The efficacy of the first shock and its reproducibility in DFT testings and in spontaneous episodes during long-term follow-up of the study group were compared to those in the control group.	0.8830623981521543
A DFT+ value was found to be <=15 J in 166 of 176 patients (94%).	0.4477114237440544
The DFT+ in the study group was 9.6+/-3.2; in control group 10.1+/-.35 J.	0.7357859304936498
The prohability of successful defibrillation at DFT+ level after one year was 84%.	0.32385530735662094
The success rate of the first shock meant to terminate induced ventricular fibrillation (VF) was 99.5% in the study group (217 of 218 episodes) and 99% in the control group (201 of 203 episodes).	0.8145049816578912
During follow-up of 24+/-9 months spontaneous episodes in the study group, 83/86 (96.5) monomorphic ventricular tachycardias (MVT) and 38/40 (95%) VF-episodes were converted successfully by the 2x DFT+ shock.	0.6739102786193247
In the control group the first shock was successful in 151/156 (96.8%) spontaneous MVTs and in 30/33 (91%) VF episodes.	0.7031059236829423
The efficacy of the first shock was not influenced by clinical data such as the underlying cardiac disease, left ventricular function, ongoing antiarrhythmic therapy with amiodarone, or the number of spontaneous episodes per day or by the DFT itself.	0.7893724099030542
At a mean follow-up of two years there was no significant difference between the two groups concerning the incidence of sudden cardiac death (2.4% in the study group vs. 3.8% in the control group).	0.9867773843398818
In conclusion programming the first shock with the ICD lead system used in this study at 2x DFT+ is as efficient as a shock energy of 34 J in order to terminate induced and spontaneous episodes of VT/VF.	0.5575452859844803
Thus, the safety of ICD-therapy is not impaired when programming the shock energy at the 2x DFT+ value.	0.6662503610880052
Culpable deficits of the preoperative information cause a complete illegality of the whole medical intervention and lead to liability for any resulting damage.	0.5589481847393108
In cases of controversy it's the physician's due to prove the correct preoperative information.	0.5567050259793325
To reduce these liability-risks a computer based information system has been developed.	0.47959945983865726

Acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) is rare but beset with a high mortality rate.	0.6234253714746518
In recent years, however, a trend towards higher survival rates has been observed.	0.5085690380395728
High inspiratory oxygen concentrations, large tidal volumes, and high peak inspiratory airway pressures applied during mechanical ventilation have been identified as harmful to the lung and can contribute to the progression of ARDS.	0.6722749034290809
This had led to reconsideration of the sequelae of ventilatory therapy.	0.32179718418620384
Mechanical ventilation and other adjunctive strategies in ARDS have changed from the conventional approach aiming at normalisation of physiological ventilatory parameters to an elaborated approach that intends to protect the ventilated lung, prevent oxygen toxicity, recruit the infiltrated atelectatic and consolidated lung and reduce the anatomical and alveolar dead space.	0.4333094446566374
This new approach consists of various forms of pressure-controlled mechanical ventilation with PEEP and permissive hypercapnia, body position changes, and inhalation of nitric oxide.	0.5801630659801194
Should these procedures fail to improve impaired gas exchange, extracorporeal membrane oxygenation is an additional therapeutic option.	0.42449904854934317
None of these therapeutic procedures, however, has been tested against traditional standard treatment in a classical randomised controlled trial.	0.6685424348048238

Procalcitonin is the propeptide of calcitonin devoid of hormonal activity.	0.28197866294044005
Normally, procalcitonin is produced in the C-cells of the thyroid gland.	0.42141449981924695
In healthy humans procalcitonin levels are undetectable (<0.1 ng/ml).	0.6899910655707814
During severe generalized infections (bacterial, parasitic and fungal) with systemic manifestations, procalcitonin levels may rise up to 100 ng/ml.	0.5932451712507731
In contrast, severe viral infections or inflammatory reactions of non-infectious origin do not or very moderately increase procalcitonin levels.	0.568870834368893
The exact site of procalcitonin production is not exactly known but even large amounts of procalcitonin released during infections do not lead to an increase in plasma calcitonin level or activity.	0.46102960741752774

Electron beam CT, which does not require mechanical movement of an X-ray tube, has a temporal resolution which exceeds that of conventional computed tomography by a factor of about ten.	0.6553773312445275
Axial images of the heart can be acquired within 50 to 100 ms with a spatial resolution below 0.5 mm2 and permit precise visualization of all cardiac structures.	0.5736323318768461
ECG-triggered acquisition of 30 to 40 axial images (3 mm slice thickness) in a short inspiratory breathhold allows one to sample a 3-dimensional volume data set which covers the complete heart.	0.6661951338621281
Overall acquisition times are approximately 30 to 50 seconds.	0.3046710109919816
While electron beam CT in general permits a complete cardiac investigation, including morphology, function, and perfusion, the method's most important application is non-invasive imaging of the coronary arteries.	0.7064704489846244
Without contrast enhancement, coronary calcification by EBCT currently constitutes the most sensitive non-invasive marker for the presence even of very early forms of coronary atherosclerosis.	0.5428027642134888
Intraveneous injection of contrast agent during image acquisition additionally permits the selective visualization of the coronary artery lumen and detection of significant stenoses.	0.5484353802098814
This method is especially well suited in the follow-up of coronary interventions and coronary bypass grafting.	0.6396653715411436
Breathhold and movement artifacts, superposition of coronary arteries and veins, as well as severe coronary calcifications currently constitute the method's main problems.	0.48888514337086886
In spite of these limitations, electron beam CT has been shown to permit clinically valuable non-invasive investigations of the coronary arteries, which may be further refined as technology progresses.	0.7018203436236614

Procalcitonin is a propeptide of calcitonin.	0.25787363173512307
It is usually not detectable in healthy volunteers but appears in high concentrations in the serum of patients with severe bacterial, parasitic or fungal infection.	0.7002163835617221
In contrast, procalcitonin levels do not or only moderately increase during viral infections or during non-infectious systemic inflammatory states.	0.5614398335040839
Because of these properties, procalcitonin has been proposed to serve as a marker of severe infections and sepsis.	0.7408285282426464
Increased procalcitonin levels have recently been shown to indicate the severity of systemic infection with increasing specificity.	0.5982383923890846
Normally, procalcitonin is produced in the C-cells of the thyroid gland.	0.42141449981924695
The origin of the high levels of procalcitonin in septic conditions is not fully understood.	0.5765788292608399
Although procalcitonin has drawn attention as a marker of severe systemic infections, a recent study suggests it may also be a mediator of sepsis.	0.6371607687146641
More studies are needed to uncover the nature and pathophysiological role of this molecule.	0.44639606671929305

In both cases, activity of -L-fucosidase in leukocytes and cultivated fibroblasts was negligible.	0.5195947193012966

Discussion: On account of the mutation a unique PFlMI restriction site is obliterated; this simplifies molecular diagnosis of the G401X mutation.	0.526084578652351
So far, the mutation G401X has not been found in any other population.	0.6592159851423132

Both, severity and duration of hypoxia are crucial in determining wether irreversible cerebral infarction will occur or not.	0.4288453809822751
For the clinical routine, the diagnosis of hypoxia is indirectly made by low CPP, low jugularvenous oxygen saturation (SjO2) or low tissue PO2.	0.6586179612028323

Targeted treatment of hypoxia according to the underlying cause is mandatory.	0.6268927923578295
Primary goal is to increase cellular oxygen delivery by correction of low arterial oxygen content and elevation of regional CBF.	0.511496921611332
Within the autoregulatory range decreasing CPP causes vasodilation and increasing CPP vasoconstriction with increasing or decreasing cerebral blood volume respectively.	0.3664858148323721
Initially elevation of the lower autoregulatory threshold often requires CPP 70 mmHg.	0.5265456025229956
Targeted treatment of intracranial hypertension must avoid decreasing CPP.	0.37006836390725745
In the early postrautmatic phase prevention of cerebral hypoxia relies on management of CBF by means of CPP and cerebral vascular resistance.	0.47505226466505024
Thereafter targeted treatment of intracranial hypertension caused by cerebral edema and hypervolemia are increasingly important.	0.40288561106454307
Today, orthotopic liver transplantation is the treatment of choice for the end-stage of various liver diseases, and a 1-year survival rate of 80 % and a 5-year survival rate of 70 % in elective patients without tumor are reported in international surveys.	0.9924726238720798
The liver transplant programme of the Inselspital in Bern is small compared with international centres, which may raise questions about the results and the justification for such a programme.	0.657234176151124
Over a period of 66 months, 62 liver transplantations were performed in 60 patients at the Inselspital.	0.59966664404421
The hospital mortality was 3.3 %, and the 2.5-year overall survival rate was 92 % for elective cases without tumor.	1.0114277417604527
After a median follow-up of 30 months, 68 % of all patients were re-integrated in housework or full- or part-time in their profession, and 83 % were independent from the help of others.	0.8414165466692726
We conclude that a small liver transplant programme based only on routine resources can achieve results comparable to the international standards.	0.4804847383376455
Accidental hypothermia (AH) can be defined as an unintentional decrease in core temperature below 35  °C during cold exposure by individuals without intrinsic thermoregulatory dysfunction.	0.4516561292734113
Pathophysiological changes can be attributed both to the severity of hypothermia and to co-morbid factors such as trauma, submersion, intoxication and underlying diseases.	0.47823948127990323
In trauma victims stratified according to the Injury Severity Score, the factor hypothermia is considered to be a poor prognostic sign for survival.	0.6559369601593524
In these patients rewarming therapy should be applied as soon as possible.	0.6353158599490291
In the Utrecht University Hospital, adult patients with AH are managed according to an algorithm based on their presenting hemodynamic conditions.	0.5103314053467961
Patients with perfusing cardiac rhythms and systolic pressures over 80 mmHg will receive continuous arteriovenous rewarming (CAVR).	0.328663973515178
Arrested and hemodynamically instable patients are treated with cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB).	0.3701934397046383
In a 3-year period, 22 patients with AH were admitted to the emergency department.	0.8282138487264324
Fourteen patients had a trauma as the cause of hypothermia.	0.5624579655540259
Twenty patients were treated according to the algorithm (CAVR n = 18, CPB n = 2) and two patients were alternatively managed.	0.7961310155539854
Mortality in the CAVR group was 28 % and total mortality reached 32 %.	0.6748093514115517
Complications of CAVR are related to placement and removal of vascular catheters and may be severe in these patients with impaired coagulation.	0.624737668551339
CAVR permits a good access to the (trauma-) patient and rewarming can be continued synchronously with diagnosis and treatment of various injuries.	0.7031491799267973

Pseudarthrosis is a serious disturbance or disorder within the regulation cycle in fracture healing, which consists of osteoregeneration, osteovascularization and stabilization.	0.4638154921426423
The causes and underlying reasons for disturbance of this regulation cycle are primarily massive destruction of the biological and functional very important unity of periost, cortical substance and medullary space.	0.5164888468655299
This can occur from trauma, but it happens more often from surgical procedures that do not take the biological principles of bone-healing into account.	0.6999253688637892
Surgical strategies and interventions that respect the importance of periosteal tissue, cortical tissue and medullary space do fill the biological principles of fracture-healing and fracture union.	0.49132558072889393

In contrast, erythropoiesis is markedly reduced in CML and to a lesser degree also in IMF.	0.509366288679321

Results: Significant differences (p<0.01) were observed in HR and O2D when comparing both DDD- to VVIR- and DDD- to DDDR-modes.	0.7687686187501916
Comparing the randomly synchronous VVIR- to the DDDR-mode, only the MRT of oxygen uptake demonstrated a significant decrease in the DDDR-mode (p<0.05).	0.6666496145314422
There were also significant decreases in O2Di and MRT in the DDDR-mode, as compared to the non-rate responsive DDD-mode (p<0.01).	0.5232706923056775

Introduction: Results of animal experiments have demonstrated that the osseous integration of non-cemented prostheses can, at the very least temporarily, be impaired by the application of non-steroidal antiphlogistic agents (such as diclofenac).	0.6118606990360652
It is the objective of this study to examine whether there is a direct influence of diclofenac used in usual clinical dosages (3 times 50 mg daily) on bone cells and their progenitor cells which would explain the observed slow integration of the prostheses.	0.8205630292550617
Methods: To investigate this, cultivated human in vitro osteoblasts and stromal bone marrow cells were incubated with increasing doses of the medications.	0.6160722692131232
Our study focused on the effect of diclofenac application on proliferation and functional metabolism in both cell lines.	0.4027578785973346
The measurable maximal plasma concentration 2h after the application of one tablet Voltaren 50 reached 1.6µg/ml.	0.30380249463677883
This correlated with diclofenac concentrations between 1 and 10 ml found in our experiments.	0.426707151986329
The detected values were correlated to the control group (0 µg/ml diclofenac).	0.6454428985861281
Results: The drug effect upon osteoblasts was higher than on progenitor cells.	0.5196604087103626
The proliferation of in vitro stromal bone marrow cells, compared to untreated cells, was found to be decreased.	0.7568614799996244
We observed a decrease to 82% at a diclofenac concentration of 1 µg/ml, Osteoblasts exhibited a decrease to 97,5% at the same concentration.	0.806710489765196
The DNA synthesis increased to 118% in stromal bone marrow cells, in osteoblasts to 144%.	0.592924584574647
In contrast, we detected a neglectible decrease to 92% in the collagen synthesis of osteoblasts compared to untreated cells.	0.6530896836326628
The synthesis of osteocalcin by osteoblasts increased to 119%.	0.2861927525141544
The alkaline phosphatase activity was found to be decreased to 88% in stromal bone marrow cells and increased in osteoblasts to 111%.	0.5883312882514117
Conclusion: Temporary inhibiting effects on osseous integration in non-cemented prosthesis by diclofenac could be caused by a disturbance in the anabolic bone metabolism, exhibited by an increase of osteoblastic osteocalcin expression.	0.5333306914007782
Osteocalcin as a known negative regulator of the osteoneogenesis is most likely inhibiting the collagen matrix deposition.	0.40298522201539466

The aesthetic result was evaluated as symmetric and durable in all cases.	0.4485417395249789

Patients with primarily lacking diplopia developed neither eye motility disturbances nor postoperative enophthalmus in the following period.	0.4101574293017448

These glucocorticoid hormone binding receptors are the mineralocorticoid receptor (MR) and the glucocorticoid receptor (GR).	0.4989195654155549

The following study investigated the effects of this intervention on aortic input impedance.	0.5355591284306263
In 8 pigs, the wall of the ascending aorta was wrapped with a prosthesis.	0.6127507747137054
This approach was chosen to minimize additional influence of extended operative procedures on the ascending aorta, like extracorporal circulation, cardioplegia or blood loss.	0.5206878005745581
Flow and pressure were recorded before and after the intervention, and following Fourier Transformation, the aortic input impedance was calculated.	0.6929578194757421

Microcallus formations are demonstrable in nearly all cancellous bones by means of suitable preparation techniques.	0.3919492927923055
Histologically, these structures are immature fibrous bone formed in local overloaded parts of the trabeculae.	0.4659959271333215
Using a preparation technique that allows combined two- and threedimensional analysis, 26 normal human spines and 11 osteoporotic spines were investigated for microcallus.	0.5476809266617384
Microcallus formations occur frequently in people over 45 years of age.	0.36512023580033864
They are mainly localized in the lower thoracic and lumbar spine and occur significantly more frequent in females than in males.	0.6288094992335129
The number of microcallus formations depends more on the microarchitecture of the cancellous bone than on individual trabecular parameters.	0.35564175345163856
In about 33 % of cases microfractures are demonstrable in the centre of the microcallus formation.	0.6804949404831004
In noninvasive studies the bone mass could be misinterpreted due to microcallus.	0.3164395977128903
Although it indicates instability of the bone structure, microcallus formation is not a purely negative mechanism.	0.6738958514582624
It stabilizes and regenerates the bone tissue.	0.20161231616608444
Furthermore, complete new trabeculae can be formed due to bridges of microcallus between residual trabeculae.	0.40198104085391434
Osteoporosis is not the result of an inability to form microcallus.	0.6792407194123946

Fractures of the distal metaphysis of the tibia often include an extension into the ankle.	0.6789504286544181
Intramedullary nailing combined with covered screw osteosynthesis should reduce the high incidence of soft tissue and ankle problems and should be an alternative to open plate fixation, with good ultimate functional outcome.	0.6767394764962811
Between January 1993 and December 1995, a prospective study on 49 patients with distal metaphyseal tibia fracture and involvement of the ankle was performed.	0.7238756524284599
All the fractures were treated with intramedullary nailing combined with covered screw osteosynthesis, and plate fixation in cases of fibula fractures.	0.6171217160486085
There were 27 men and 22 women with an average age of 46.4  +/-  12.7 years (range 21-90).	0.7835959676496451
In most studies of the use of intramedullary nailing in distal tibial fractures the classification has been inadequate.	0.4843894516912924
Therefore a new classification according to Robinson et al.	0.44964048520724564
(1995) was used: 10 fractures were type II B (20.4 %), 13 were type II C (26.5 %), and 26 patients suffered a combination of type II B and type II C (53.1 %).	0.7460748607872896
This fracture type was defined as type II D for use in this study.	0.5567384221761252
The severity of soft tissue injury was recorded using the Gustilo system in case of open (n = 19) and the Tscherne system in case of closed fractures (n = 30).	0.5822853238119663
In 31 patients distal tibia fracture was accompanied by a fracture of the fibula, which was first stablized using a plate.	0.7460902481321376
For reconstruction of the distal articular surface, covered screw osteosynthesis was done.	0.6086413615683355
At the next step intramedullary nails were inserted and were statically locked proximally and distally.	0.4296549536045968
From January 1993 to February 1994, the reamed AO standard nail was used.	0.4822116920679845
After introduction of the unreamed tibial nail (UTN) all fractures were treated by this implant.	0.6665958454688269
Full load on the operated leg was allowed after 8 weeks.	0.4528461685634304
Union of the fracture was assessed by standard radiological and clinical criteria.	0.7818065070338076
Misalignment was defined as more than 5  ° of angular rotation.	0.6961882535389216
Further surgery due to a valgus deformity in the ankle joint had to be done in three cases.	0.7395477197803303
There were no deep infections.	0.5541741150864393
Three patients had a superficial infection in the ankle area, but surgical debridement was not necessary.	0.8918317732265064
A leg shortening was found in 4 cases, but it was less than 1 cm in every case.	0.9295437360945937
Therefore, surgical correction was not done.	0.6293002177458031
Patients were reviewed at intervals of 2, 6, and 12 weeks, and after 6, and at least 12 months.	1.0731737007090676
All 49 patients were finally reviewed after an average time of 15.7 months (range 12-38).	0.752739533360003
Bone fusion was reached 12.8 weeks (range 9-21) after the operative treatment.	0.8286278277442889
A specific assessment of the ankle symptoms was made using the score of Olerud and Molander (1984).	0.5828550835066344
In 29 patients excellent results were recorded.	0.33660798827704097
A satisfactory result was attained with 17 patients and just 3 patients were found to be unsatisfactory.	0.5184494156973407
Although proximity of distal tibia fracture to the ankle makes the treatment more complicated than for fractures of the tibial diaphysis, closed intramedullary nailing combined with covered screw fixation is a good alternative to open reduction and plate fixation.	0.5689755647304382
The major advantages are closed procedure and simplified interlocking techniques.	0.32586363681366864
Therefore, closed intramedullary nailing combined with covered screw fixation is a safe and effective method of managing this type of fracture.	0.5799901016581619

The beneficial effects of anxiolytics, however, appear to be difficult to prove.	0.49266363570157595
In this study a comparison was made of heart rate (HR), blood pressure (BP), and norepinephrine, epinephrine, and cortisol levels.	0.7533927887146747
In group I 19 children recieved only psychological treatment, while in group II 21 children received 0.2 mg/kg midazolam orally.	0.7088132138474555
Measuring points were directly before medication, 30 min afterward, and at induction of anaesthesia.	0.716548932635809
During the observation period the patients (5-10 years old) remained calm.	0.7921769766215471
At the beginning of the study the parameters of all patients were within a normal range; 30 min after premedication the HR and BP were significantly higher in group I than in group II.	0.9170542718758894
In contrast to group I, epinephrine levels in group II were lower at the beginning of anaesthesia than before premedication.	0.639997246082174
In both groups, norepinephrine levels were the same at induction of anaesthesia as before premedication.	0.48243685245363527
Cortisol decreased only in patients who received midazolam.	0.8325894421517925
HR, BP, as well as humoral stress parameters indicate that midazolam in a dose of 0.2 mg/kg orally is sufficient to reduce preoperative stress in children.	0.5348244011702499

The incidence of hepatitis A infections has decreased due to improved hygienic conditions in Germany.	0.5026569644423973
However, hepatitis A is one of the most important diseases imported to the country.	0.6989286129365492
Currently, more than the half of all registered hepatitis A infections are acquired in foreign countries.	0.632150446064591
According to the decreased morbidity over the past few decades most younger people (age below 50 years) are not immunized and, subsequently, this age group is at higher risk during exposure in foreign countries.	0.7651396629911521
Therefore, a hepatitis A vaccination is recommended before travelling in countries with a higher incidence of hepatitis A (Southern Europe, Africa, South America, and Asia).	0.6081316903429613
Lactic Acid Bacteria (LAB) are a group of Gram-positive organism, which have in common a fermentative metabolism with lactic acid as the major end-product.	0.7180716614231587
Except for bifidobacteria, the LAB are phylogenetically closely related.	0.46975754867681574
They directly contribute to human well-being as they are the most important germs in the production process of fermented foods which constitute one fourth of our diet.	0.5904939318722913
They are, furthermore, an essential component of the mucosal flora and especially of the intestinal flora.	0.7240462716455034
The genus Streptococcus contains highly pathogenic species which can be clearly differentiated from the useful germs.	0.4594838974982501
The intestinal flora contains such species of the genus Lactobacillus that are also important in food fermentation and species which are strongly adapted to the intestines and therefore, can be found exclusively in this ecological niche.	0.5300809788880094
A special status characterises bifidobacteria and enterococci.	0.32478791877558194
The former are located in a separate phylogenetic branch and also occur virtually exclusively in the intestines.	0.47415196464683146
Enterococci are rather ubiquitous, participate in indigenous food fermentations, are found in the mucosal flora and are counted as opportunistic pathogens.	0.48573245813800797
To influence the intestinal flora and to achieve health promoting effects LAB are isolated from the intestinal flora, grown and employed either as pharmaceutical preparations or additions to food (usually fermented milk).	0.4619543235840925
These bacteria are termed "probiotics".	0.2980795777330747
The exposition of consumers to high numbers of germs belonging to one or a few species needs an evaluation of their safety for human health.	0.4357749868728233
In this process the traditional experience with the safe nature of the species can serve as an important criterion.	0.6482743570008227
In front of this background, LAB in probiotics can be considered to be especially safe, nevertheless some restrictions have to be made.	0.588319531550495
Generally, the germs used should not contain genes encoding transmissible resistance to antibiotics.	0.44201554004053134
In addition they should not produce biogenic amines (e.g.	0.23945942179894578
histamine, tyrosine or phenylethylamine) and should not degrade mucine.	0.5246600158978414
The assessment may also include the following: absence of a potential for deconjugation of bile salts, induction of platelet aggregation and binding to fibrinogen and fibronectine.	0.47472555996243765
These examinations may be required as certain LAB have been identified in clinical isolates.	0.5729385967571939
The isolates were, however, obtained in the most majority of cases from debilitated patients.	0.5310841196919336
The germs were components of the body flora as well as of the environment, organisms deliberately employed in food fermentations or probiotics have never been isolated.	0.5975099112260186
Dural sinus thrombosis is not uncommon.	0.28716215814999163
Due to the nonspecific symptomatology, as well as the manifold etiology, clinical diagnosis may be difficult.	0.7265640324890059
In these cases imaging procedures are frequently crucial in deciding how to proceed and how to treat.	0.522609761823919
The aim of our study was to evaluate the diagnostic utility of helical CT in the detection of dural sinus thrombosis.	0.6218241203667185
In 20 patients with clinically suspected thrombosis CT angiography was performed.	0.658682148505603
In 6 patients dural sinus thrombosis was diagnosed.	0.48336569647322036
In order to acquire also arterial vessels, a short delay of about 22 s after the onset of the application of contrast medium was selected.	0.7036753908397045
By this method we found an occlusion of the MCA in two patients with clinically suspected sinus thrombosis.	0.789183488495169
In all patients the transverse slices and the multiplanar reconstructions showed filling defects or an "empty delta" sign.	0.5226727341976205
With irregular outlines the thrombus could be depicted over the complete course of the sinus.	0.5347328765153252
The MIP reconstructions were particularly helpful in the evaluation of the vessel anatomy and the pathological collateral venous drainage.	0.5424967752263834
In three patients MR angiograms were available for comparison.	0.5354665084021526
The smaller veins, such as the v. vermis inferior, were less clearly depicted than in CT angiography.	0.5919177407763158
CT angiography is a fast and reliable method to exclude or verify a sinus thrombosis.	0.5042644847392611
It can be performed immediately after non-enhanced CT.	0.6565327472601112
According to our present experience CT angiography is sufficient for the diagnosis of a sinus thrombosis.	0.7508123876389031
Coronary angiography ist considered to be the most important component in the diagnosis of coronary artery disease.	0.7776346964627023
Only the lumen may be visualized using contrast radiography of the coronary arteries, however.	0.5755841157835366
With intravascular ultrasound, on the other hand, pathological changes in the vascular wall can be recorded.	0.638483312103542
Despite typical symptoms, an angiographical image of the coronary arteries is sometimes unable to show unambiguous stenotic lesions of the coronary arteries.	0.6290513183472777
In such cases, intravascular ultrasound provides a new complementary diagnostic tool for detecting even early forms of arteriosclerosis or angiographically underestimated coronary findings.	0.4797302082601795
Two cases are used to illustrate this.	0.6206735788199724
In those, angiographic visualization of the coronary arteries was unable to produce an unambiguous finding despite typical clinical symptoms, yet intravascular ultrasound could detect considerable arteriosclerotic wall changes.	0.4952412288778671
