The risk to health posed by a sedentary lifestyle is a problem of our times.	0.43947748781515994
In contrast to the previous assumption that only fairly high-intensity sporting exercise undertaken over a minimum period of 20 min produces health-related benefits, recent studies have shown that even everyday activitites (climbing stairs, brisk walking and cycling) can have a benedicial effects on health, particularly in those who take little exercise.	0.6057679512847198
So now the recommendation is: exercise of moderate intensity lasting 30 min at least 5 times a week, corresponding to an energy consumption of about 150 kacl/day or 1000 kcal/week.	0.40255334958000977
The results of experimental studies on sport and arthritis and sport and osteoporosis point to the advisability of taking up or maintaining an active sporting lifestyle.	0.4747786226336524
For one thing, it can be assumed that a moderate amount of movement does not increase the risk of developing arthritis: for another, sporting activity during early and late childhood produces a high maximum bone mass, therby delaying the development of osteoporosis in later life.	0.5848267546844026
The new guidelines on the extent and intensity of health-giving exercise make it easier to advocate exercise and sport for disease prevention and health promotion because they appear to implement.	0.49266094865284704
More difficult, however, is deciding on a suitable method for motivating inactive individuals to increase their level of physical acitivity.	0.48196032056809585
A model that has proved effective in smoking cessation programmes, and one that can also be applied to exercise counselling (transtheoretical model), can help in the selection of an appropriate counselling strategy.	0.69944917481547
Depending on whether an individual is inactive, or sporadically or regularly active, each one employs his or her own strategies primarily to maintain this lifestyle.	0.49316452342015793
Assuming that the counselling is adapted to the level of activity, the patient's attitude and behaviour can be influenced both more effectively and more economically.	0.6960515443312414

Beginning in the 1920s Wilhelm Reich developed the fundamental concepts of a body-oriented psychotherapy out of psychoanalysis.	0.4095661226767054
He started from considerations of egopathology, sexuality and the analysis of resistance and character patterns.	0.420769174340701
Characterological and bodily attitudes were understood as defence-patterns against emotions, which function not only psychologically but also bodily.	0.4219709706671695
Thus he began to mobilize repressed affects through working on muscular tensions and bodily expressions.	0.25772942880519206
That way their meaning in the person's history could be understood and a self-healing process restarted.	0.46731867772688734
This approach to release constrained energy is still valid for neoreichian schools such as bioenergetics, biodynamics, biosynthesis and others whose understanding of human nature and of healing processes is similar to those of other schools of humanistic psychotherapy.	0.4565286222901049
Bodily processes are used as indicators for the processes and successes of therapies.	0.47827035259974565
Besides there are impulses in modern body psychotherapies to work with the body in the relationship and transference process and attempts to reintegrate psychoanalytical concepts.	0.49259683150063405
Recurrent phlebothromboses in young patients with subsequent severe postthrombotic syndrome and chronic venous leg ulcers may be caused by underlying hereditary disorders of hemostasis or may occur as part of other congenital syndromes.	0.47454974082029827
The most common hereditary disorders of hemostasis in this respect appear to be deficiencies of antithrombin III, protein C, and protein S, and activated protein C resistance (mutations of factor V).	0.6879299698155419
Less frequently, dysfibrinogenemia, increased plasminogen activator inhibitor levels, or deficiencies of tissue plasminogen activator or heparin cofactor II may be found.	0.5310926001881081

Early diagnosis of these disorders will allow timely treatment, preventive care and counselling of patients as well as family members.	0.6079791206580775
Epidurography with contrast medium is used to verify the correct poition of an epidural catheter and to detect malpositioning.	0.5430213196832525
There is great variability in the distribution of contrast medium according to the individual morphology of the epidural space and the way it is injected.	0.704407407723003
Results of investigations of the anatomy of the spinal canal and epidural space performed with anatomic specimens, epiduroscopy, and conventional and computed tomographic (CT) epidurography are sometimes contradictory.	0.5469520961620418
We have performed CT epidurography in approximately 30 patients to date.	0.4814721837228039
Insights regarding the distribution of contrast medium in the epidural space can help to interpret conventional epidurographies and to explain special features, such as the "rail-road-track phenomenon" or the plica mediana dorsalis.	0.6568150581468543
Patients scheduled for major abdominal operations were studied.	0.31686231134889387
Catheters were introduced into the thoracic epidural space on the day before the operation.	0.5320919171883656
Conventional epidurographies were performed routinely after insertion of the catheters with a mobile X-ray apparatus, usually in the recovery room, using 5 ml iopamidol (Solutrast 250 M).	0.5845810799228288
Selected patients (good mental state and stable psychic condition), after written consent and with approval of the local ethical committee, were investigated with CT epidurography using the same contrast medium (partly diluted).	0.6508938461776513
From among the CT scans performed until now, five characteristic images are presented and compared to conventional epidurographies.	0.725072258081427
When small volumes (5 mL) of iopamidol were injected slowly, we regularly observed a railroad-track phenomenon in the AP images of conventional epidurographies.	0.675377970754858
After rapid injection of larger volumes (10 - 15 ml), the spread was more homogeneous and sometimes outline a lighter zone of contrast distribution in the midline.	0.6611541613003523
CT epidurography in these cases (5 out of 30 patients) revealed a plica mediana dorsalis.	0.8331112365687398
In the majority of the CT scans of the thoracic epidural space its anterior (ventral) compartment was unfilled by contrast medium.	0.6021168496503895
According to the findings of several investigators, dura mater and ligamentum longitudinale posterius have grown together, so that an epidural space does not exist in ventral thoracic segments of the spinal canal.	0.5756680832608095
In lower thoracic and lumbar segments both structures are separate, and a wide anterior epidural space was present and filled with contrast medium.	0.6660756734233251
In other cases the dorsal and dorsolateral epidural space was completely filled, but the contrast medium stopped behind the spinal nerves and surrounding dural sheaths, as if these structures, together with the connective tissue strands between them, formed a membrane that spread in a frontal plane.	0.5881332795113117
A railroad-track phenomenon is interpreted in the literature as the X-ray correlate of contrast medium spread in the subdural space, indicating an incorrect catheter position.	0.6243616657482987
According to conventional epidurographies and confirmed by CT scans, this feature is also seen regulary in cases with correct catheter position.	0.6908383562261783
Small volumes of iopamidol spread preferentially into the wider parts of the epidural space between the gaps of the vertebral arcs, whereas the dura mater and periosteal layers touch at the inner side of the pedicules and laminae, allowing the existence of only a potential epidural space.	0.5833420360477353
This rhythmic widening and narrowing of the epidural space is the explanation of the "railroad track" in AP contrast epidurographies.	0.5361692166752947
CT epidurography is a valuable tool to provide better insight into the morphology of the epidural space when filled with fluid (contrast medium, local anaesthetics), complementing findings using epiduroscopy and anatomic specimens.	0.5337850056198964
It stands to reason that this time- and cost-expensive method can never replace conventional epidurographies, but can help to interpret them properly.	0.7057790217867838
A 71-year-old woman suffered from pronounced erosion of her nose after soft X-ray therapy (total dose 28 Gy, half dose depth 10.5-11.5 mm).	0.710094688426304
5 weeks after the end of the irradiation no healing tendency was observed.	0.4635174416053095

There were 16 (27%) subjects with PD who also had symptoms of cerebrovascular disease.	0.5803375941355062
The frequencies of carotid stenoses, ischemic brain lesions and most of cerebrovascular risk factors seen in the latter group was comparable with those of stroke patients and significantly higher than in the investigational subsets of patients with "pure" PD and normals.	0.6912417530807623
Only one (1.6%) individual with PD presented signs suggestive of an ischemic etiology of parkinsonism.	0.6657622291202715
These findings suggest that cerebrovascular disease occurs in approximately one fourth of patients with PD, but seldomly is causally related.	0.6329981078682984

The tendency towards sphincter-preserving resection for distal rectal cancers has led to a revival of the technique of coloanal anastomosis (CAA) in recent years.	0.6092341172358028
In order to improve functional results, creation of a colonic J-pouch in conjunction with a coloanal anastomosis (CPA) was proposed.	0.5791085493174273
Two different operation techniques exist: i) Double-stapling with the anastomosis close to the dentate line and ii) intersphincteric resection with the anastomosis located immediately at the dentate line.	0.5888224068987313
A long rectal remnant after double-stapling leads to urgency in 15 % of the patients due to stool retention in the atonic remnant.	0.5580393719869032
No propulsive motility patterns were recorded from the pouch which is emptyed passively by upper colonic peristalsis.	0.30953236714408644
Therefore colonic pouches should be fashionned of descending colon and should not exceed a length of 6 cm in order to prevent stool fragmentation.	0.5046403710216243
Under these conditions the average stool frequency is reduced from 2-6 /d after CAA to 1-3 /d after CPA.	0.7097576101881117
This effect is maximal during the first postoperative months, but is still significant after 3 years.	0.8895066512500938
Colonic pouch construction also leads, due to better blood supply and prevention of pelvic hematomas, to a significant decrease of the anastomotic insufficiency rate from 10,0 % after CAA to 5,4 % after CPA.	0.7721500113461105
Therefore creation of a colonic J-pouch should be combined with coloanal reconstruction if the oncologic situation allows a sphincter-preserving procedure.	0.37817707818247387

The abstinence syndrome was much more intense in the methadone group (convulsions 47.1%) than in heroin-exposed babies without methadone treatment (convulsions 27.1%).	0.5492556799119263
Women in methadone maintenance programs lived in more stable socioeconomic conditions than opiate-addicted women without methadone substitution.	0.36106672599801903
Moreover, they cared significantly better for their babies: 81.3% of the methadone mothers visited their children on a regular basis and 90.9% cared adequately.	0.5645419603237994
The data emphasize the need in future research to look more closely at the role of methadone treatment programs in the development of opiate-exposed babies.	0.48685257194638976

A diagnostic scoring system, recently published by Ohmann et al.	0.4563506759389773
in this journal, was validated by analyzing the clinicopathological data of a consecutive series of 2,359 patients, admitted for suspicion of acute appendicitis.	0.6354223607434558
The results of the scoring system were compared to the results of clinical evaluation by junior (provisional) and senior surgeons (final clinical diagnosis).	0.693597976545246
To assess the diagnostic ability of the score, the accuracy and positive predictive value were defined as the major diagnostic performance parameters; the rate of theoretical negative laparotomies and that of diagnostic errors served as the major procedural performance parameters.	0.7285143775323927
Of 2,359 patients admitted for suspected acute appendicitis, 662 were proven to have acute appendicitis by histology, for a prevalence of 28 %.	0.6051436629027288
The overall sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value, negative predictive value, and accuracy of the provisional clinical diagnosis were 0.50, 0.94, 0.77, 0.83, and 0.82; 0.93, for the score 0.63, 0.93, 0.77, 0.86 and 0.84, and for the final clinical diagnosis 0.90, 0.94, 0.85, 0.96, and 0.93, respectively.	0.7145231648413252
Of the main diagnostic performance parameter, the accuracy of the score was signifianctly better than that of provisional clinical diagnosis (P < 0.05, 2 test).	0.7287231659160929
The score yielded a rate of negative appendecomies and laparotomies of 14.3 and 12.3 %.	0.572073517706067
With respect to the rate of overlooked cases of acute apendicitis, the score demonstrated a superior performance, with only 6 cases missed (0.9 %).	0.714990237714332
However, the number of patients with acute appendicitis, including those with perforated disease, who were not identified by the score, was almost four times that of the final clinical diagnosis (245 vs 63).	0.8349264309614708
With regard to the main procedural performance parameter, the score resulted in a significantly smaller number of diagnostic errors than the provisional clinical investigator (P < 0.05, 2 test).	0.6368006731028959
The results of this study indicate that the diagnostic scoring system might be helpful when experienced investigators or additional diagnostic modalities such as ultrasonography are not available.	0.722555516894665
It may therefore be of value in the preclinical evaluation of patients with suspected acute appendicitis and may be instrumental as a quality control tool and in clinical guidelines.	0.6240799166264572

In patients with acute or chronic myocarditis, arrhythmias are a common and often the only clinical symptom in the natural course of the disease.	0.7007088572216817
The potentially malignant tachy- and bradyarrhythmias are of particular significance in the differential diagnosis of sudden cardiac death in myocarditis.	0.6012933942009123
Factors responsible for the increased incidence of cardiac arrhythmias are structural changes, parameters of ventricular dynamics and vascular changes.	0.5510190339980023
On the one hand, inflammatory processes in the cardiac myocytes and interstitium can lead directly to fluctuations in membrane potential.	0.4722303510643201
Fibrosis and scarring of the myocardial tissue and secondary hypertrophy and atrophy of the myocytes favor the development of ectopic pacemakers, late potentials and reentry as a result of inhomogeneous stimulus conduction.	0.5157854448573252
Furthermore, parameters of ventricular dynamics such as increased wall tension, increased myocardial oxygen consumption and diminished coronary reserve in the case of disturbed systolic or diastolic left ventricular function also contribute to the increased incidence of arrhythmias.	0.5823591999110338
Lastly, vascular factors can further increase the arrhythmogenicity of the inflamed myocardium through the disturbance of micro- and macrovascular perfusion and the resulting myocardial ischemia.	0.6155173387747984
Non-invasive rhythmological evaluation by 24 h Holter ECG, measurement of ventricular late potentials and heart rate variability can be used for orienting risk stratification of the at-risk patient with myocarditis.	0.6287481727429933
Programmed atrial and ventricular electrophysiological stimulation also has a relatively high predictive value for spontaneous ventricular tachyarrhythmias.	0.5754112829052568
It should be emphasized that, at the present time, optimal electrophysiological parameters with a high predictive value do not exist.	0.6574718616272546
In a selected patient population, immunosuppressive therapy in addition to conventional antiarrhythmic therapy can lead to the reduction or complete suppression of spontaneous and inducible arrhythmias.	0.6193905547482528
Nevertheless, in the interim, further precautionary antiarrhythmic measures such as serial antiarrhythmic treatment, VT ablation and AICD implantation are necessary in patients with malignant cardiac arrhythmias.	0.6087114724412777
Right ventricular myocardial biopsy for demonstration or exclusion of myocarditis is an important additional examination which can improve the differential diagnosis and treatment of patients with cardiac arrhythmias of unclear etiology.	0.6896717912493294

The media had in its axis direction the lowest reparative potential for regenerating the continuity break.	0.31792773845393996

A differentiation is made between patient information on findings and diagnosis, patient information on avoidance of known dangers, and patient information on the risks involved in a particular intervention that has been selected.	0.694369206097481
If no information is given on the risks inherent in a patient's condition and how she must proceed in order to ensure that they do not come about, this is considered to be a treatment error, and in these circumstances the intervention is then legally seen as bodily harm.	0.8160419920507447
Information on the risks involved in an intervention must be given in good time, which generally means on the day before the operation.	0.7022596291503409
An exception is made to this rule for day surgery.	0.3816991331764987
The patient must be informed about treatment alternatives when the method selected is not the method of choice or when there is an alternative offering equivalent chances but risks of a different kind.	0.7283412221005372

A bacterial contribution to atherosclerosis appears more relevant if the resident mesenchymal cells of the vascular wall that constitute the plaque can support chlamydial infection continuously.	0.44005348761478785
The study consists of a prospective randomized controlled clinical trial of patients undergoing laparoscopic cholecystectomy.	0.8200241221372156
Besides medical and sociodemographic data, two personality factors - self-efficacy and locus of control - were found to predict postoperative pain.	0.7976310700638487
Self-efficacy describes the expectations of a person to successfully execute the behavior required to produce behavioral outcomes.	0.4616299596187698
Locus of control, in the extreme case, is a personality factor which is represented by an internal orientation in which the individual believes that rewards are brought about by his own action, versus an external orientation, in which the individual believes that rewards are the result of powerful others or chance factors and fate.	0.6536698668445134
We postulate that the two personality factors correlate with postoperative parameters of pain and that there are also multiple correlations between them.	0.6032649589158866

In 7 patients a hematological disorder was confirmed by bone marrow biopsy.	0.5893810108654232

Heart rate variability (HrV) has been established as an important risk parameter in patients surviving myocardial infaction.	0.6984054124601144
Recently, analysis of HRV - particularly of the standard deviation of NN intervals (SDNN) - from short term ECG recordings has been proposed as an alternative to that from 24 hour Holter monitorings.	0.728297516479635
The present study is the first to compare SDNN from short term recordings to that from 24 hour recordings with respect to risk stratification after myocardial infarction.	0.6973493997546933
In 60 patients at the time of discharge from the hospital, SDNN from Holter monitoring averaged 93  +/-  30 ms compared to 39  +/-  18 determined from short term recordings.	0.6789735296054862
Patients with a prospectively defined clinical endpoint differed significantly from those with an uneventful course with respect to age, left ventricular ejection fraction, mean RR interval from Holter recording ( 753  +/-  153 vs 921  +/-  132 ms), mean RR from short term recording (783  +/-  153 vs 914  +/-  163 ms), and SDNN from the Holter recording (71  +/-  27 vs 97  +/-  29 ms; p < 0.001) However, patients with and without clinical event could not be seperated by means of SDNN measured from short term ECG registrations (35  +/-  22 vs 41  +/-  19 ms; P = NS).	0.6848717630166
Thus, SDNN measured from short term ECG recordings does not seem to be useful regarding risk stratification of patients after myocardial infarction.	0.6162227913255007
Analysis of HRV should be performed using 24 hour Holter monitoring, which provides more information and reflects circadian fluctuation in autonomic tone.	0.6258635517120082

Some of these techniques have been adapted for use in intensive care patients whilst being mechanically ventilated.	0.8063560914802509
However, most measurement setups are bulky, cumbersome to use and their running costs are high.	0.4997909477511916

Up to now most efforts to improve and simplify FRC measurement were made at the expense of accuracy.	0.45778563358261176
An ideal method ought to be accurate, easy to handle and cost-effective.	0.5118027549929138

These demands can be met using modern data acquisition software.	0.3010033180110747
The pros and cons of all methods available for FRC measurement are discussed in view of their suitability for intensive care patients.	0.5989527505441139
A conventional nitrogen washout using emission spectroscopy for measurement of nitrogen concentration gives satisfying exact values for the determination  of the parameters mentioned above.	0.5238082503582632

Blisters had never developed and did not occur during follow up.	0.5063221921263625

The report encompasses a short biography, including Virchow's nonmedical activities.	0.4804770826422186

assaults, etc.).	0.24476371167265734
When a starter's pistol is loaded with blank cartridges and is fired, a powerful shooting noise results.	0.4174746966591534
The level of the noise produced is high enough to cause acoustic trauma.	0.46819253452620274
For legal examinations and giving an expert opinion further information is needed about the power of such noise.	0.4479446362815917
We examined how high peak sound pressure levels were of the gunshots of blank cartridges and whether there existed any directional characteristics from the noise emissions.	0.40944475604991387
In all, 15 different models of starter's pistols of 8 different calibres were examined.	0.44837205913687167
In addition to blank cartridges, 8 mm tear gas cartridges were also examined.	0.5702631364561024
Four transducers were situated in the horizontal plane around the muzzle: 0 ° (shooting direction), 45 °, 90 °, and 180 ° (towards the firer).	0.6435232592822483
The distances between the transducers and the muzzle were 25 cm, 50 cm, 100 cm, and 200 cm.	0.5857646983350753
At a distance of 1 m and in the 0 ° shooting direction the peak sound pressure levels of nearly all weapons tested exceeded 160 dB.	0.5346905206840835
At a shooting distance of 25 cm the peak sound pressure levels reached 181 dB.	0.36808988397167497

We have identified 2 intravascular sites in the superior (SVC) and inferior vena cava (IVC) where parasympathetic nerves, which innervate the atrioventricular node, can be stimulated electrically.	0.6089349621756277
In 8 dogs, a 7-F catheter with an expandable electrode basket at its tip was non-fluoroscopically positioned in the SVC and in the proximal IVC (time for positioning: 3-5 minutes).	0.6836355252188978
High-frequency electrical parasympathetic stimulation (PS) with 20 Hz at an impulse duration of 0.1 ms was performed during pacing induced AF.	0.6157121544291169
Results: With increasing stimulus strength, a graded ventricular rate slowing was observed during PS in the SVC and IVC (P<0.01, ANOVA).	0.6496828489004044
The negative dromotropic effect started instantaneously after onset of PS and ceased immediately after termination of PS.	0.3837491789437462
During ventricular pacing at a constant rate, no decrease of the arterial blood pressure was observed during PS.	0.8567446320330209
PS in the IVC yielded significantly lower stimulation thresholds than in the SVC.	0.5322025174778812
Conclusions: Transvenous parasympathetic stimulation for ventricular rate control during AF can easily be achieved in the SVC and IVC in dogs.	0.5114084264959706
This procedure may provide a foundation for investigating the usefulness of PS in humans.	0.4542741760944858
If the results translate to patients, PS may be very beneficial in the treatment of AF in patients with congestive heart failure.	0.5012776113658759

This entity, which can be subdivided into 3 groups including subgroups, predominantly begins during childhood and progresses slowly.	0.5726561010449163

The first description, based on six cases, was published in 1986 by Yousem and Hochholzer.	0.5561553288862676

Gene therapy involves the transfer of functional genes into somatic cells and their expression in target tissues in order to replace absent genes, correct defective genes, or induce antitumoral activity in the tumor-bearing host.	0.6069816382616798
Currently, an increasing number of gene therapy strategies are being investigated in experimental and clinical trials.	0.6207835976963576

Using the PTB simulator, which emits real signals from patients, we examined the precision of the oscillometric blood pressure measurement with the Dinamap 1846 (Critikon) and the HP M-1008B (Hewlett Packard).	0.6205243067017596
For this purpose we simultaneously registered invasive arterial pulsewave, cuff pressure and cuff pressure oscillations of 20 patients from our intensive care unit and stored them in the database of the simulator.	0.5648309789431173
The invasive reference blood pressure values were determined following the recommendations given by the Association for the Advancement of Medical Instrumentation.	0.5627278963920938
The invasive system showed a cut-off frequency of 35 Hz; the damping constant was 0.21.	0.5182564591416235
With 49 record signals from patients we carried out 15 simulated measurements each.	0.33190012630203763
From a total of 49 bio-signals from patients the Dinamap 1846 was able to process 41 signals and the HP M-1008B 47 signals.	0.4446632100750552
The mean error of the oscillometric blood pressure measurement of the systolic, diastolic and mean arterial pressure amounted to -2.50 mmHg, 3.35 mmHg (P<0.05) and 1.51 mmHg with the Dinamap 1846 and to -8.5 mmHg (P<0.001), -5.15 mmHg (P<0.001) and -5.58 mmHg (P<0.001) for the HP M-1008B.	0.7884280209319781
The 95% confidence limit for the systolic, diastolic and the mean arterial pressure amounts to 56 mmHg, 30 mmHg and 35 mmHg for the Dinamap 1846 and 50 mmHg, 38 mmHg and 35 mmHg for the HP M-1008B.	0.5236543365776666
The differences between that two instruments could be caused by the different algorithms for the calculation of blood pressure values and different artefact detection and elimination techniques.	0.6002131378984379
The results of the performance tests we achieved with the PTB simulator correspond to the results of other clinical examinations.	0.6434248894862811
The American Association for the Advanecement of Medical Instrumentation recommends a maximum mean error of 5 +/- 8 mmHg.	0.5419143887959652
None of the examined instruments lay within these limits.	0.4691830826059668
Due to the systematic and stochastic errors, we think that the Dinamap 1846 (Critikon) and the HP M-1008B (Hewlett Packard) do not achieve performance levels that are adequate for measuring critically ill patients.	0.5267817153123008
Many patients consulting medical emergency services make the initial contact because of psychiatric emergency situations.	0.3618362707930774
However, emergency physicians and their assistants are usually not sufficiently experienced in psychiatry.	0.5432301543960393
Therefore, psychiatric emergencies are sometimes only reluctantly accepted or inadequately treated by these services.	0.4153365884092778
Our present contribution aims at improving this situation.	0.27063597049364096

3 different types of complex spinal trauma are defined: Type I means a multilevel contiguous or non contiguous unstable injury, type II is described as a spinal injury with concommitant thoracic or abdominal lesion, typ III stands for the coincidence of spinal injury and polytrauma.	0.538626838780177
Overlapping of different types occurs.	0.4362821020630722
Type I: The incidence amounts according a german multicenter study to about 2,5 %.	0.7101469348642483
Multilevel injuries need to be stabilized for a long distance from posterior.	0.5692860811388583
With a thoroughful analysis the segments to be fused are determined.	0.397622972153766
Typ II: The leading thoracic injury is a lung contusion which occurs in up to 50 % of the cases.	0.6948620951257466
A CT scan of the thorax during the first diagnostic screening is recommended.	0.6210195150551356
Early reduction and stabilization from posterior should be aimed at.	0.3958367648282602
During the first two weeks anterior procedures are contraindicated.	0.676942490618324
Abdominal injuries are to be found in 3-4 % of all spinal injuries.	0.8760946784165857
All organs could be affected.	0.2262211560875916
A typical constallation is the "seat-belt syndrome" with lesions of the upper abdominal organs and a flexiondistraction injury of the upper lumbar spine.	0.6653074396688361
The main problem is to make the diagnosis of both components initially.	0.7018684762332692
Most of the patients may be treated in one operation by first taking care of the abdominal injury and than stabilazing the spine.	0.7923643537448212
The prognosis of this combination is favorable.	0.6198926865199579
Typ III: In 17-18 % of all polytraumatized patients lesions of the spine are to be diagnosed.	0.8795460765418747
From these only one third need surgical care.	0.39605212818748037
From 680 patients with operatively treated fractures of the thoracolumbar junction 6,2 % were polytraumatized according to the multicenter study mentioned above.	0.6594581696592966
The risk of missing a spinal injury in polytrauma totals approximately 20 %.	0.4237958192936401
Surgical stabilization should be performed in the primary phase (day-1-surgery).	0.8697404095905464
Additional injuries, potentially time consuming operations with a high blood loss sometimes necessitate a different approach.	0.6048188145615296
Non stabilized spinal injuries apparently do not have the same negative effect on the whole organism as long bone fractures.	0.6037613882769861
In the early phase of treatment on the C-spine only anterior procedures and on the thoraco-lumbar spine only posterior techniques should be applied.	0.6784900484866659
Experimental studies have shown that in traffic accidents with frontal impact the new airbag system can significantly reduce the incidence of severe injuries and fatal outcome.	0.5238917585505888
The question of whether the airbag itself induces specific patterns of injury needs further investigation.	0.5072650273256952
Two cases of traffic accidents with airbag protection are presented here.	0.49966052954233625
The first case report clearly shows the life-saving and injury-reducing effect of the airbag system in a traffic accident with frontal impact at 100 km/h.	0.555511815131825
In the second case only minor injuries of the face were diagnosed initially.	0.7409314075394159
Hemodynamic instability occurred after 3 h of hospitalization due to rupture of the azygos vein.	0.4609518332056364
Analysis of the presented cases shows that, besides the well-known benefits, there are certain injury patterns that seem to be related to the use of airbags.	0.7304363938073908
These have not been described before.	0.5312216232434076
It is concluded that patients who were involved in traffic accidents with airbag deployment have to be hospitalized and followed up carefully over time, even though they are initially stable, as potentially fatal sequelae of deceleration trauma can occur later.	0.6593881587473664
In our opinion it is not possible to estimate the severity of airbag-associated injuries with conventional methods.	0.744444653846786

Proliferation or clonogenic tumor cells most likely is the major mechanism underlying this phenomenon.	0.4363628147625841

Possibilities to minimize the time factor are briefly discussed.	0.5526889807415791

A strong correlation was found between TSS and the rising popularity of hyperabsorbent tampons.	0.4942923796089802

Menstrual and nonmenstrual forms of TSS are differentiated.	0.27324388031234625
The nonmenstrual form is comparatively rare and has a high rate of mortality rate.	0.585168878755364
Several studies showed that the overall incidence of menstrual and nonmenstrual TSS is approximately 1-3 cases per 100 000 persons.	0.6107521330110208

However, due to the low incidence of TSS, this method of detection has not yet been taken up in the routine diagnostic procedures.	0.7663810477882074

Results from typing MRSA originating from different clinical sources in all Germany reveal that there is a continuing interhospital dissemination of definite epidemic strains and also a spread of the mecA gene to clonal groups of S. aureus which have been until now sensitive.	0.5021957996497693
These newly emerging MRSA are still sensitive to a number of other antibiotics.	0.41176044979733195
This results in less broad resistance phenotypes of currently disseminated MRSA.	0.29829340598569204

It totally stops eye movement as well as sensitivity to pain.	0.3133050694203536

Aortic dissection with no entry or false lumen flow was recently identified as intramural hemorrhage of the aortic wall (IMH).	0.4843294078781988
Analysis of the literature revealed 209 cases of in vivo diagnosed IMH reflecting 17% of all dissections, whereas in autoptic studies this condition is found in 4-13%.	0.8115480450014885
Transesophageal echocardiography, computed tomography, magnetic resonance imaging and aortography (to rule out dissection) have been applied for diagnosing IMH in 57, 49, 43 and 38% of the cases, respectively.	0.6391375562319057
However, diagnostic accuracy of each modality is not available to date.	0.6805954369325297
In 34%, IMH involves the ascending aorta (type A).	0.5569275020566086
The average age of patients with IMH ranges between 55 and 65 years; 65% are males.	0.7009365821147979
In 12%, IMH was associated with abdominal aortic aneurysm.	0.5438070949280581
With 87%, arterial hypertension is the predominant risk factor for IMH irrespective of its location.	0.5648971212543095
As suggested by the term "mediastinal apoplexy" IMH may - similar to cerebral apoplexy - result from hypertensive rupture of the vasa vasorum in the aortic media.	0.5442029185908779
With 97%, the majority of patients present with acute chest or back pain similar to classic dissection.	0.6042215164669317
Mediastinal widening is found in 83%; signs of hemothorax/pleural effusion are present in 38%, acute aortic regurgitation in 26%, pericardial effusion in 23%, acute neurologic deficits in 12%, and pulse deficits in 5%.	0.5833827694637255
In 18%, IMH progresses to dissection and in another 15% to rupture.	0.7338763601351934
In 25% and 28%, respectively, dissection and rupture occur in the ascending aorta and in 12% and 9%, respectively, in the descending thoracic aorta.	0.8043598463265997
The 30-day mortality of IMH is 24% (36% with type A and 12% with type B IMH; p<0.05).	0.6825265621576346
With surgical repair, mortality of type A IMH is lowered to 18% compared to 60% with medical treatment (p<0.01).	0.6437254825856388
In contrast, with 8% mortality associated with medical treatment, prognosis of type B IMH is more favorable without surgical intervention, the latter associated with a 30-day mortality of 33% (p<0.05).	0.693942948347817
Thus, IMH is a potential precursor of dissection and should be managed like dissection with undelayed surgical intervention in patients with type A IMH and with medical treatment in type B IMH.	0.7160026046167897

Entactogens have been reported to make users aware of previously unconscious feelings and experiences.	0.490822006141739
The "entactogenic" effect is the most typical of the psychedelic effects n 3,4-methylenedioxyamphetamine (MDMA).	0.5748372028699689
MDMA induces euphoria and acts stimulating, but the most common effect of MDMA is a heightened sense of "closeness" with other people.	0.6911228527495852

Ecstasy is not a novel substance.	0.6110463325020142

Cisatracurium - one of the ten stereoisomers of atracurium - is an intermediate long-acting non-depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agent.	0.7083696294855677
Cardiovascular reactions have been described after administration of cisatracurium or vecuronium in surgical patients.	0.6213119625218029
After approval by our institutional review board, 62 patients (ASA I-II) were randomly assigned to three groups to either receive 3xED95 or 5xED95 of cisatracurium or 3xED90 of vecuronium prior to intubation as a bolus.	0.49595237245956336
After oral premedication with 2 mg lormetazepam anaesthesia was induced with thiopental (4-12 mg/kg) and maintained with O2/N2O and isoflurane (1.5%-2%).	0.7085712378993989
Six minutes after administration of thiopental, patients received the muscle relaxant.	0.7235694929965132
Six minutes later 0.1-0.2 mg fentanyl was given and the trachea was intubated.	0.6298310247675587
Heart rate (HR) and blood pressure (BP) were monitored every minute.	0.6610109061748038
Changes of heart rate or blood pressure >20% compared to baseline were defined as clinically significant.	0.6520130414441986
After application of the study drug, median values of blood pressure and heart rate were stable.	0.7826833754377907
For each muscle relaxant, there were several patients who had statistically significant cardiovascular changes.	0.756352118874868
After 3xED95 cisatracurium, 3 of 21 patients exhibited haemodynamic changes >20% (2 exhibited hypotension and 1 tachycardia), while in the high-dose cisatracurium group 2 of 21 patients demonstrated a tachycardia that was predetermined to be statistically but not clinically significant.	0.7470681900310177
In the vecuronium group, 2 of 20 patients sustained statistically significant hypotension and 1 patient had statistically significant tachycardia.	0.7283717554257038
The frequency of all individual cardiovascular changes after the application of the muscle relaxant was not dose-dependent.	0.6243283449220242
After the administration of cisatracurium in two different doses (3xED95 and 5xED95) or vecuronium (3xED90) only minor cardiovascular changes were observed.	0.6014032615169668
Both drugs proved to be safe for use during induction of anaesthesia in patients ASA I-II.	0.531547867431218
With regard to its cardiovascular effects, cisatracurium shares with vecuronium the requirements of an ideal muscle relaxant.	0.48579142884365883

Autolyzed, antigen-extracted, allogenic (AAA) bone is an osteoinductive preparation of completely demineralized bone matrix.	0.3746184024030042
It has been clinically applied for years.	0.4562330004734801
In an experimental study in rabbits, we evaluated the influence of cortical bone and periosteum on the amount of bone formation following augmentation with AAA bone.	0.7022412252358464
Two implants of standardized size were placed on the femoral bone of rabbits.	0.52553725870146
A cell-excluding PTFE membrane was wrapped circularly around the femur as well as the anterior implant shielding the implant from the surrounding periosteum.	0.5102580891303713
The posterior implant was exposed directly to the periosteum while being shielded from the cortical bone by the membrane.	0.4343362350857559
Thus, two compartments were created selectively, preventing contact between the periosteum or cortical bone and the implants.	0.5999783820072335
For each compartment the area and volume of the induced new bone were evaluated by computerized radiograph analysis and quantitative CT (pQCT) scans.	0.489596609014975
Implantation of AAA bone led to new bone formation in both compartments.	0.5237906207270135
Contact of the periosteum and the implant led to an almost fourfold increase in bone volume.	0.581298466771328
Although bone formation showed interindividual variations, the difference of both compartments was highly significant using the Student's t-test for paired samples (P < 0.0001).	0.5347101366138339
The data show that periosteum is the primary source of new bone formation in augmentations with osteoinductive materials as it is rich in inducible progenitor cells and is well vascularized.	0.5753451677818868
In osseous augmentations with AAA bone, the periosteum should be preserved in order to achieve a close contact of the osteoinductive implant.	0.6143286178935807
Shielding from the periosteum, e.g., by cell-excluding membranes, leads to significantly less bone formation following implantation of AAA bone and should therefore be avoided.	0.6034228893578703

A frequent finding was euchromatization of chromatin.	0.22640674483090267

The antipyretic analgesics still comprise the most widely used group of analgesic compounds.	0.33340972880426417

A 38-year-old man presented with an intracranial extra-axial tumour at the base of the left posterior fossa which proved to be a meningeal melanocytoma.	0.6603665534222699
Meningeal melanocytoma is a rare, benign melanotic tumour of the leptomeninges occuring predominantly in the posterior fossa or the upper spinal cord in adults.	0.6398648082644551
It shows characteristic cytologic features with isomorphic epitheloid or spindle-shaped cells, often with prominent nucleoli and a variable content of intracytoplasmic melanin.	0.5017212443588869
It usually lacks signs of malignancy such as high mitotic rate, necroses or infiltrative growth and shows a low labeling index in proliferation marker studies.	0.38987779151743424
Its immunohistological profile with S-100 protein-, vimentin- and HMB-45-positive tumour cells is similar to that of (primary or metastatic) malignant melanoma.	0.7368393130257748
This differential diagnosis is crucial because of the totally different therapeutic and prognostic implications.	0.5987929702175594
Therefore, everyone dealing with surgical neuropathology should be familiar with the rare, but clinically important diagnosis of meningeal melanocytoma.	0.5387464328032552

An 81-year-old patient had prolonged competitive neuromuscular blockade with train-of-four ratios of 0.1 and 0.5, respectively, after two successive anaesthesia procedures (enflurane-N2O/O2; vecuronium-succinylcholine-sequence) for transurethral prostate resection.	0.6807582424490611
Although antagonism with neostigmine was promptly successful after the first, 65-min period of anaesthesia (1.5 mg vecuronium for precurarization, 100 mg succinylcholine for intubation, 3 mg vecuronium), repetitive and chronologically staggered administration of neostigmine after the second, 30-min period of anaesthesia (1 mg vecuronium for precurarization, 100 mg succinylcholine for intubation) had hardly any effect, so that the patient had to be ventilated mechanically for a total of 4.5 h. Laboratory analysis revealed homozygous, atypical, plasma cholinesterase (790 U/l; dibucaine number 23; genotype E<![CDATA[|lefbop|a<![CDATA[|clobop||opnbop|1<![CDATA[|clobop|E<![CDATA[|lefbop|a<![CDATA[|clobop||opnbop|1<![CDATA[|clobop|).	0.5456122010072687
This retrospectively confirmed a succinylcholine-induced phase II block in both instances, as had already been suspected following the second anaesthetic procedure.	0.5260035775861696
The degree of block transformation, and thus the available time, are decisive in explaining the diverse effects of antagonism here.	0.6979622132824563
It must be assumed that a complete phase II block developed after the first succinylcholine exposure owing to the longer duration of anaesthesia; the purely competitive component (train-of-four ratio 0.1) was easily antagonized by neostigmine.	0.6819051696424746
At the time of the attempted antagonism after the second, shorter period of anaesthesia, however, block transformation was still incomplete (train-of-four ratio 0.5).	0.5692624311905459
The administration of neostigmine therefore rather intensified the depolarization segment of the mixed block, so that repeated attempts at antagonism then inhibited any further block transformation.	0.44572842657192113

Histological progress in each group is characterized by (1) increasing number and pleomorphy of megakaryocytes, (2) increasing fibrosis, and (3) excess of blasts.	0.6682025233079508
These three features can be observed in diagnostic biopsies before any therapy.	0.5508622558050992
Therefore, it is recommended that such alterations be reported semiquantitatively.	0.6285229754816203

This novel technique represents a synthesis of known approaches to coronary surgery using sternotomy without extracorporeal circulation and limited access techniques in general thoracic surgery.	0.42538922607679475

Our experience and the treatment results (debridement, drainage and external fixation) are presented.	0.7637318699549939
The methodology, complications and final results are also given for 15 patients.	0.5077294927203574
Consolidation was achieved in primary external fixation without additional procedures such as spongioplasty or internal fixation conversion methods.	0.46202848267690355

Objective: Patients in a surgical intensive care unit (ICU) have a high incidence of nosocomial infections which often lead to septic shock and death.	0.7672731557989108
Since calculated antibiotic treatment is often difficult, it was recommended to obtain routine nose/throat swabs in order to have a better idea of the causative agent when a systemic inflammatory response occurs in a given patient.	0.7302561644324124
Methods: In 1435 patients of our cardio-surgical ICU, routine nose/throat swabs were taken three times a week and tested for micro-organisms and resistance to antibiotics.	0.5145267029671936
Of these 86 patients developed clinical signs of systemic inflammation, and additional blood cultures were obtained.	0.5989743427240571
Antibiotic treatment was achieved to cover the microbes from the nose/throat swabs, or a calculated dosage was given to patients whose swabs had tested negative.	0.582126705809509
Results: Of the 86 patients with systemic inflammation, 29 had blood cultures positive for microbes.	0.6805158248365103
Of these 29 patients, 18 received a calculated antibiotic coverage based on their positive nose/throat cultures prior to the return of the blood cultures from the lab.	0.6492136666814448
However, in only 11 of the 18 patients were routine swabs and blood cultures positive with the same microbes.	0.7442796482620412
While positive routine swabs are quite specific for sepsis when there is a systemic inflammatory response, routine swabs are not a suitable screening tool due to their low sensitivity.	0.6188715569876355
Conclusions: Routine nose/throat swabs led to earlier specific antibiotic treatment in only 22% of our patients with clinical signs of systemic inflammation.	0.6436490236785918
In addition, in almost 40% of the cases organisms detected in the routine swabs and blood cultures were not identical.	0.8436546507336229
As a result, we feel that routine swabs are only of limited value in instituting earlier, specific antibiotic treatment in septic patients.	0.6358411320363269

Problem There is a great need to expand current knowledge of the various functional capacity measurements used in the rehabilitation of chronic low back pain (CLBP) patients.	0.7238546617463735
The literature on these patients reports that mobility, endurance, trunk strength and lifting capacity decrease during the process of chronicity.	0.5398977205211102
Chronically disabled patients appear to have lower functional capacity than asymptomatic persons.	0.361264064777934
Methods Our study group consisted of 90 disabled CLBP patients (44 female, 46 male; average age 42 years) who underwent a multidisciplinary 8-week daily treatment program of functional restoration with behavioral support (instruction, endurance training, strength exercises, behavioral and treatment to facilitate return to work therapy).	0.6033655289146267
Initially these patients where compared with 107 asymptomatic persons (44 female, 63 male, average age 41 years).	0.5022564928490187
The patients were investigated before and after treatment, and at intervals of 6 and 12 months.	0.9747385580036191
The reliability of the functional measurements was evaluated by interrater comparison.	0.6609071091944325
Physical assessment included a medical examination (mainly diagnosis of radicular or nonradicular pain), changes in the lumbar spine revealed by X-ray studies according to Herron and Turner [50], rating of physical impairment according to Waddell [117], flexibility, length of hamstrings muscles (SLR), test of power and endurance of trunk movement by standardized exercises according to the Swiss group of Spring [102] and isokinetic measurements (LIDO Back), tests of lifting capacity (LIDO Lift), and (in part) of general endurance on a cycle ergometer (CASE 15 Marquette).	0.568561996069253
Results Physical findings showed that mobility was reduced substantially in patients suffering from back pain due to reduced SLR (shortened hamstrings) and decreased spinal mobility.	0.4899945336574857
Patients also demonstrated significant reductions in their ability to perform lifting tasks in comparison to healthy individuals.	0.5012985442723559
The results of trunk flexion showed no significant differences between patients and the control group, whereas the ability to perform trunk extension was much better in the control group.	0.7737198870116294
In principle we found the same results with isokinetic measurements as in the exercises without machines.	0.6165092526492052
Cardiovascular endurance was also much better in the control group than it was in the back pain patients.	0.5261001538095296
At the end of the treatment program all physical deficits were improved significantly.	0.5253490150816641
In many cases performance was comparable with that of the control group.	0.6906102420656247
With time, however, training effects gradually decreased.	0.4413883766344196
The success of treatment (return to work, absence from work, pain reduction, use of medical care) was independent of the functional status of the patients before and after treatment.	0.8899994258390332
Conclusion Study results showed that physical capacity in disabled patients with low back pain is substantially reduced in comparison to persons who do not suffer from back pain.	0.6451629207087772
The only exception was in trunk flexor strength and endurance, in which measurements did not differ between the patients and the control group.	0.8629957745713541
However, even CLBP- patients with long-term pain and severe physical illness can successfully improve their physical condition by participating in an active treatment program.	0.6099586250764287
Back extensor muscle training has to be included in physical therapy.	0.49937510333958385
Because of loss of condition during the time after treatment, regular monitoring of patients and their home training programs is necessary.	0.6647950501487933
Overall, treatment of CLBP has to include physical training and psychosocial treatment to achieve satisfactory results.	0.534022350021344

To date, this has still not been fully investigated or understood.	0.6146079639859714

Reactive oxygen species (ROS) are probably not only unintended, toxic side-products of oxygen metabolism in mammalian cells, they also have several important physiologic functions including antimicrobial killing, regulation of cellular proliferation and growth, and regulation of vascular tone.	0.5900191823352713
ROS are generated within the vessel wall by several mechanisms, including a vascular type of a NAD(P)H oxidase.	0.6101465283359367
ROS formation can be stimulated by mechanical stress, environmental factors, the peptide angiotensin II, cytokines, native low-density lipoproteins (LDL), and in the presence of catalytic metal ions.	0.6372913962515842
Their ability to modify LDL, react with endothelial-derived nitric oxide subsequently forming peroxynitrite, and amplify the expression of various genes important for leukocyte recruitment within the arterial wall are the basis of the oxidant injury theory of atherosclerosis.	0.4735912604030129
In animal studies, antioxidant therapy (probucol, butylated hydroxytoluene, N',N'-diphenylendiamide, vitamin E, superoxide dismutase) have been successfully used to prevent fatty streak formation, and to restore impaired nitric oxide-dependent vasorelaxation.	0.5989272224664894
In man, antioxidant therapy (e.g., supplementation with vitamin E) clearly increased the resistance of LDL to oxidative modification.	0.372237451215677
Case-controlled and prospective clinical studies suggest a relation between baseline antioxidant plasma levels and/or antioxidant supplementation and risk of cardiovascular events.	0.47748243638899174
In one secondary prevention trial (randomized, blinded, placebo-controlled), vitamin E supplementation reduced significantly the risk for non-fatal myocardial infarctions.	0.5358540680726445
Before general recommendations can be made, results of further large-scale trials should be awaited.	0.5790755663652777

At the moment there is no consensus about the pathogenesis of RSD.	0.6513448597149775
In 1942 Paul Sudeck suggested that the signs and symptoms of RSD may be provoked by an exaggerated inflammatory response to injury or operation of an extremity.	0.4907500381128406
His theory found no disciples, as most physicians believe that RSD is initiated by an hyperactive sympathetic system.	0.4923870451606887

Pregnancy causes substantial changes in the cardiovascular system: cardiac output (40%-50%) and blood volume (40%) increase whereas systemic peripheral resistance and arterial pressure decrease.	0.7014418985198887
The rise in progesterone and estrogen levels accompanying pregnancy stimulates the renin-angiotension-aldosterone system.	0.3009675935110286
Increased prostaglandin production follows renin activation; simultaneously, the arterial vessels show diminished angiotension sensitivity.	0.42116448648433535
The result is pronounced vasodilatation.	0.4545067343754628
Heart disease remains the most important nonobstetric cause of maternal death.	0.5496472720476788
The physiological changes in the cardiovascular system during pregnancy influence cardiac diseases in different ways.	0.4851525913114259

Sometimes congestive heart failure occurs and appropriate medical therapy is necessary.	0.4135247041666054
Pregnant women with uncorrected cyanotic congenital heart disease (Eisenmenger's syndrome, tetralogy of Fallot) constitute a high-risk group because of right ventricular insufficiency and hypoxic attacks.	0.5402368276462461
The consequences for anaesthesia in parturients with congenital heart disease are discussed.	0.4908724598394444
The symptoms of acquired mitral or aortic stenosis are aggravated by the physiological changes in the cardiovascular system during pregnancy; the clinical symptoms of valve insufficiency are ameliorated by vasodilatation.	0.6480453574813184
Peripartum cardiomyopathy clinically shows similar features to idiopathic dilated cardiomyopathy.	0.21942468113480784
The basis of treatment is the same as that of congestive heart failure, with the therapeutic spectrum ranging from diet to heart transplantation.	0.7130303191991099

ICa,L density was reduced by 70% (p < 0.001) in AF patients compared to the sinus rhythm group.	0.6819903590486207
Cell sizes, expressed as cell capacitance, were identical in both groups.	0.5287996612228107

The basic prerequisite for induction of adequate treatment volumes for clinical use was the development of a thermostable application system.	0.5258896976042436

The results of a further in vivo test series demonstrated that the lesions were subject to a four-phase connective-tissue organization within a 6-month period.	0.7211876968000139

The Amplicor test yielded a positive result in 83.	0.3961802875267354

Incidence and clinical significance of cardiopulmonary complications of acute cerebral lesions are still unclear.	0.5887796455055884
Neurogenic pulmonary edema (NPE) is characterized as an acute, protein-rich lung edema occurring shortly after cerebral lesions associated with an acute rise of intracranial pressure.	0.7113511225323045
NPE is infrequently diagnosed, usually in association with head trauma.	0.4925468629031574
Pathophysiological mechanisms include a rise of the pulmonary vascular hydrostatic pressure either due to sympathetic innervation with pulmonary vasoconstriction or increased left-atrial pressure following systemic arterial hypertension or an increase in pulmonary capillary permeability.	0.5316526135654323
In contrast to NPE, cardiac complications are frequently observed, most consistently in patients with subarachoid hemorrhage.	0.6898505392437961
Typical ECG changes are repolarization abnormalities, similar to those observed in coronary heart disease, and cardiac arrhythmias.	0.6552777819031053
The CK-MB may be slightly elevated; echocardiographic findings show a depressed left-ventricular function.	0.36805608344104207
Pathological examination reveals myofibrillar necrosis.	0.18702876198216437
Cardiac complications are explained with overactivity of the sympathetic innervation and high levels of circulating catecholamines.	0.48756947987652355
For adequate treatment, close cardiac monitoring is required in all patients with acute cerebral lesions.	0.9066873893273701

Ischemic stroke is defined as a localized lack of cerebral perfusion mainly due to cardioembolic or arterial-embolic occlusion of cerebral arteries or hemodynamic or microangiographic reduction of cerebral blood flow.	0.480575882036646
We focused on pathophysiological mechanisms with potential clinical relevance as the role of oxygen and glucose concentration, the therapeutic time window, the role of excitatory neurotransmitters, Ca2+-influx, free radicals, and the development of ischemic brain edema.	0.6598811633329796

This includes the early basic management with monitoring of blood pressure, ECG, oxygen and blood glucose concentration, and the balance of the water and electrolyte supply.	0.7043851738122736

The obliteration of the frontal sinus is endangered in cases of multiple fracturing of the posterior frontal sinus wall or if it has been destroyed by an inflammatory process.	0.6591842441858972
In these problematic cases obliteration bears the danger of complications and cranialization of the frontal sinus is therefore the method of choice.	0.6223469663227466
We review 8 patients who were operated on using the cranialization technique.	0.5091423904546242
Indications for surgery were a combined fracture of the anterior and posterior frontal sinus wall (3), a pyocele of the front sinus with extensive destruction of the posterior wall (4) and a large osteoma of the posterior frontal sinus wall (1).	0.7440815572985329
The frontal sinus was exposed through a coronal incision, the mucosa and the posterior wall were completely removed and the frontal sinus obliterated with fat tissue.	0.7381066178139803
The anterior sinus wall was replaced after obliteration of the sinus or reconstructed with calvarian bone transplants.	0.42151003619559657
The follow up period was 1.8 years (11 months to 8 years).	0.8895320145246295
All patients underwent postoperatively a clinical ENT-examination and radiological assessment by CT-scan or MRI.	0.6323380718211443
The overall functional and esthetic outcome was excellent.	0.30453940621565034
There were no serious complications nor any recurrence.	0.523771059474494

The clinical picture is characterised by progressive ataxia and macular degeneration.	0.5200926029889057
Other common signs are slow saccades, external ophthalmoplegia, and pyramidal tract signs.	0.5055766872177211
The disease is caused by the expansion of an unstable CAG trinucleotide repeat in the gene for ataxin 7 on chromosome 3.	0.5974778650338735
SCA7 is a rare disorder.	0.7767750071173095
The first case in Germany was described only recently.	0.6878126935579749

The father carries a trinucleotide expansion of 42 CAG repeats, the son 51.	0.4070281635293469
Normal alleles range from 7 to 35 CAG repeats.	0.3070283265355647
Both patients show the typical picture with progressive ataxia and macular degeneration.	0.44154510387828105
We found a pronounced anticipation (earlier disease onset in subsequent generations), which is highly characteristic of CAG repeat disorders.	0.5765962536651371

Although they are chemically different, there are many similarities in their mechanism of action.	0.6555083969907285
In provocation tests they have equal efficacy on some tests (allergen, exercise), but nedocromil sodium has greater effect on neuronal mechanisms such as So2 challenge.	0.4423258290985932
Very few studies compared the two drugs.	0.4283646818662584
In children, only one study was done, showing that twice daily nedocromil is as effective as four times daily cromolyn sodium.	0.5834837801381298
Thus twice daily administration is one advantage of nedocromil, the other being proven effect of steroid- sparing, which has not been shown with cromolyn sodium.	0.6636317487791363

The definition of endocrine disrupters is not very sharp.	0.4602407701798662

Here they may cause severe estrogenization of aquatic life.	0.41403598780594386

The effect of a locally applied peppermint oil preparation on tension-type headache was examined in the design of a randomized, placebo-controlled double-blind crossover study for the first time.	0.5932720274187925
The preparation was tested against both the reference substance acetaminophen and to the corresponding placebo.	0.6226222712560991
The liquid test preparation contained 10 g of peppermint oil and ethanol (90 %) ad 100 (test preparation LI 170, Lichtwer Pharma, Berlin); the placebo was a 90 % ethanol solution to which traces of peppermint oil were added for blinding purposes.	0.5171384082219403
The reference preparation contained 500 mg acetaminophen; the placebo tablet was identical to the verum in size and appearance.	0.49591533384834374
The study included the analysis of 164 headache attacks of 41 patients of both sexes ranging between 18 and 65 years of age, suffering from tension-type headache in accordance with the IHS classification.	0.5778782303911381
Four headache episodes per patient were treated in a double-blind, randomized crossover design.	0.5435890046243403
Each headache attack was treated by the application of 2 capsules of the oral medication (1000 mg of acetaminophen or placebo) and the cutaneous application of the oil preparation (peppermint oil or placebo solution).	0.6799731404772088
The oil was spread largely across forehead and temples which was repeated after 15 and 30 minutes.	0.33592210881932233
Using a headache diary, the headache parameters were assessed after 15, 30, 45 and 60 minutes.	0.664626497819029
Compared to the application of placebo, a 10 % peppermint oil in ethanol solution significantly reduced the clinical headache intensity already after 15 minutes (p < 0.01).	0.5329839232245014
This significant clinical reduction of the pain intensity continued over the one hour observation period.	0.5215632275406403
Acetaminophen, too, proved to be efficient compared to placebo (p < 0.01).	0.5263412224468574
There was no significant difference between the efficacy of 1000 mg of acetaminophen and 10 % peppermint oil in ethanol solution.	0.4683764017433858
Simultaneous application of 1000 mg of acetaminophen and 10 % peppermint oil in ethanol solution leads to an additive effect which remains below the significance threshold, however.	0.5240151019446635
The patients reported no adverse events.	0.3676825557427449
This controlled study showed for the first time that a 10 % peppermint oil in ethanol solution efficiently alleviates tension-type headache.	0.521582944934017
Peppermint oil thus proves to be a well-tolerated and cost-effective alternative to usual therapies.	0.6763732050002115

Aspiration of toxic substances, foreign material, bacterially contaminated secretions, or water (near-drowning) either immediately leads to cessation of respiration or to impaired ventilation due to airway obstruction, it causes hypoxia due to surfactant dysfunction, and pulmonary infection might develop.	0.5488154172289283
Respiratory insufficiency is the resulting consequence which needs immediate and appropriate therapy and intervention.	0.3589028421109822
The knowledge of risk factors that promote aspiration injury is important for its prevention and limitation.	0.5866438694126558
Mortality varies between 3 and 70% depending on patients studied, and on the nature and amount of aspirated material.	0.6605977295234278
The major cause of death is acute respiratory failure.	0.45878863434180495
The onset of injury to the lung after aspiration is very rapid.	0.5002645706269605
Therefore, therapeutic interventions like bronchoscopy are often too late.	0.4691737443956776
More importantly, oxygenation should be monitored continuously for timely institution of mechanical ventilation.	0.4379496089560452
Antibiotics should not be given routinely but a calculated regime is neccessary when signs of infection develop.	0.4856045333424787
Prognosis in near-drowning considerably depends on early rescue and successful resuscitation.	0.40130737715313974
A rapid onset of cerebral hypothermia during the accident can help to increase the ischemic tolerance of the brain and makes it neccessary to continue advanced life support until rewarming of the near-drowning victim.	0.5649466580529197
Anticipation of individual outcome in unconscious patients is difficult.	0.3585071404071828
One third of them survive with a moderate to severe neurologic damage.	0.4786023300061021
The overall mortality of near-drowning is about 11%.	0.4770937315102881

One of these assumptions is that stents may prevent restenosis.	0.489838962821459

Abstract   Mitoxantrone is an anthracenedione antineoplastic agent that has recently been shown to be effective in ameliorating disease activity in multiple sclerosis (MS) as indicated by clinical and MRI data.	0.5526200125270885
However, the role of mitoxantrone in escalating treatment of patients with frequent and severe relapses and with rapid progression of disability is less clear.	0.5616385800993734
In this retrospective analysis we report on 15 patients with severe relapsing-remitting (9 patients) and secondary progressive MS with superimposed exacerbations (6 patients) treated openlabeled with mitoxantrone in our Clinical Research Group from July 1994 to October 1998.	0.8237775225751586
Eleven of these patients (73%) were treated with azathioprine, interferon-beta-1b or cyclophosphamide before.	0.7469942215196502
The patients received mitoxantrone over a period of at least 12 months (19 +/- 6 months) with a single dose of 10 mg/m2 monthly for the first three months.	0.9336331056116591
Thereafter, infusions were repeated every 3 months (total dose 141 mg +/- 45 mg).	0.5090305849642821
The annual relapse rate could be significantly reduced from 3,0 +/- 1,5 in the year before therapy to 0,5 +/- 0,5 during therapy.	0.7791805312835292
Nine patients (60%) were stabilised, while four patients (27%) showed an improvement of disability.	0.9532370399897245
The treatment was well tolerated with only minor side effects.	0.5268316926556773
These results although retrospectively obtained confirm previous trials showing that mitoxantrone may be useful in MS patients with frequent and severe exacerbations and/or a rapidly progressive course of the disease who have had other immunomodulatory medication.	0.5933181748372213
Interstitial cystitis (IC) represents a rare and complex inflammatory bladder condition in which diagnostics can be challenging.	0.47273281947623985
Strict NIH criteria for its diagnosis were designed for research purposes.	0.3729309837408667
Their routine application would miss large proportions of IC patients.	0.2615737260278129
When IC is suspected, history and physical exam are followed by an evaluation of long-term voiding diaries.	0.5624194437855803
Large voided volumes (functional capacity >250 cc) or longer micturition intervals (>2 h.), absence of nocturia or symptom-free periods reduce the likelihood of IC.	0.6422395236556291
Further exclusion diagnostics include urine tests (infection), cytology (in-situ carcinoma), ultrasound (calculi, bulks, anomalies) and urodynamics in selected cases.	0.5410626918564445
Bladder capacity measurements under sedoanalgesia are of limited value, since functional low-volume bladders can be mechanically extendable.	0.44388667688844485
Cystoscopy under general anesthesia represents the diagnostic standard procedure for IC during which 90% of IC-patients present with characteristic mucosal glomerulations after bladder distension.	0.5050674463510546
Biopsies are recommended for exclusion of malignancy.	0.45604929620927015
Potassium-leak testing plays no relevant role in routine diagnostics due to its poor sensitivity.	0.38152468675558626
Similarly, complex determinations of novel IC markers (histamine, tryptase, cytokines, growth factors, substance P, nitric oxide) are of no relevance in clinical settings and should be restricted to research projects.	0.5533388293650213
According to semiotics, which may be defined as the doctrine of the essential nature and fundamental varieties of signs, objects, and interpretants, pain is considered to be a sign (significant) with very different meanings (significance) either as a naturalistic symptom (of disease) or as a symbol used in a metaphorical context.	0.7361515451476626
When following this methodological perspective it is possible to interpret medical as well as poetic writings on equal terms.	0.41034933106921534
In Graeco-Roman medical texts pain was mostly understood as a result and an indicator of disease, but nonetheless as a symptom which seemed to be actively produced by the affected body.	0.6289752537333391
Especially in the Corpus Hippocraticum dating from the 5th and 4th century B. C. this materialistic and at the same time psychosomatic attitude can be noticed.	0.4931059332918107
Aristotle (4th century B. C.), Celsus (1st century A. D.), and the famous experimental physiologist Galen (2nd century A. D.) agreed that pain was a sign of evil which should be fought without exception.	0.5184156969027458
It was Galen who added the disturbance of function (functio laesa) as the fifth cardinal sign of inflammation to the four well-known cardinal signs of Celsus (rubor, calor, tumor, dolor).	0.5875610737212649
He also coined the term µK to characterize an attack of migraine.	0.2701899167742684
In algotherapy, Galen used a complex pharmacological system which was based upon the four cardinal qualities of humoral pathology.	0.42296791886719626
On the other hand, pain was designed as a multi-dimensional symbol by the famous Graeco-Roman epic poets.	0.4870848870784666
In Homer's Odyssey (8th century B. C.), pain appears transformed into the shape of a scar which is visible and palpable on the hero's leg like an identification tag, whereas in Virgil's Aeneids (1st century B. C.) pain symbolizes weakness and defencelessness which can only be alleviated by the goddess Venus.	0.47167030085984474

A lack of standardisation of neuromuscular monitoring is probably the major problem on the way to a widespread utilisation of the monitoring.	0.6250847760636558

Observer agreement was very good for the 1.0-T unit and fair for the 0.2-T unit.	0.6248578811869745

Data concerning screening mammography are available from nine prospectively controlled trials, the largest series being presented from Sweden.	0.5317047733868856
Mammographic screening leads to a significant reduction of breast cancer of 30 % in women ages 50-59 years.	0.790462195162106
In younger women (40-49 years) the benefit accounts to only 20 % and has not proven to be statistically significant.	0.8760818881515039
Nevertheless, the major advantage of mammographic screening is detection of the non-palpable tumor <= 10 mm in size.	0.7111847935165371
The treatment of these small breast carcinomas leads to long-term survival rates of >= 90 %.	0.8368325946656164
Mammographic screening programs have been introduced in the USA, Canada, Iceland and Sweden for women in their 5th decade of life.	0.4217842540634116
Starting yearly lifelong mammography-screening at the age of 40, the theoretical cancer induction by radiation exposure does not exceed 0.1 %.	0.5388600739379851
Under highly qualified conditions, it should be possible to minimize false-positive and false-negative screening results.	0.671837413176549
In Germany, screening-mammography is only introduced in patients at high risk for breast cancer.	0.5711840512348624

Their recognition is important to avoid diagnostic pitfalls and inappropriate therapy.	0.43542114824146516
