The prevalence of hepatitis B, hepatitis C and HIV infections among drug abuse-related fatalities in Hamburg (1985-1997) was investigated with respect to epidemiological, forensic and morphological aspects.	0.6477025974485298
The purpose of this study was (1) to determine the prevalence of hepatitis B (HBV), hepatitis C (HCV) and HIV infections among drug abuse-related fatalities (drug deaths) in Hamburg from 1985 to 1997, (2) to assess the rate of multiple infections and (3) to analyze the liver histomorphology in 100 autopsied drug deaths.	0.7332751650999444
Furthermore, we discuss the epidemiological and forensic aspects.	0.814880494951458
In this period 1469 drug deaths were registered with a prevalence for HBV of 35% (1997: 39%), for HCV 51% (1997: 58%), and for HIV 7% (1997: 15%).	0.6789849603342785
Co-infections were common (28%) and 19% of all cases were infected with HBV and HCV.	0.8553591863619059
The liver histology showed that hepatitis was frequently diagnosed (74%) and was associated with HBV and/or HCV infections (77% of all hepatitis cases).	0.7216089650577947
Only 9% showed a normal liverhistology.	0.8178404585030093
Forensic autopsies and monitoring of HBV, HCV and HIV infections in drug deaths represent an important tool to gain information about the individual case and the situation among i.v.	0.5939037007747002
Background: An abnormal coronary flow reserve represents an early marker of impaired blood flow regulation in the natural history of coronary atherosclerosis under the impact of risk factors such as hypercholesterolemia.	0.6480352021207665
Our clinical investigation was aimed at assessing noninvasively the integrative coronary flow response to dipyridamole stress in 18 consecutive patients with microvascular angina, only moderately elevated LDL-cholesterol levels (168 +/- 33 mg/dl), and reduced vasodilator capacity despite normal (n=9) or slightly abnormal (n=9) coronary arteriograms (minimal disease with luminal irregularities and/or diameter reduction <=30%) before and after 6-month lipid-lowering therapy (simvastatin).	0.5768050977014565
Methods: Regional and averaged myocardial blood flow were measured at rest and after dipyridamole induced vasodilation (0.56 mg/kg) using dynamic positron emission tomography (PET) and N-13 ammonia as flow tracer related to a 3-compartment kinetic model.	0.5978710479583256
Baseline data (mean +/- SD): 13 males, 5 females; mean age: 56 +/- 8 years; basal coronary flow: 90 +/- 22 ml/minx100 g; after lipid intervention: 93 +/- 18 ml/minx100 g (n.s.).	0.6739035185456567
Total cholesterol decreased to 170 +/- 36 mg/dl (p<0.001); mean LDL level: 97 +/- 26 mg/dl (p<0.001).	0.5279600069877725
Coronary dilator capacity increased, assessed in terms of minimal coronary resistance: 0.38 +/- 0.08 vs 0.49 +/- 0.09 units at baseline (p<0.01), myocardial blood flow under dipyridamole: 232 +/- 43 vs 186 +/- 37 ml/minx100 g at baseline (p<0.01), and instantaneous flow ratio: 2.6 +/- 0.7 vs 2.2 +/- 0.6 (p=0.06).	0.5873295763406766
Concomitantly, a considerable regression of angina was noticed in the majority of patients.	0.5917350758415549
Conclusions: An improvement of the non-invasively determined integrative dipyridamole induced coronary vasodilator capacity may be achieved after 6 months by intensive lipid lowering at a very early stage of coronary atherosclerosis.	0.6068883759191527
Consequently, aggressive cholesterol-lowering therapy represents an antiischemic and antianginal approach suggesting, at least in part, functional reversal and probably prevention of further disease progression.	0.5417611864548935
We report the case of a a 60 year-old worker in the pharmaceutical industry who suffered from recurring contact dermatitis.	0.5212582527817639
Initially the contact dermatitis was limited to the hands; later on it became generalized.	0.5091160949790771
The patient had been working on a drug filling line in a pharmaceutical plant for more than 20 years.	0.5841003688656992
Eight years after starting this job he had developed allergic hand dermatitis to 2,6-diaminopyridine (patch test positive); this healed upon cessation of exposure.	0.42064526665123053
Ten years later he again developed hand dermatitis which progressed to generalized dermatitis and conjunctivitis.	0.3586021495740277
Under systemic and local therapy with corticosteroids and cessation of work, it healed nearly completly.	0.5704344242418785
Four months after returning to work, the patient experienced a first episode of severe asthma and generalized dermatitis with conjunctivitis following exposure to hydroxychloroquine the day before.	0.6138213454883352
The asthma and dermatitis improved after systemic corticosteroid therapy and stopping work.	0.2866568018818797
His condition continued to fluctuate, when though the patient was transferred at work and now wore rubber gloves.	0.5767961393245802
Eight months later he again developed a generalized dermatitis.	0.4001647708997435
Patch testing revealed delayed-type sensitizations to hydroxychloroquine (tested in concentrations of 0.1%, 0.5%, 1% and 2%).	0.708504140310182
Equivalent tests in five healthy volunteers were negative.	0.28766576416921474
The patch test reactions were pustular, while a biopsy was interpreted as a multiform contact dermatitis reaction.	0.5534963853962213
Bronchial exposure with hydroxychloroquine dust produced a delayed bronchial obstruction over the next 20 hours, which progressed to fever and generalized erythema (hematogenous contact dermatitis).	0.4979677000298228
After removing exposure to 2,6-diaminopyridine and hydroxychloroquine, the patient went on to develop a contact dermatitis to latex (patch test positive).	0.6114155047673614
However, skin prick tests with latex and patch tests with rubber additiva were negative.	0.4483127219508953
Hydroxychloroquine is well known to cause drug reactions.	0.5880971470854437
To our knowledge, contact dermatitis to this substance has not yet been reported.	0.49345131932036085
It is noteworthy that the patch test reactions were pustular and of multiform morphology and that bronchial exposure to the allergen resulted in asthma and a generalized drug reaction.	0.455939787532651
Pathogenetically the asthmatic reaction seems to be on a delayed-type mechanism as is also seen with ampicillin, cobalt and nickel induced asthma.	0.4581183274586059

One month later the right Achilles tendon ruptured without any sudden pain.	0.3365344428383272

The tendon was reconstructed surgically.	0.3787300282524469
The histological analysis showed cystic changes with focal necrosis.	0.3577096718049508
This finding differ from findings in non drug induced tendinopathies.	0.32280758778282553
After antimicrobiotical treatment with ciprofloxacin the side effect of a tendon disorder must be considered.	0.5373337403419524
The impairment of the tendon may be as strong that a tendon rupture may occur at daily living activities without any typical clinical symptoms.	0.5761890912224263
The recent results obtained from investigations based on molecular biological techniques have led to a better understanding of recurrent genetic causes important for the pathogenesis of tumors.	0.5658978532543556
Several genes have been identified as being involved in the development of cancer.	0.6100438992102247
In many cases, the activation of oncogenes or the inactivation of tumor-suppressor genes is the predominant reason for cancerogenic cell transformation.	0.6066424506948439
Functional dysregulation is frequently the consequence of mutations, resulting in an alteration of the primary structure of the DNA.	0.6356976598081722

Hyperbaric Oxygen (HBO) therapy is a kind of medical treatment in which a patient breathes 100% of oxygen inside a pressure chamber while the pressure of the chamber is increased to a point higher than sea level pressure.	0.7065876689063417
It is strongly based on clearly defined physical laws and physiological regularities.	0.3215440688951751
For the clinical use of HBO therapy, according to international recommendations, there are several commonly accepted indications in which HBO either is the only causative life-saving kind of treatment, or is an essential and oftenly decisive component of a comprehensive interdisciplinary intensive care therapy.	0.6822655326604179
Among potential adverse effects, barotrauma of the lungs and especially oxygen toxicity to the central nervous system have to be mentioned.	0.5460469832364591
Clinical use of HBO therefore requires special knowledge of its effects, risks, and adverse effects, a clear and distinct indication, and the ability and skills to keep complications under control by means of intensive care or emergency medical measures.	0.6821143665079626
The clinical use of hyperbaric oxygen with its interdisciplinary-like character of emergency medicine or intensive care therapy therefore should be an additional, most interesting field of activity for the anaesthesiologist.	0.6546363516144394
Although arthroscopy of the ankle joint has been well established, there are only very few reports about arthroscopy in ankle fracture treatment.	0.7133866268546565
In order to sytematically analyze the intraarticular lesions of ankle fractures, we assessed 196 consecutive ankle fractures immediately before ORIF.	0.5332243947385986
There were 94 male and 101 female patients with an average age of 47.8 years (16-88 years).	0.7006118911015362
There were more cartilage lesions found than expected, and cartilage lesions were not noted more frequently in type C-fractures than in type B-fractures.	0.694390211278182
In both fracture types, an increasing amount of cartilage lesions was found from group 1 to 3.	0.6361470719604713
In addition, more ligament injuries were found than expected, especially in the B.1- and B.2-fractures.	0.8706388477276672
Successful arthroscopic surgery was performed in 26 cases: internal fixation, 9; loose body removal, 7; ligament reposition, 5; cartilage smoothening, 4; and cartilage fracture repair, 1.	0.6792795403357605
In one case, a periostal flap could not be reduced, and in another case, the internal fixation of the medial malleolus was not stable.	0.9429022283951339
In summary, arthroscopy was shown to be a very helpful diagnostic tool in ankle fractures.	0.7856054894121313
As long-term results are not yet available, it remains, however, unclear as to whether arthroscopy may improve the success of the following ORIF.	0.9287924301804064
Arthroscopy was also shown to be a successful tool for several closed surgical procedures.	0.5852914176130007

Methods: The instruments were translated and tested for internal consistency (Cronbach's coefficient alpha), test-retest reliability (intraclass correlation coefficient, ICC), construct validity (testing for association with Schober's test, finger floor distance, occiput wall distance, frequency and duration of awakenings at night, and a visual analog scale pain), and responsiveness (standardized response mean, SRM).	0.5179891746005773
Results: The study sample consisted of 72 patients of a randomized, controlled clinical trial receiving either Diclofenac or placebo.	0.6762973208523894
Visual assessment of distribution patterns revealed a ceiling effect of both instruments.	0.3700422636624791
Both questionnaires had a high internal consistency (Cronbach alpha: 0.81 [BASFI], 0.85 [D-FI] and a high test-retest reliability (ICC: 0.92 [BASFI], 0.89 [D-FI]).	0.5575899533215755
The limited responsiveness to Diclofenac treatment (SRM: 0.46 [BASFI],  0.33 [D-FI]) may be related to the selected study sample.	0.6336413767713123
The BASFI was significantly correlated with all tested validation parameters.	0.3434479350820959
The  D-FI was only significantly correlated with finger floor distance, occiput wall distance, and duration of awakenings at night.	0.482726268334531
Conclusion: The transculturally adapted version of both functional indices are valid, reliable, and internally consistent.	0.5746100306063541
Because of psychometric advantages, the BASFI may be preferred in clinical trial settings.	0.6090975700172324

Data on longterm side-effects are only available from older studies with outdated radiation techniques.	0.4873052687464579

Group 1 showed no signs of resorption and chronic inflammation at all.	0.45139985240598623

There were no significant differences between endogenous and neurotic depressives.	0.5671702246148431

Several recent studies in human volunteers have been performed to evaluate this potential.	0.6133627264844713

The initial investigation found high excretion of protein, glucose and renal tubular enzymes in the urine of the volunteers receiving sevoflurane.	0.49975968452475333

Background: The microbial colonization of the intestinal tract in newborns begins during delivery.	0.5428853567047426
Streptococci and Escherichia coli pave the way for the bifidobacterial dominance typical in breast-fed newborns.	0.37549380635933516
They provide optimal living conditions for anaerobic bifidobacteria by withdrawal of intraluminal oxygen.	0.25979404062508454
A mixed intestinal flora is established on infant formula feeding in the infant.	0.330428034714418
Bifidobacteria, Bacteroides, Enterobacteriaceae, streptococci and lactobacilli are the main genera of this mixed intestinal flora.	0.43777482041430726
This represents an intermediate stage of the microflora in adults.	0.44151274054793005
The bifidogenic effect of mothers' milk is based on the active substances it contains, which selectively enhance the growth of bifidobacteria, whereas other active substances suppress the growth of the accompanying flora.	0.6830462860913699
Bifidus-enhancing factors in breast-feeding are lactose, oligosaccharides, glycoproteins such as glycomacropeptide and the inoculation with bifidobacteria deriving from the skin surface of the mother.	0.4847385955232212
Factors directed to the suppression of the accompanying microflora are antibodies, lactoferrin, lysozyme, fatty acids and monoglycerides that act as antimicrobial substances and the comparatively low protein and iron content in mothers' milk.	0.4077432506022543
A bifidus-inhibiting colonization of the intestinal tract with pathogenic germs is caused by maternal birth-canal infections, which are now known to be the most frequent reason for premature births.	0.7234519646160309
An increasing number of surgical deliveries, the separation of the newborn infant from its mother, and the generous use of antibiotics contribute to the delayed colonization of bifidobacteria and to the development of life-threatening nosocomial infections.	0.759882601601537
Counteractive measures against this disastrous situation are the preferential use of bifidobacteria-preserving antibiotics and the inoculation of lyophilized bifidobacteria.	0.3754373919519352
Between January 1983 and December 1987, metatarsal head-resections were performed on 203 patients, comprising a total of 370 feet, using the Hueter/Mayo and Hoffmann procedure.	0.543655287354922
Seventy-two patients, comprising a total of 126 feet, were available for post-operative review after an average of 11.4 years from the date of the original operations.	0.7690324519545808
The information obtained from standardized questionnaires was compared to the information found in each patient's file.	0.6225312765054511
In addition, every available pre- and post-operative x-ray taken from 1983 to 1987 was analyzed.	0.5444550443107722
Thus, with an average follow-up period of 5.6 years, the changes found in the pre- and post-operative x-rays from a total of 183 feet could be compared.	0.9097322980967303
Before the operations, nearly 100% of the examined feet suffered from painful synovial hypertrophy and erosion of the metatarsophalangeal joints with dislocation and subluxation, causing approximately 70% of all patients to have great difficulties in walking.	0.6307877017692812
After the operations, however, 90.2% of the patients reported that this condition had noticeably improved or had completely disappeared.	0.6802461020950122
In fact, 87.5% of all patients reported a lasting improvement in their ability to walk longer distances.	0.6824117013328276
As the main criteria in determining the success of an operation (namely, the noticeable reduction of pain and increased mobility) were achieved in 87.5% of the patients, we consider the metatarsal head-resection a reliable method of correcting forefoot deformities in rheumatoid arthritis.	0.8016228743899247

Bone morphogenetic proteins (BMPs) as representatives of the latter substances are known to have the ability for ectopic bone formation.	0.6992949272018514

Rx-BMP-4 induced a differentiation of HPOC to almost the same extent as rhBMP-2, whereas the addition of rh-bFGF, applied at the same concentration, failed to have any influence on cell differentiation.	0.6209381001328503
However, rh-bFGF provoked an increase in cell proliferation when compared with unstimulated HPOC, while rhBMP-2 and rxBMP-4 showed no effect on proliferation.	0.6122360742318653
TGF-ß influenced bone proliferation as well as differenciation significantly.	0.36816536551540807
The equipotent effect of recombinant human BMP-2 and recombinant BMP-4 obtained from Xenopus laevis with regard to differentiation and proliferation of human primary osteoblast-like cells originates either in the fact that target cells have receptors for BMP 2 as well as BMP 4, or that both BMP's link to the same receptor with almost the same affinity.	0.5571090555807678

Before the era of immunotherapy and in the absence of effective nonsurgical therapy, resection of metastases was the accepted way to prolong survival, giving a 5-year survival of 7-69 %.	0.676247123176951

Sixty-six fractures, 5 cases of osteolysis or pathologic fractures, 2 limb shortenings and 1 lengthening (monorail technique) and 3 cases of pseudarthrosis were stabilised with the UFN from July 1994 to December 1996.	0.6781622986630338

According to our clinical and radiological score the results were excellent in 34 % of cases, good in 36.3 %, poor in 20.4 % and bad in 9 %.	0.832167003171832
Average fracture healing time was about 9.8 weeks.	0.5542155440651074
Fractures of the atlas account for 1-2 % of all vertebral fractures.	0.8978957058014381
We divide atlas fractures into 5 groups: isolated fractures of the anterior arch of the atlas, isolated fractures of the posterior arch, combined fractures of the anterior and posterior arch (so-called Jefferson fractures), isolated fractures of the lateral mass and fractures of the transverse process.	0.7040863648152751
Isolated fractures of the anterior or posterior arch are benign and are treated conservatively with a soft collar until the neck pain has disappeared.	0.6691254567230377
Jefferson fractures are divided into stable and unstable fracture depending on the integrity of the transverse ligament.	0.4705420572174016
Stable Jefferson fractures are treated conservatively with good outcome while unstable Jefferson fractures are probably best treated operatively with a posterior atlanto-axial or occipito-axial stabilization and fusion.	0.49712381002276945
The authors preferred treatment modality is the immediate open reduction of the dislocated lateral masses combined with a stabilization in the reduced position using a transarticular screw fixation C1/C2 according to Magerl.	0.560191049902751
This has the advantage of saving the atlanto-occipital joints and offering an immediate stability which makes immobilization in an halo or Minerva cast superfluous.	0.4019236343589473
In late instabilities C1/2 with incongruency of the lateral masses occurring after primary conservative treatment, an occipito-cervical fusion is indicated.	0.5392244897642238
Isolated fractures of the lateral masses are very rare and may, if the lateral mass is totally destroyed, be a reason for an occipito-cervical fusion.	0.7152857105868844
Fractures of the transverse processes may be the cause for a thrombosis of the vertebral artery.	0.8848164311795981
No treatment is necessary for the fracture itself.	0.6980972622398876

Fractures and dislocations of the elbow are some of the most common injuries in childhood and adolescence.	0.8786760192846259
The majority occur in sport and play activities, e. g., a fall from gymnastics apparatus or a bike, or from popular sports items, such as skateboards or in-line skates.	0.5230626731074467
The injuries can be divided into pure dislocations of the joint and fractures of the distal humerus, proximal radius and ulna, or combinations of both.	0.7283948406533136
In addition, extra- and intraarticular fracture types are defined, with the latter as partial or complete joint lesions.	0.6891929292532079
Dislocations of the elbow joint or the radial head can occur as single injuries or in combination with a fracture.	0.6778888124413914
Supracondylar fractures and avulsion fractures of the medial epicondyle are the most frequent extraarticular lesions of the distal humerus.	0.8220001300216457
Fractures of the lateral condyle prevail is incomplete intraarticular lesions.	0.5178094929909679
In the forearm, radial head and neck fractures are predominant while typical and atypical Monteggia injuries have a special status.	0.5403576849443276
The complex joint construction and the age-dependent appearance of the epiphyseal ossification centers sometimes make a correct radiological diagnosis difficult.	0.5802185885973342
The trauma history and an exact, clinical examination help to verify the injury, as do comparative X-ray studies of the uninjured side when necessary (but not routinely).	0.6854784434598017
Unlike other anatomical areas, most elbow injuries - even in the growing skeleton - are treated operatively.	0.8599407908069064
Hereby, the growth plates have to be respected using minimal amounts of small implants.	0.6519384262556385
Additional immobilization in a cast for 2 - 4 weeks is necessary in most cases but does not lead to a functional deficit - in contrast to adults.	0.7965839139909704
The implants should be removed as early as possible.	0.3307845027092275
Despite all therapeutic efforts, a significant number of late sequelae, such as malunions and functional impairment, can be seen.	0.6516284142118643
The rate of long-term complications increases in cases of untreated displacement of fragments or joint instability.	0.5983543952041717
Corrective measures are performed only in selected cases and after the growth plates are closed.	0.6562112735799125
Our own treatment regime is demonstrated using exemplary clinical cases of the different injuries and the results of a long-term follow-up study on sports injuries of the elbow in children.	0.8127884549882367
Errors in diagnosis and therapy, as well as possible complications, are pointed out.	0.7145465860980296
2-adrenergic agonists, mimicking the action of the inhibitory transmitter norepinephrine, cause antinociception due to postsynaptic inhibition of spinothalamic projection neurons, presynaptic inhibition at the central nervous system termination of primary sensory nerves, presynaptic inhibition of brainstem noradrenergic neurons and a generalized decrease in central nervous system sympathetic efferent activity.	0.441735118569108
There is a mutual potentiation of antinociceptive effects of clonidine and morphine.	0.44535948280492355
Clonidine is used in chronic pain states for treatment of neuropathic, neuralgic and deafferentiating pain.	0.6625875614663237
Based on a meta-analysis of the studies published in the years 1996-1996, the therapeutic efficacy of systematically administered clonidine was evaluated in chronic pain states.	0.8780251218020187
Out of 403 screened published studies, only 9 fulfilled the selection criteria.	0.5035860344026866
Besides three case reports with successful clonidine treatment, four placebo-controlled studies could be analyzed treating the following chronic pain states: chest pain despite normal coronary angiograms; painful diabetic neuropathy; postherpetic neuralgia; hyperalgia in patients with sympathetically maintained pain and chronic low back pain.	0.5564463287304305
Although three studies demonstrated statistically significant improvement in pain scores, the improvement in pain relief in these cases was slight.	0.8166734715879652
Long-term treatment was successful in a few responders over a period of 17 months.	0.7475601770637853
Hyperalgesia caused by sympathetically maintained pain was relieved by topical (transdermal) application of clonidine.	0.348107427322605
Based on this evaluation a grade C recommendation is derived, which relates to responders.	0.5579230589605008
Successful treatment is expected only in pain states with increased sympathetic nervous system activity.	0.42032213167533333
Therefore, in chronic pain, treatment with systemic clonidine is of no significant value.	0.8256106579646985

We examined the disturbed joint motion as exclusive criterion for a somatic dysfunction, because through an anesthesia with endotracheal intubation including complete neuromuscular blockade segmental influences on the inspected joint were eleminated.	0.526510382676647
For complete muscle relaxation as required for orotracheal intubation a non depolarizising muscle relaxant was used.	0.36461473511262943
Somatic dysfunctions were found most frequent for side-inclination and retroflexion in segment O/C1.	0.3224619081830574
Both before as well as during complete neuromuscular blockade could be found in the majority of examinations (89,1 %) similar restraints of joint motions.	0.6910220735526567
To 10,9 % were found, that somatic dysfunctions established before the muscle relaxant was applicated, were no more demonstrable under complete blockade of neuromuscular transmission.	0.7048504739662708
Different theoretical models are presented for the interpretation of our results.	0.5463857255891418
We assume, that the disturbance of one component of the metamer organized segment is the basic phänomenon of somatic dysfunction.	0.5446434356766886
This disturbance break through the spinal segmental inhibition and expand into the segment.	0.30936890361310626
Subsequently we discuss to replace the term "somatic dysfunction" through "segmental dysfunction" and to define it as increasing of nozizeptive afference in the segment over a determined period of time with breakthrough of the spinal segmental inhibition threshold.	0.5945311360892789

The postoperative delay of bowel movement, however, is often also related to the type of anaesthesia being used.	0.5629953743682171
In order to evaluate the magnitude of an anaesthetic-induced postoperative delay of bowel movement, two types of intravenous-based anaesthesia using fentanyl/midazolam (1 mg/25 mg; dosage 0.1 ml/kg/h), and ketamine/midazolam (250 mg/25 mg; dosage 0.1 ml/kg/h) respectively were compared with a volatile anaesthetic technique (enflurane; mean concentration 1.5 vol%).	0.6988195896722805
In three groups of patients (each n=15) undergoing elective surgery of the lower extremities, induction of anaesthesia was accomplished with methohexital (1 - 1.5 mg) followed by succinylcholine (1.5 mg/kg) to facilitate intubation.	0.854456858908297
For the maintenance of muscle relaxation vecuronium bromide was used.	0.3743967249042241
All patients were given droperidol to prevent postoperative emesis, and they were artifically ventilated with N2O/O2 (60: 40) to normal end-expiratory CO2 concentrations.	0.781030234816589
No anticholinergic agents were used at the end of operation since they are known to interfere with bowel motility.	0.4848753167188809
In order to determine gastro-intestinal motility, the H2 exhalation test was used.	0.5961746579300815
For this purpose 40 g lactulose in 100 ml of water was given to all patients via a gastral tube shortly before extubation.	0.5152998289701957
Lactulose is broken down by bacteria once it enters the colon, and H2 is released, taken up by the vascular system and exhaled.	0.48926091982096176
Postoperatively, patients were asked to exhale into a 20-ml syringe every 10 min.	0.546780599786514
The content was analysed for hydrogen (ppm), using an electrochemical sensor (GMI exhaled hydrogen monitor).	0.45064920503333006
From the time of lactulose instillation to a threefold increase in endexpiratory hydrogen concentration (compared to the preoperative value), gastro-coecal transit time was computed.	0.5212837747116668
All three groups of patients were comparable in age, height and body weight.	0.7342421736991984
Also, the duration of operation was comparable in all three groups.	0.7834568968114407
Mean gastro-coecal transit time was 204 ( +/- 19.6 SD) min following enflurane, 302 ( +/- 32.8 SD) min following fentanyl/-midazolam and 210 ( +/- 28.8 SD) min following ketamine/midazolam anaesthesia.	0.5991025239274937
The gastro-intestinal inhibition after the opioid-based anaesthetic technique was significantly prolonged (p<0.001, Kruskal-Wallis test).	0.4770310132497191
There was no significance between patients after ketamine-based anaesthesia and those who had the volatile anaesthetic.	0.6060183544273718
When using intravenous anaesthesia with an opioid, gastro-intestinal inhibition, especially in patients prone to have constipation, is likely to develop postoperatively.	0.6931743939444532
In classical neuroleptanaesthesia and in analgosedation in the ICU, the simultaneous use of the butyrophenone droperidol seems to counteract the inhibition of opioid-related gastrointestinal motility.	0.5561140274570232
In cases of opioid-related gastrointestinal atonia a gastrokinetic compound may be necessary to overcome this effect on intestinal motility.	0.5114516435297326
In a prospective study 20 patients were monitored with serial sonograms and radiographs during distraction osteogenesis at the lower limb.	0.5504338897269729
All sonograms were obtained in four planes using a 7.5 MHz transducer.	0.5753173269550931
The distraction gap was seen as a sonolucent area in all patients after corticotomy.	0.656792814349723
At an average of 20.7 (14-28) days after the beginning of the distraction, echogenic foci occurred and showed increasing longitudinal alignment with further distraction.	0.7814318667455833
Radiographical signs of beginning mineralization were seen an average of 48.3 days after the start of the distraction.	0.6781618855981737
Exact measurement of the distraction gap was possible in all patients during lengthening.	0.7727893792900137
Bone healing complications and hematoma could be detected by ultrasound.	0.5561431038464613
A rapid increase of bone mineralization was seen after the distraction was stopped.	0.5164402071729323
With increasing cortication of the regenerate bone, sonograms showed a hyper-reflecting solid line so that further mineralization and the time of removal of the fixator could not be assessed by ultrasound.	0.5531012077654972
Ultrasound is more sensitive than radiography in identifying new bone formation during distraction, measuring the length of the distraction gap, and detecting early bone-healing complications and can therefore reduce the need for radiographs.	0.6341479348654195
The interval between the onset of symptoms in patients with head and neck cancers and the introduction of treatment was evaluated.	0.6566265759548437
During a 1-year period, patients were interviewed to determine the duration of any delays from the onset of complaints until the first visit to a doctor.	0.730567135582278
Also asked was how long it took to be referred to an ENT specialist and actual referral to our department.	0.3825952884962447
We then determined the interval from diagnosis to the introduction of therapy.	0.5291057555022178
It was found that the delay of patients who went directly to an otorhinolaryngologist was shorter (median, 8 weeks) than that of patients who first went to their family doctors (median, 13 weeks) (P<0.02).	0.8472062108187438
The latter then took an additional 4 weeks before sending patients to an otorhinolaryngologist.	0.41138317650008405
Referral from the ENT specialist to our department took another 2 weeks, as well as our staging and pre-therapeutic management.	0.5088665394197501
Our findings show that the patient himself is the critical factor in delaying diagnosis and therapy.	0.6433898894483905
Tumor patients with greater professional qualification went to their doctors earlier (P<0.0001) or more often went directly to an ENT specialist (P<0.002).	0.5179952714793171
Consultations of physicians without experience in otorhinolaryngology caused yet further delays.	0.29169939107347304
The present study deals with long-term dimensional changes in cemented Müller-type total hip endoprostheses.	0.5082171580549504
Creep and wear contribute to different extents to the dimensional changes in polyethylene.	0.3068130663058802
The total amount of polyethylene wear is represented by the displacement of the femoral head into the socket.	0.47419246857778785
Within the first postoperative years, the head shifts up to a relatively high rate of about 0.5 mm per year.	0.9942025317024148
This rate diminishes after 5 years to an average of about 0.1 mm (ceramics) and 0.2 mm (metal) per year.	0.7696653806344843
Values exceeding 0.2 mm per year for the shift of the femoral head are considered to be unfavourable with regard to a probable loosening of the prosthesis.	0.6340098018699063
In this study we determined the orientation of the centre of the prosthetic head in relation to the wire marker of the polyethylene cup, comprising in all 369 total hip prostheses.	0.6638199980560335
After an average of 77 months, 96 % of the prostheses with ceramic heads (n = 109) had a wear rate of less than 0.2 mm per year.	0.7454723612577655
Using metal heads (Protasul-2 and Protasul-10) this rate could only be measured in 71 % (n = 109) of the prostheses (61.5 months).	0.7396807173219219
The combination ceramics-polyethylene produces half of the total amount of wear produced by metal-polyethylene.	0.44156951537719114
Younger patients should preferably be treated with a ceramic ballhead.	0.6113689205287085
The so-called amyopathic dermatomyositis is a rare variant of dermatomyositis which has attracted increasing interest during the last years.	0.5497106276392697
One finds the classical signs of dermatomyositis such as periorbital edema and erythema, erythematous macular and papular lesions localized at bony prominences (so-called Gottron's papules), generalized pruritus, photosensitivity, and a cutaneous histopathologic picture compatible with skin lesions of dermatomyositis.	0.5041673944606974
Crucial for the diagnosis is the exclusion of myositis by clinical examination, EMG and histology.	0.7424472732477586
Furthermore, longterm supervision of patients is advisable in order not to miss the appearance of early signs of myositis.	0.5076271167045385
The longest reported follow-up of amyopathic dermatomyositis patient is 4 years; however, it cannot be excluded that these cases will eventually culminate in classical dermatomyositis.	0.5800318966111536
In this paper we describe two cases and discuss the differential diagnosis and therapy; also, the term "Premyopathic dermatomyositis" is proposed, to indicate that the full picture is to be expected in most cases.	0.8646833941441906

This study compares the results of the outpatient-based program of the Cochlear Implant Center Ruhr with inpatient-based rehabilitation, which is almost exclusively performed in Germany.	0.6262750010565895
The Department of Otorhinolaryngology at the University of Essen in Germany provided 52 patients with either 22- or 24-channel Nucleus cochlear implants from March 1996 to July 1999.	0.5993333473032112

Syringe drivers are used in anaesthetics, intensive care and emergency medicine to deliver small volumes of highly potent drugs with continuous, constant and reproducible flow.	0.49834288361176815
For early recognition of interruptions of the drug delivery caused by occlusion of the infusion system, an alarm is triggered as soon as the system pressure exceeds a certain limit.	0.6085841709892249
The sensitivity of this alarm depends on the flow rate, type-specific cut-off pressure and the elastic parameters of the infusion system.	0.7247138113868151
The sudden release of pressure built up in the system after occlusion occurred can cause delivery of an uncontrolled drug bolus and hence an additional hazard.	0.47110103832876443
Methods: Six syringe drivers that are widely used in clinical practice were tested for alarm delay and bolus delivery in the event of an occlusion in the system.	0.6391946290079406
First, the alarm pressures at flow rates of 10, 50 and 100 ml/h were measured.	0.620883325855812
Then the alarm delay time and bolus volumes post-occlusion were assessed, using a basic infusion system (syringe+single infusion set).	0.5565117280879993
Finally, several alterations to the system like extension, tap battery with germ filters or branching were made and their impact on alarm delay and bolus volume measured.	0.4784577169689583
Results: Because of the great differences in alarm pressures between the devices tested, there were marked differences in the alarm delay at same flow rates.	0.725006093202635
Predictably, there was an indirect proportional link between alarm delay and flow rate.	0.7124624209444115
Using the basic infusion system, alarm delays between 23 s and 143 min were measured.	0.3306308351693341
In two of the tested syringe drivers, a pressure-release mechanism is activated with the pressure alarm, which prevented bolus application.	0.7135699629209726
In the other devices, release of the pressure in the occluded system caused boli of 0.5-7 ml.	0.8324993504842086
Variations in the actual syringe volume and insertion of a second connection tube had no impact on alarm delay and bolus volume.	0.516534951481332
Tap batteries, parallel running syringe drivers or trapped air in the system, however, caused marked increase in both alarm delay (107%) and bolus volume (+147%).	0.5383766788406862
Discussion: Unidentified occlusions of the system cause grave malfunctioning of syringe drivers.	0.44249294944866013
While applying highly potent drugs, the discontinuation of drug delivery with subsequent bolus application can cause vital danger to the patient.	0.49989510608855703
As a result of the significant time delays in the pressure alarms, the devices tested do not provide sufficient protection against unrecognized system occlusion.	0.622506003362798
Syringe drivers with adjustable alarm pressure can be set close to the actual infusion pressure.	0.4642141293619097
A further important point is that one should aim at a reduction in the elastic properties of the infusion set because of the great impact on alarm delay and bolus volume.	0.6335025850438168
Because the overall results of conservative treatment for distal radial fractures have been unsatisfactory, it is rarely used.	0.6482767241988872
However, minimally invasive methods such as stabilization by external fixation and percutaneous K-wire pinning are being increasingly used.	0.5224875922094266
A justified indication for the use of K-wire pinning is that it provides an opportunity to achieve good and very good short- and long-term anatomic and functional results.	0.665358986669559
Short-term supplementary immobilization with a minimized plaster cast or protective external fixation is generally considered to be useful.	0.5834740056665116

The indications therefore need to be further specified.	0.4824236044341696

Wet autoclaving is a simple, reliable and time-effective method for antigen retrieval in routinely processed archival material.	0.512394156717183

Wet autoclaving may allow successful application of antibodies in paraffin-embedded tissues designed for use on frozen sections.	0.388348357412954
The technique has the poten-tial to reliably handle up to 200 sections at a time, without evidence of any significant damage to the sections or nuclear morphology.	0.5833133495014413
Classical stable plate osteosynthesis with its anatomical repositioning, absolute stability between fragments and medial support should only be applied to joint fractures and spongy bone.	0.4915406451212091
In cortical bone, the anatomical reposition connected with the plate promotes bone necrosis along the fracture and prevents callus formation.	0.5544019569189453
Direct cortical synthesis, a method also known as "primary bone healing", serves the bone's revascularisation and is not necessarily aimed at healing.	0.643813341226701
Thus, this may also be termed "necrosis healing".	0.6480412063904833
Along the shaft of long bones, elastic plate osteosynthesis, a biological method, is safer than and superior to the rigid technique.	0.6649334952627681
This even applies to short oblique and transverse fractures insofar as nailing does not appear feasible.	0.30874181083776714
Elasticity is achieved by leaving a flexible stretch of at least 2 - 4 holes, i.e.	0.5892666259559379
as long as possible, without screws over the fracture and by employing a titanium plate.	0.6102858968729021
Thus, there is no punctate fatigue leading to plate breakage.	0.5473780488359974
The fitting of third fragments is deliberately left out.	0.2302264753190316
The same applies to all kinds of compression with lag screws, tension devices or DC-gliding holes - and this with the intention of allowing micromovements in the fracture's fissure.	0.5659507022741003
Periost and muscle are not removed and the fracture is not examined.	0.4473268366518296
Healing occurs spontaneously via a fixating callus forming within the first 3 - 6 weeks out of the periost-soft tissue combination.	0.670558152767955
Histomorphological investigation dates the first woven- bone bridges between the fragments to 3 weeks subsequent to the accident.	0.4137134339199101
In Göttingen University trauma centre, 87 fractures have been attended to over 2 years using this technique.	0.47926852216134497
Despite considerable soft-tissue damage, no delayed bone healing, pseudoarthrosis or bone infection has been observed.	0.530778730493039
The risks of elastic plate osteosynthesis lie in unbiological and exaggerated reposition methods, too short a flexible stretch, and insufficient anchorage of the screws.	0.6227429351749126

Both methods are available throughout Germany.	0.5203453039414822

There was no relationship between the two pressure types and the different species of microorganisms responsible for the inflammation.	0.7217485999742874

These advantages were not related to patient age.	0.36310141933759277
The complication rate was comparable for both groups; however, both groups showed an elevation of the complication rate in the age groups 75 to 84 years.	0.6749584093620515
The mortality rate within the first 30 days after nephrectomy was 1.7% in the open nephrectomy group.	0.8081501084439137
Conclusions: The laparoscopic nephrectomy offers comparable operative results (with less blood loss and a lower transfusion rate) when compared to open nephrectomy.	0.7522182814985867
In terms of postoperative parameters, patients in the laparoscopy group have significant advantages.	0.7209667253266677
Especially geriatric patients benefit from these advantages and, therefore, the laparoscopic approach should be the preferred technique for a nephrectomy in these patients.	0.6334952749988713

Medial tilting of the talus with vertical position provokes flattening of the medial arch and abduction of the forefoot.	0.583684040887262
Varus position of the calcis and lateral direction of the talus (as in residual clubfoot), however, causes supination and adduction of the forefoot.	0.6143963454010146
Repair of deformities in the hindfoot therefore also influences the forefoot.	0.3359809095459971
A large number of various osteotomies have been proposed at both bones.	0.4119970753387729
The most popular ones are Dwyer's osteotomy at the corpus of the calcis and its modification described by Mitchell at the same location for correction of the cavus foot and the residual clubfoot, and the lengthening osteotomy at the neck of the calcaneum according to Evans.	0.5624782282045997
Indication and operative technique of these three procedures are described in detail.	0.7194804446765402
The closing wedge osteotomy according to Dwyer is indicated in cases of cavus feet.	0.40950713243516257
In clubfeet the os calcis is usually too short and the medial opening wedge osteotomy provokes skin problems.	0.38769623043298335
In these cases an osteotomy according to Mitchell with lateral displacement of the tuber calcanei is more suitable.	0.5018043061257904
In flat- and skewfeet a lengthening osteotomy at the neck of the calcaneum according to Evans can be indicated, especially when the load of the foot is bigger medially under the talus rather than at the lateral margin of the foot.	0.6490995858221027
If these procedures are carried out carefully, they have low complications rates.	0.5262016336454743

It supplies a realistic simulation of different in vivo situations concerning microvascular anastomosis.	0.30419482514006047
As to availability, handling and costs the placenta is superior to animal models and has replaced them almost completely in our educational concept.	0.43382123313779836
Since Manfred Bleuler's description of the clinical picture of late onset schizophrenia over 50 years ago, debate has persisted as to whether it is justifiable to differentiate this as a valid, independent entity from the group of classic schizophrenic disorders with early onset.	0.6387029160652272
As this review shows, this question cannot be answered unequivocally even now.	0.5501073864061151
It must rather be remarked that we have neither been able to decisively extend our knowledge since Manfred Bleuler's comprehensive contribution, nor managed to achieve a much sounder basis methodologically.	0.42575032493708176
The reasons for this are the international conceptual and terminological confusion that has developed around this illness group, and on the other hand the methodological limitations of the empirical studies conducted on this clinical picture so far.	0.617378898756707
Definition of the problem: In parallel with public and philosophical discussions, there is an ongoing debate about euthanasia in theological ethics.	0.5688600178081628
In this situation it is helpful to provide a systematic overview of the different arguments and judgements.	0.7022693247848556
Arguments: A short introduction is followed by a first part dealing with the definition of terms.	0.7632697175627827
The second and major part concerning normative arguments is subdivided into three steps: the level of principles, the more concrete level of actions and finally the level of social consequences.	0.6174129055253622
The third part presents some reflections following the eudaimonistic ethical tradition (the ethics of a good life and death) focusing on the central question: how to find meaning in life when faced with suffering.	0.5382161631506108
Conclusion: It would be fruitful to intensify the ethical reflection both on the problems concerning the foundations of social life, especially the meaning of dignity, autonomy and inviolability of human life, and social consequences of a liberal practice of euthanasia.	0.6005062917626279
In this context ethicists are challenged to reflect on the different approaches to what is or can be a good life and a human death.	0.5603688973835527

Despite the combination of all three therapeutic options, there is still a large number of treatment failures and therefore major questions remain.	0.6102014250017603
Recent investigations suggest that mutations of the p53 tumor supressor gene may account for some of the therapeutic failures.	0.5530939948632014

From all patients, biopsy and resection material was available for immunohistochemical analysis of p53.	0.4528838068128568
After radiation treatment, 51 patients (57%) showed a complete response; 39 patients (43%) only showed a partial response or did not respond at all.	0.7923969235210854
Among the responders, 82% of the pretherapeutic tumors were p53 positive, whereas among the nonresponders only 56% of the pretherapeutic tumors were p53 positive.	0.5920829613593772
The majority of the residual tumors were also p53 negative according to immunohistology after radiation treatment.	0.48371978705366664

The human cartilage and bone is characterized by a remodeling during the life, well balanced by neosynthesis and degradation of matrix components.	0.5607008572095694
In different joint diseases, it becomes imbalanced and the destruction of the cartilage supersedes the repair.	0.6123717617039988
In tissue processes in disease and in normal turnover of the matrix, these molecules are fragmented and released into surrounding fluids, in the synovial fluid, and then in the blood and the urin, where they can be detected.	0.7882305459630291
The quantitative measurement in the synovial fluid is more specific than in the other body fluids.	0.6525376228883711
The research process in recent years has suggested that these molecular markers of cartilage and bone matrix metabolism can be used to determine diagnosis, the disease severity rather than its presence or absence, the prognosis, and the response to therapy.	0.8258202209427555
They should help to identify the disease mechanism in different joint diseases not only on the tissue but also on the molecular level.	0.6408290129386008

The research in this area is still in the early stages, with most results dated from the end of the 1980s and the 1990s.	0.7730433754878353
Axillary block is a common anaesthetic technique for operations on the hand and forearm.	0.6706838428205089
In our hospital, with many trainees in anaesthesia, only 250 - 300 axillary blocks per year are performed by about 30 colleagues.	0.7316745986802985
This implies a small number of blocks for each anaesthetist.	0.3548968780840958
The present study was designed to assess whether it is possible to teach this technique and use it with an adequate degree of success under these conditions.	0.6719028160217625
We used a nerve stimulator and studied whether the success of the block under these conditions is independent of anaesthetist's experience in this technique.	0.5677596997455066
Furthermore, we examined other factors involved in the success of the block.	0.8728367024590716
The study included 112 patients subjected to elective surgery of the upper extremity; all received an axillary block.	0.6386984699342848
We used a nerve stimulator and injected mepivacaine 1% without adrenaline.	0.4420439015908119
The following parameters were recorded: the number of blocks to date performed by the anaesthetist; the minimal current required for nerve stimulation; the dose of local anaesthetic; the time between the end of injection and the beginning of surgery; the duration of surgery; and the quality of sensory and motor blockade after 10, 20, and 30 min.	0.8434089976481232
Sensory blockade was assessed by the pinprick method (no blockade, analgesia, anaesthesia); motor blockade was judged by comparing the muscle strength of both arms (no blockade, paresis, paralysis).	0.5499565935675241
Data were analyzed using the Mann-Whitney test, with P<0.05 considered statistically significant.	0.6645450372718901
Of the 112 blocks, 95 (85%) were successful; 17 (15%) failed and the patients required general anaesthesia.	0.7613443856444533
Eight of the successful blocks showed a decrease in analgesic quality after >=70 min and required additional analgesics or general anaesthesia.	0.4582632298546961
We found no correlation between the experience of the anaesthetist and the success of the block.	0.6998116647258018
The minimal required current for nerve stimulation in the success group was 0.4 mA and differed significantly from the value of 0.6 mA in the failure group (Table 3).	0.6392908876421018
The dose of mepivacaine was higher in the success group (5.9 vs. 5.3 mg/kg).	0.9045776061804537
Complete sensory blockade was more frequently achieved for the median, ulnar, and radial nerves than for the musculocutaneous and cutaneous brachii medialis (Fig.	0.4865725836564411
The frequency of complete sensory blockade (anaesthesia) had increased by 21.9% between the 20th and 30th min.	0.6405090414966215
Complete motor blockade was less often achieved than sensory blockade (Fig.	0.3263052766901092
Using the method of electrostimulation, the axillary block is an appropriate anaesthetic technique that can be applied in a hospital where each anaesthetist only occasionally performs it.	0.7529831801095433
Prior to injection of the local anaesthetic, the current for nerve stimulation should be reduced to <0.5 mA.	0.8749262913376568
The time between the end of injection and the beginning of surgery should be no less than 30 min because complete sensory blockade can more often be achieved.	0.5049393396625019
The dose of mepivacaine should be no less than 6 mg/kg body weight.	0.5686833826030974
Vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) was discovered 10 years ago as a growth factor that can regulate angiogenesis and in addition the permeability of blood vessels.	0.6150125341735919
Numerous studies have revealed that it is essential for normal embryonic development and that it plays a major role in physiological and pathological events of angiogenesis in adults.	0.6585788567668248
It is unique in that its expression is regulated directly by hypoxia.	0.3452539726090206
These properties are now being exploited in attempts aimed at the induction of new blood vessels in pathological situations such as ischemic heart disease.	0.4314370344815676
Five VEGF forms of 121 to 206 amino-acids are produced from a single gene by alternative splicing.	0.38066853909108456
Cells expressing VEGF usually express several forms simultaneously.	0.20268971770361652
VEGF121 does not contain exons 6 and 7 of the gene and consequently lacks a heparin binding ability.	0.47991243846765835
However, this form is fully  active as an inducer of angiogenesis, and as a blood vessel permeabilizing agent.	0.7373811084385592
Exon 6 and 7 contain 2 independent heparin binding domains.	0.3687272140060575
The VEGF form containing exon 7 (VEGF165) and the vascular endothelial growth factor form containing exon 6 (VEGF145) display similar biological potencies raising the question of why so many VEGF forms are required.	0.5862625295305849
It was found that VEGF121 diffuses better because it does not bind to heparan-sulfate proteoglycans.	0.4209549563032157
In contrast, VEGF145 binds to extracellular matrix ad is released from it slowly.	0.29167422046989266
When the receptor binding properties of VEGF121 and VEGF165 were compared it was found that VEGF165 binds to a class of VEGF receptors that is not recognized by VEGF121.	0.46901726980648406
These receptors are encoded by the neuropilin-1 gene, and we have recently found that the related neuropilin-2 gene also encodes a VEGF165 receptor.	0.5851284396490822
We have recently found evidence indicating the neuropilins form complexes with another VEGF receptor, VEGFR-1.	0.33747895109603404
However, the biological function of this complex remains to be elucidated.	0.665041302124922
In addition to mucositis and myelotoxicity as well known early reactions after radiotherapy or radiochemotherapy in advanced head and neck tumors, late toxicity following treatment is an often underestimated problem.	0.5566053205989147
The healing of wounds by secondary  intention is a simple method to close  operative defects.	0.5766568554231876
The quality of wound healing will depend on the anatomic site on the face as well as on size and depth of the  defect.	0.7150396001534708
Best functional and cosmetic results are obtained at locations with concave  geometry and when the defect lies  symmetrically at the interface of two  anatomic subunits.	0.478392559510059
Partial reconstruction or guiding sutures can create a symmetric  defect in relation to anatomic subunits which will heal by second intention.	0.34152468185195606
This simple and efficient operative procedure is ilustrated by two case reports.	0.40466821221993854

The typical clinical features of myasthenia gravis are weakness and excessive fatiguability of striated muscles that increases during the course of the day or after strenous exercise.	0.5703786072324547
Ocular muscle involvement with ptosis (in 50%) and diplopia (in 25%) are the most common initial signs.	0.8795147746246255
The disease can progress to bulbar muscles and to all other striated muscles (generalized myasthenia).	0.45218088819192215
The muscle fatiguability and a fluctuating course can mislead to a diagnosis of neurasthenia.	0.3870533265886645
Since the treatment of myasthenia gravis is directed at the pathogenetic mechanisms of the disease an early diagnosis is of great significance for the course of the disease.	0.8237519073717443
Also, a false positive diagnosis of myasthenia has to be avoided because of the potentially hazardous side effects of the therapy.	0.8410949305476004
The mainstay of the diagnosis is the history and a subtle clinical examination with tests of excessive muscle fatiguability.	0.7242670216801439
The injection of edrophonium (Tensilon), the electrodiagnostic testing after repitive stimulation (decrement test) and the testing for serum antibodies against acetylcholin receptors have to be performed to secure the diagnosis of myasthenia.	0.7092861927086441
The edrophonium test and the decrement test can yield false positive results in other neuromuscular diseases.	0.4394798589084452
Antibodies are present in 50% of ocular myasthenia and in 80-90% of the generalized form.	0.6719319021902294
The Lambert-Eaton myasthenic syndrome, other neuromuscular diseases, mitochondrial diseases, diseases of the cranial nerves, botulism and the rare congenital myasthenic syndromes have to be considered as differential diagnosis.	0.6109786428737485

Primary vasculitides are of unknown origin while secondary vasculitides may be caused by drugs, malignancy or infection.	0.377064543408825

After successful treatment of the infection, the vasculitis usually subsides.	0.709380565000751
Therefore, all patients with vasculitis should be evaluated for underlying infection.	0.8927340873589638

The draining sinus is an unpleasant complication of acne conglobata, acne fulminans, acne inversa, rosacea conglobata and rosacea fulminans (pyoderma faciale).	0.3664870718051976
It is most common on the face, especially in the nasolabial folds, and on the neck below the mandibular line.	0.6929447640090813
Clinically, it is an elongated (2-5 cm long), elevated, periodically inflamed lesion, which sporadically discharges pus.	0.7658240810389727
The lesion persists with no tendency to spontaneous regression.	0.3349893829089125
Histopathologically, it consists of elaborate, epithelialized galleries connected to the skin surface at multiple points.	0.6074781783922335
It contains corneocytes, hairs, bacteria, serum, inflammatory cells and epitheloid granulomas.	0.5193641771946423
A surgical thread placed into the skin provides a model in which the generation of sinus tracts can be studied.	0.5791128837219442
Intralesional corticosteroid injection, cryosurgery and isotretinoin are not always very effective.	0.3927522829773323
Sometimes complete excision of the lesion is necessary.	0.7143035821603773
The draining sinus is a special form of scar analogous to the pilonidal cyst.	0.39210230296467585

Thoracic outlet syndrome is a clinical diagnosis.	0.5758165062578094

Methods: In June 1997 a questionnaire was sent to 598 German and Austrian anaesthesiologists specialized in pain therapy.	0.4794982956809921
Questions concerning the use of medicaments for epidural and intrathecal treatment of chronic pain were asked.	0.6248401836346007
Results: The response rate was 23%.	0.5993080306840284
The data show that 78% of the anaesthesiologists use epidural or intrathecal analgesia in the therapy of chronic pain.	0.6448398032484721
Local anaesthetics are used by 85% of these anaesthesiologists, followed by morphine (72%), clonidine (48%), buprenorphine (34%), baclofen (20%), fentanyl (13%) and sufentanil (10%).	0.7397450900251256
For most of the treatments local anaesthetics are used, again followed by opioids und clonidine.	0.5683809617164886
In the 137 answering pain clinics 79.821 epidural and intrathecal analgetic treatments are performed per year.	0.3509295906602848
Discussion: Epidural and intrathecal pain therapy is frequently used in Germany and Austria, either as a complementary or alternative treatment to systemic pain therapy.	0.6359192114687114
Local anaesthetics followed by opioids are the most commonly used medicaments for this treatment.	0.5617057075098228
For some of the applied substances neurotoxicological data are lacking.	0.54070540427627
The use of these substances has to be considered very carefully.	0.8355837388306696
Intraartial conduction disturbances (IACD) are the known substrate of re-entrant atrial arrhythmias and their diagnosis is important for the selection of proper therapy.	0.6384277391081107
Signs of IACD can be missed on the standard ECG, and signal averaged (SA) P wave analysis has proved valuable for the evaluation of electrophysiological (EPS) properties of atrial myocardium.	0.501329966230288
Unfavourable EPS effects of RAA pacing are known to electrophysiologists, but this aspect is rarely considered in normal practice, and RAA based pacing modes remain standard even for pts.	0.6073626235026705
We examined and compared EPS effects of different atrial pacing modes using two diagnostic tools: IEGM obtained from two atrial leads of biatrial pacing system (via telemetry) and time domain analysis of SA P wave in 22 pts.	0.5317470707658701
with BiA pacing system (implanted due to atrial arrhythmias and IACD).	0.38667629846890256
The results showed that different atrial pacing modes influence atrial activation timing parameters differently: RAA pacing aggravates IACD in comparison to sinus rhythm; the effects of CS pacing is less visible.	0.5163069345747019
BiA pacing normalises all atrial activation times.	0.20665301225384164
The normalisation of SA P wave duration, reduction of SA P wave dispersion, increasing of RMS 20 and decreasing of LAS 5 and finally abolition of presence of late atrial potentials in most of pts.	0.4667925309537145
indicates beneficial effects of BiA pacing (in pts.	0.5527925989580914
with IACD) in comparison to sinus rhythm and RAA pacing.	0.7128793997973136
Unfavourable EPS effects of RAA pacing in patients with IACD indicates suitability the need for alternative (resynchronising) atrial pacing modes.	0.4465565663851455
Time domain analysis of SA P wave is a valuable and sensitive diagnostic tool for non-invasive evaluation of EPS effects of different modes of atrial pacing.	0.5793082343980132

Chronic lymphoplasmacellular osteomyelitis may occur in children, adolescents and adults, but has not been found in newborns or babies either in our series or in the literature.	0.7177099175075365
Symptoms suggesting an acute disease like fever are uncommon, but a primary chronic course with symptomatic and asymptomatic periods is typical.	0.5083004670708738
Pain and swelling are the main symptoms; painless masses are rare.	0.5848373906090291
In children and adolescents the clavicle and metaphyseal regions of long bones are typical sites of chronic abacterial osteomyelitis.	0.5978558559733929
In adults the clavicles or the first two ribs are mainly affected with synovitis of the adjacent joints, but the long bones are rarely involved.	0.7094858635163612
Laboratory findings are non-specific but important for the differential diagnosis.	0.6671384808238308
The sedimentation rate and c-reactive protein might be elevated.	0.3758937462823581
The X-ray examination shows osteolytic, sclerotic or mixed bony changes and, in case of a diaphyseal involvement, onionskinlike periosteal bone formation may be present, suggesting a malignant process.	0.5985289865097945
In late stages sclerotic bone formations may be seen as a rest.	0.5392922047242913
Uni- or multifocal lesions can be detected by bonescan, as can asymptomatic lesions.	0.8054964801448637
Magnetic resonance imaging shows gross signal intensity differences both in the bone and perifocal soft tissue and involvement of the synovium with gadolinium DPTA enhancement in T1-weighted images.	0.5705099670661776
In early stages of the disease granulocytes, microabscesses and new bone formations might suggest bacterial osteomyelitis that cannot be differentiated by histology.	0.6047023196951855
In intermediate phases lymphocytic and plasmacellular infiltrates are found, whereas in late phases sclerotic bone formations and fibrosis of the bone marrow are seen histologically.	0.5983872620803669
In chronic lymphoplasmacellular osteomyelitis, all clinical, radiological and histological findings, as well as negative bacteriological cultures, are mandatory and will allow a definitive diagnosis to be made.	0.6207932086959862
The disease may be uni- or multifocal, and new bone lesions may occur over time, as well as skin manifestations, which can be found years before or after bone involvement.	0.7622012886102967
The association with dermatological diseases and/or synovitis led to the acronym SAPHO syndrome (synovitis, acne, pustulosis, hyperostosis, osteomyelitis).	0.5181338935779545
For the treatment non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs are effective for pain relief, reduction of swelling and dysfunction.	0.7144825231953729
Antibiotics have been used in several series and are not effective.	0.7084097135265427
Major surgery is not recommended even for recurrences, and the prognosis for growth and function is excellent in the long term despite recurrences over several years.	0.796218407977015
A woman with severe stiff-man syndrome showed periodic cardiovascular dysregulation.	0.36936452185443674
The blood pressure changed spontaneously every 5-10 min.	0.6058512914259293
This rhythm was also maintained after relaxation.	0.26039442684189523
However, the vegetative and motoric disturbances disappeared after intrathecal application of baclofen.	0.46290544825559016
It is speculated that spinal GABAergic mechanisms are responsible for the tonic regulation of the cardiovascular system.	0.49661341254332864
The frequency and prognostic relevance of sarcoid-likelesions and microcarcinosis in regional lymph nodes in gastric cancer (n = 113; pT1-3, pN0-1, pM0, R0) were investigated; the prognostic value was compared with pT and pN stage, grading and Laurén's tumor classification with Cox's multivariate regression-model.	0.5783937849534221
Sarcoid like lesions were found in 34 % of the cases (n = 113).	0.7043507806781871
Statistical analysis did not indicate that they had any prognostic value or showed whether or not microcarcinosis or metastasis was present; they were independent of pT stage, histological tumor type, tumor grading, and the clinical course of disease.	0.7229640213113492
Microcarcinosis (defined as scattered carcinoma cells within lymph node sinuses or pulp without adjacent stromal reaction) was revealed by immunohistochemistry in 90 % of pN0 cases; the presence of 3 or more tumor cells per lymph node section in over 10 % of sampled lymph nodes per case carried a significant prognostic value.	0.5985765810770806
In microcarcinosis without evidence of metastasis, the number of tumor cells and the number of involved lymph nodes are of prognostic value.	0.6276171907652757

TMLR (Transmyocardial laser revascularization) is a disputed cardiosurgical technique available in Europe since 1994 that aims to deliver additional blood flow to ischemic myocardium from the left heart chamber.	0.4991988814558276
Goal of our study is morphological examination of laser channels in human hearts to answer the questions: Are there patent laser channels with communication to the left chamber and to intramural vessels?	0.5851482010968718
We examined hearts of 10 patients who died during the first 18 days after TMLR.	0.6891998841603807
Channels were examined in histological serial sections under the light microscope.	0.4655070243588504
Laser channels in the first days postoperatively have a lumen diameter of about 1 mm and are surrounded by coagulation necrosis about 500 µm thick.	0.535020427495825
Despite phagocytic removal of necrotic tissue the lumen diameter decreases during the following two weeks.	0.42512576265135144
Open intramyocardial channels can be shown in all patients.	0.4501649904957823
These channels communicate with intramural vessels, but in no instance with chamber lumen.	0.5710676554256899
Our results suggest that clinical benefits are based on improved distribution of coronary blood.	0.45873945633174695
Additional blood is not delivered from left chamber lumen to the myocardium.	0.3754799085410137

50 %) due to chromosomal aberrations.	0.4447284160498017

Several placebo-controlled studies have been performed.	0.7123168757347644
Due to the small number of cases, results were not significant.	0.7952454159931

The first electronic implantable hearing aids for patients with hearing loss are coupled to the ossicular chain or perilymph during implantation and are now available.	0.5438812854808753
Our new Tübingen implant designed for sensorineural hearing loss (SNHL) is the combination of an implantable microphone and piezotransducer.	0.5983478473990244
To avoid hearing losses during implantation, the Tübingen piezotransducer will be (1) fixed to the mastoid cavity and (2) positioned to one of the ossicular target points.	0.6461674589610326
This can be done with a micromanipulator which will be implanted together with transducer and microphone in the mastoid cavity.	0.5636699390061712
The manipulator weights 0.7 g. With four degrees of freedom, it allows highly secure and safe positioning of the transducer's probe tip to the ossicular chain under close to stereotactic conditions.	0.6610478401408513

Following integrated safety as the leading principle, ossicular or inner ear injuries caused, e.g., by the patient's head movement or unintentional manual contact by the surgeon, are minimized.	0.6379463263162377

Sevoflurane, like all currently used volatile anaesthetics, is degraded by carbon dioxide absorbents.	0.5439194449499953
The most significant degradant is a haloalkene known trivially as "compound A".	0.5115418524577592
Compound A is nephrotoxic in rats and, at higher doses, in nonhuman primates, causing proximal tubular necrosis.	0.6467619598456323
There has been much interest in the potential for compound A toxicity in humans.	0.6258321136887196
Inhaled compound A concentrations are greatest at low flow rates, high sevoflurane concentrations, warmer absorbent, barium hydroxide vs soda lime, and drier absorbent.	0.5370851995612371
Typical inspired compound A concentrations during low-flow and closed-circuit sevoflurane anaesthesia in humans are 8-24 and 20-32 ppm with soda lime and barium hydroxide lime, respectively.	0.5140430625271502
Renal effects of compound A production during sevoflurane anesthesia have been examined in surgical patients and volunteers, using standard (creatinine clearance, serum BUN and creatinine) and experimental (urine excretion of protein, glucose, NAG, GST, AAP) markers of renal function.	0.5469913129256555
Investigations to date in surgical patients show similar renal effects of low-flow sevoflurane, low-flow isoflurane or high-flow sevoflurane.	0.8252196054021373
There have been no case reports of compound A-associated renal injury in humans.	0.5975522032729961
In volunteers, one study found changes in experimental but not conventional renal markers, while other investigations show no significant changes in either standard or experimental markers.	0.5822233737774194
The mechanism of compound A nephrotoxicity in rats appears to involve metabolism to glutathione and cysteine conjugates, and their subsequent renal uptake and metabolism by pathways that are different in rats and humans.	0.5345256462534271

Results: Patients in group 1 revealed elevated levels of IL-12 up to p70 > 1000 pg/ml and p40 > 2500 pg/ml.	0.7444897315300291
The common clinical feature of group 1 was a thorax trauma in combination with pneumonia (85 % survivors).	0.6179303582066532
Patients with single thorax trauma or pneumonia without thorax trauma (group 3) showed normal IL-12 values.	0.7498185598839592
Patients with decreased IL-12 levels revealed also a thorax trauma and pneumonia but all patients succumbed.	0.46444959590731255
The groups significantly differ in their stay in the intensive care unit, in TISS, in MODS score and in respiratory ratio, but not in ISS, mean CRP values and leukocyte counts.	0.785952907749216
Correlation analysis revealed no significant relation between systemically altered IL-12 values and clinical parameters, with the exception of a negative correlation of p70 and ISS (r = -0.785) or MODS score (r = -0.314) in group 1.	0.6591615793020262

Shoulder impingement is caused by compression of the supraspinatus tendon underneath the coracoacromial arch, mainly in forward flexion of the arm.	0.5078479525536841

Stage I relates to edema and hemorrhage of the supraspinatus tendon.	0.3255677070223421

This technique is less invasive than the pulmonary artery catheter since it only needs a 3 or 4 French catheter in the femoral artery.	0.6168887403454039

The mammalian brain is capable of a substantial functional reorganization, manifesting on a cortical somatotopical and on a behavioral level.	0.38353093974351454
Possible mechanisms are reviewed based on the work by others and ourselves on somatosensory reorganization in humans.	0.4554049945605928
The somatosensory system is characterized by divergent projections from the periphery to the cerebral cortex.	0.44751302225100825

On the other side, sensorimotor training can increase the representational cortical zone of a limb.	0.5978415813968218

Trauma scores in emergency medicine quantitatively characterise the severity of trauma victims' injuries and physiologic derangements.	0.492203622228245
They are used to detect and assess patients and have applications in guiding patient care and early therapeutic decisions.	0.5522206259398974
In the pre-clinical setting, an effective trauma index meets the following criteria: - It is highly reliable with regard to identifying high- and low-risk patients.	0.7612084364854773
- It has high face-validity.	0.678791656004811
- It has high inter- and intra-rater reliability.	0.7452311531645369
- It is easy to use and allows rapid, accurate measurements.	0.7100314762697019
The most widely accepted injury severity index is probably the Injury Severity Score (ISS).	0.6016360011087596
It is calculated as the sum of the squares of the three most severely injured body regions, and was originally developed as a means to standardise the description of injuries sustained in motor vehicle accidents.	0.6146269654939829
The Trauma Score (TS) represents the gold standard of physiologic scoring of injury severity.	0.49388365873994183
It summarises the numerical assessments of the central nervous and cardiopulmonary system functions.	0.45346714309106456
The recently developed Mainz Emergency Evaluation Score (MEES) is based upon numerical specification of the vital signs, including a pain scale, and has been designed as a dynamic score.	0.765939195346833
Nevertheless, limitations of the established trauma score systems have been described.	0.5907026888034174
Mortality and patient outcome do not strictly correlate with injury severity scoring.	0.4059316580866542
In addition, intubated or paralysed patients were excluded from outcome studies since the scoring systems lacked options for evaluation of pathophysiological conditions after therapeutic interventions.	0.40988504059428355
Thus, therapeutic efficacy could hardly be assessed, and subsequent scoring during time periods was impossible.	0.5503224449372384
The accurate definition of comprehensive evaluation of a trauma victim is challenging, for example, "pain" as chosen in the MEES must be regarded as a highly desirable piece of information although its rating may prove difficult, especially when classifying unconscious patients.	0.6564355368225614
Further criticisms of the above-mentioned trauma indices could include omission of the trauma victim's age, gender, pre-injury health status, or the influence of alcohol or additional medication.	0.563926857791627
Moreover, questioning the interrater reliability of injury severity scoring, a recent study revealed bias in assigning values to trauma patients: trained raters classified injury severity with significantly higher indices than less experienced researchers.	0.46355696265345625
If trauma indices in pre-hospital emergency medicine were relied upon as the only means of evaluating a trauma patient and guiding therapeutic approaches, significant numbers of trauma victims requiring major interventions would be missed.	0.5134540938513111
Resuscitative treatment regimens must not be based solely upon indices, since, e.g., in states of shock injury scores do not correlate with fluid resuscitative requirements.	0.5757828368462381
Furthermore, a qualitative assignment of single vital-function parameters as crucial indices for a patient's condition never reflects the broad range of a patient's profile.	0.6983904747634591
Many multiple-trauma patients do benefit from controlled ventilation in clinical experience even though pulse oximetry values are within the physiological range, and the administration of analgesics or even pre-hospital anaesthesia has often proved advantageous for trauma patients in the field.	0.6742839163003526
Providing the opportunity of subsequent patient evaluation and the efficacy of acute care, the MEES has been developed as a dynamic scoring system.	0.6613078900278354
This design is extremely desirable and must be regarded as an indispensible criterion for future scoring systems.	0.41265044225701836
In view of the peculiarities of field emergency medicine, pre-hospital indices do have limitations.	0.44356493002754493
The parameters "unknown patient", time pressure, unprecise measurements, lack of diagnostic facilities, incomplete evaluation, and limited statistical power cannot be eliminated.	0.521375155589113
Accurate prediction of outcome within early time-frames is therefore not possible.	0.32106414651790766

The usually asymptomatic ossification has a clinical importance only in case of a new trauma.	0.6233753539146956

Patients with hair problems frequently consult the hairdresser prior to the medical specialist.	0.48698400820504845
Thus additional areas of competence should be incorporated into the hairdresser's training qualifications.	0.33835919495490163
Besides manual, creative and psychological aptitudes, "trichological competence" relating to the recognition of most important hair disorders, recognition of personal limitations and cooperation with the medical specialist are required.	0.5621762616283291
