We reexamined biopsy and resection specimens from seven patients with histologically established primary diagnosis of small-cell lung cancer (SCLC) which showed previously undetected adenocarcinomatous differentiation after chemotherapy.	0.5855024483908268
Adenocarcinoma was diagnosed in the same part of the lung as was SCLC before treatment in five cases and in contralateral location in two.	0.7383754969813536
Two tumors showed heterogeneous differentiation with small-cell and adenocarcinomatous components, and five had only adenocarcinoma.	0.6359386650910503
The interval between histological evidence of SCLC and adenocarcinoma was 3 months-5 years.	0.5232353364787394
From the specific findings in the respective patients we can offer two possible explanations for changing differentiation in SCLC after chemotherapy: (a) a primarily heterogeneously differentiated tumor with selection of adenocarcinomatous component under chemotherapy, and (b) an independently developed adenocarcinoma after successful chemotherapy of SCLC, as patients with treated SCLC are known to have an increased risk of non-SCLC.	0.6582652068628311
However, therapy-induced alteration of differentiation seems much more unlikely.	0.5713349084350218
These findings should be considered in diagnosis and therapy of SCLC to allow early and appropriate reaction to non-SCLC components.	0.6413245889441211

The patients in the balneophototherapy group (n=16) were treated with baths containing 3-5% of the synthetic salt Psori-sal, followed immediately by UVA/B irradiation, while the other treatment arm (n=12) received UVA/B phototherapy alone.	0.7561952528715583
After 20 treatments the balneophototherapy group showed a statistically significant (p<=0.0015) reduction of the SCORAD score from 69.5 before to 36.8 after therapy.	0.6109678670737596
No statistically significant reduction in the SCORAD score could be observed in the UVA/B phototherapy group (50.6 before to 44.3 after therapy).	0.7460256789777463
The cumulative UVB dose was significantly lower in the balneophototherapy group (0.9 J/cm2) as compared to the UVA/B monotherapy group (2.0 J/cm2).	0.7287495917768323

It is mandatory to differentiate between traumatic and atraumatic instability when treating shoulder instability.	0.4710827266849471
The traumatic instability is characterized by secondary lesions (Bankart lesion, Hill-Sachs lesion, overstretching of the capsule), which are caused at the time of primary dislocation.	0.6664943858060096
The quality of the capsule has to be considered in close relationship to the appearance of the Bankart lesion.	0.862509129881532
The stronger the capsule, the greater the external force has to be in order to surmount the resistance caused by the capsule.	0.6309663591093118
The damage to the glenoid rim makes it possible to draw conclusions about the condition of the capsule.	0.6076486231836341
In cases of atraumatic instability, secondary lesions are normally absent.	0.4880501411345878
These instabilities are often caused by laxity of the capsule.	0.3288678325494346
When stabilizing, a shoulder two criteria have to be taken into consideration: stability and function.	0.5925023830693429
Reattachment of the labrum alone will not guarantee stability.	0.42450587816274943
Additionally, the overstretched capsule has to be shortened or shifted.	0.5324265172079193
Both criteria are decisive for the success of the stabilizing operation.	0.5037577966230887

There is no evidence indicating that total thyroidectomy could improve the postoperative results in patients with Graves' disease.	0.6481501086232003
In Germany, thyroidectomy with cervicocentral lymph node dissection is the standard procedure for all differentiated thyroid carcinomas.	0.6293055734007695
However, there are no data to prove that this approach is superior to less radical procedures.	0.7976564945017058

The operative technique of thyroidectomy is presented as well as the technique of cervical lymphadenectomy in consideration of the lymphatic drainage of the thyroid gland.	0.772478385499975
Tyrosinemia type I is an autosomal recessively inherited deficiency of fumarylacetoacetate hydrolase resulting in accumulation of tyrosin and its degradation products (succinylacetoacetone mainly).	0.37900708255196075
Typical clinical features include liver and kidney failure as well as central nervous system involvement.	0.5204833968887123
There are three main forms of the disease: the acute form with manifestation in newborn infants and the subacute and the chronic form in children older than one year of age.	0.6065945579337527
Experimental data and clinical as well as postmortem experiences have indicated that subdural hematomas are less frequent in acceleration injuries in traffic accidents compared to falls or assaults.	0.4585691428461623
The present report demonstrates that this does not hold true in the same way for bridging vein ruptures (one of the predominant causes for subdural bleedings).	0.6196583260665308
Ruptures of these vessels without subdural bleeding (SDB) are only seldom mentioned in the literature.	0.5497369167328812
However, if no SDB is present, no one will look for these structures.	0.6882315142341032
In our institute a systematic analysis of the bridging veins in all cases of lethal blunt head injury is made: prior to the careful morphological preparation we investigate these vessels by radiographic imaging after filling with contrast medium.	0.5375204516821971
6 car passengers (age between 4 and 31 years) which suffered a lethal head injury were examined in the last year.	0.8140296061140083
2 victims had impressed fractures with cerebral compression injuries.	0.2703337992621864
In 1 case the base of the skull was broken and in 3 cases no skull fracture was present; no serious focal brain injury had occured in these 4 cases, but 3 victims had signs of diffuse brain injury.	0.6412142615625753
In 5 cases a direct impact of the head against the interior of the car was obvious.	0.7076203796913904
In 5 cases ruptures of serveral bridging veins could be demonstrated.	0.43713571110814536
In one case (survival for 3 days) a minor SDB (20 ml) was present and the ruptures had been closed by thrombosis; another victim died at the scene.	0.8084399043845762
The other 3 victims survived between 4 and 15 hours without developing SDB and without closing of the ruptures by thrombosis.	0.41331738969267956
This combination is surprising and shows that our knowledge concerning the relationship between bridging vein ruptures and SDB is restrictred.	0.4933176832893622
The frequency of bridging vein lesions in severe head injuries is likely underestimated in the clinical as well as in the postmortem literature.	0.6985125534197767
A rapid increase of intracranial pressure after the accident resulting in a collapse of the cerebral circulation is probably responsible for the absence of the SDB in the presented cases.	0.7303421924992703
Implantable hearing aids can form the basis of new surgical techniques for dealing with hearing problems originating in the inner ear, provided they are fully implantable.	0.50363856372665
Accordingly, a comprehensive, interdisciplinary, combined project was initiated at the ENT clinic of the University of Tübingen which was to conclude with operations to improve hearing via fully implantable hearing aids.	0.598309703301842
A novel electromechanical transducer for implantable hearing aids based on the piezoelectric principle is described.	0.4636992043220308
Unlike the piezoelectric transducers reported so far, this transducer does not rely on the bimorphic principle but on a circle-shaped, heteromorphic combination system consisting of a piezoceramic disc and metal membrane.	0.4149672613547033
The transducer can be hermetically sealed and is designed for implantation into the mastoid.	0.36648461919152464
Transfer of mechanical oscillations to an ossicle in the middle ear is effected by a directly fixed coupling rod or via suitable coupling elements.	0.43595675403595
The transducer is highly tuned with a resonance frequency at the upper end of the spectral transfer range (greater than 10 kHz).	0.5115355623362079
Below this resonance and down to low frequencies, the frequency response of elongation is smooth with amplitudes of around 20 nm.	0.4931980715842859
At low and middle frequencies of up to 1 kHz, these vibration amplitudes correspond to sound-pressure levels of around 90 dB SPL.	0.5588182576408988
At higher frequencies of up to 10 kHz, the output level increases to about 130 dB SPL.	0.6191934445869401
Nonlinear distortions are also very small at the highest levels (less than 0.1%) throughout the whole transfer range.	0.5048774025784959
Electric power consumption at maximum levels is in the range of a few microwatts and is therefore significantly lower than that of electromagnetic systems.	0.5791743694607976
Particularly, this makes it possible to use the transducer in fully implantable hearing aids for rehabilitation of sensorineural hearing loss.	0.6248738501460873

Precise concepts and therapeutic strategies are mandatory to detect and deal with anterior visual pathway disorders.	0.5850153784204785
In order to develop these strategies, knowledge of the pathomechanisms of potential optic nerve trauma, primary radiological investigations, and further diagnostic measures are important.	0.720148165966678
Due to the difficulties in neuroophthalmological testing of visual pathway functioning in severely injured patients or even during craniomaxillofacial reconstructions, we established flash-evoked visual potentials (VEP) and the electroretinogram (ERG) as reliable electrophysiological methods to gather specific information as to whether the visual pathway function is intact, even if pathological, but still present or absent.	0.6593102448901947

and 5.4 mg/kg bodyweight/h i.v.	0.7063883451148947
for the following 47 h).	0.388062027606952

Prospective analysis of our trauma patients and the international literature on traumatic optic nerve lesions show that the time factor in when to start therapy has been greatly underestimated.	0.7274310975309791
To fulfill modern treatment concepts in craniomaxillofacial surgery, sound diagnostic and therapeutic knowledge on the maintenance of visual pathway function is required.	0.5594343408745249

Melatonin (N-acetyl-5-methoxytryptamine) is a hormone with multiple functions in humans, produced by the pineal gland and stimulated by -adrenergic receptors.	0.6829428778656073
Serum melatonin levels exhibit a circadian rhythm with low levels during the day, rise in the evening and maximum levels at night between 2 and 4 a.m.. Melatonin participates in the regulation of several physiological processes such as seasonal biological rhythm, daily sleep induction, aging and modulation of immunobiological defence reactions.	0.4728633320707947
Furthermore, melatonin has a highly lipophilic molecular structure facilitating penetration of cell membranes and serving as an extra- and intracellular free radical scavenger.	0.485050158316664
Melatonin seems to quench mainly hydroxyl radicals, the most damaging of all free radicals.	0.559593725054541
Melatonin may play a role in the etiology and treatment of several dermatoses e.g.	0.6168118185126908
atopic eczema, psoriasis and malignant melanoma.	0.42010416916031423
The influence of melatonin on hair growth is another aspect.	0.4425142220987015
Topical application of melatonin inhibits the development of UV-erythema.	0.4538103258918755
Penetration through skin after topical application and oral bioavailability auxit further investigations on the pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic actions of melatonin.	0.3278168420232622

The measured levels in one surgical sample may easily be correlated with the increased asbestos load of the lung due to the patients' occupation as stone mason.	0.6716915352494081

Analysis of 147 repeat arthroscopies of the knee performed at the Department of Surgery at the Herz-Jesu Krankenhaus, Fulda, from 1990 to 1995, showed that meniscal lesions were the most common (n = 89, 60.5%).	0.677033392807469
The majority of meniscal lesions (n = 45, 50.6%) occurred in menisci that had already been partially resected.	0.6421209300786979
The most common localization was the posterior third of the medial meniscus in ipsilateral lesions.	0.6955649629582353
Conversely, contralateral meniscal injuries were only documented in 18 cases (20.2%), while de-novo lesions occurred in 29 cases (29.2%).	0.6404173164236124
A coincidence of meniscal injury with first- or second-grade cartilage damage was documented  in 35 patients (39.3%), whereas 54 patients (60.7%) had normal intra-articular cartilage.	0.7603489450778252
Cartilage damage was most frequent in patients who had previously undergone partial meniscectomy.	0.7312780856187653
The most common therapeutic consequences were partial meniscectomy and cartilage-shaving.	0.5359737885787138
Concerning patients' postoperative satisfaction and evaluation of the results by OAK score, the majority of patients attained significant improvement in function (65.2%) and showed good or excellent outcome in the OAK score (88.8%).	0.7625967089243637
Patients without accompanying cartilage damage had better results in comparison to patients with cartilage damage in the affected area (p < 0.05).	0.5354035529381845
In conclusion, in patients with positive meniscal signs and a history of previous meniscal surgery, repeat arthroscopy is generally and early indicated and can be recommended as a valid method to assess cartilage damage objectively.	0.6531443387147886
However, patients with cartilage damage do not have the same benefit.	0.7074488488631535

Patients showed significant improvement in skin status and psychosocial parameters in pre-post comparison.	0.47816983909058164

Patients with psoriasis also showed an increase in internal control attributes.	0.5238948808235645
Dermatological treatment combined with behavioural medicine therapy can be considered an effective method in patients with atopic dermatitis and psoriasis.	0.6602313113009076
Treatment of chronic cancer pain with strong opioids is indicated in about 60-70 % of patients.	0.7591209081669797
Surprisingly, these very potent analgesics are prescribed with great reservations in many countries, including Germany.	0.584618935000678
The aim of our investigation was to analyse the supply of opioid analgesics to outpatients with cancer pain in the region of Hannover, which has about 1.1 million inhabitants.	0.8978554342788541
In Germany special prescription forms, i. e. triplicate forms, have to be used for the prescription of strong opioids.	0.7243808239671358
At the time when our investigation took place prescriptions for outpatients had to be renewed every 7 days.	0.5443599166404942
For two observation periods of 6 months lasting from January to June 1988 and from January to June 1991 all of the opioid prescription forms that had been issued by general practitioners for clients of the AOK Hannover (one of the major medical insurance companies) were evaluated.	0.6658093837976394
The reasons for prescribing opioids were analysed by recording the diagnosis.	0.46003715784843263
The individual treatment period on an outpatient basis during these 6 months was determined, excluding, e. g. days of hospitalization.	0.5890784724891636
During the two observation periods only 16.2 % (1988) and 19.5 % (1991) of the practitioners in the region of Hannover prescribed strong opioids to outpatients.	0.7404869600228354
The majority of the practitioners consisted of general practitioners and specialists in internal medicine.	0.5871144215998179
Although these two groups mainly function as family doctors who are responsible for the basic therapeutical needs of their patients, only 22.6-33.8 % of these doctors prescribed opioids to outpatients.	0.6925672998826622
In two-thirds of the patients, cancer pain was the reason for prescribing the drug.	0.5593538175609617
The total number of patients with a prescription for cancer pain was 164 in 1988 and 196 in 1991.	0.6433031326672054
Altogether 1002 prescription forms in 1988 and 1065 prescription forms in 1991 had been issued for these patients.	0.4664640372033806
Applied to the individual treatment period as an outpatient, only 36.0 % of the patients in 1988 and 32.1 % in 1991 received a regular prescription of strong opioids every 7 days.	0.8653968427309878
The mean time interval between separate prescriptions was 16.8  +/-  25.4 days in 1988 and 19.4  +/-  29.1 days in 1991.	0.8461214932119199
Accordingly, the majority of patients with chronic cancer pain had been supplied with opioids only occasionally.	0.7477934791317162
Our data indicate a significant undertreatment of outpatients suffering from cancer pain.	0.4308434966448584
Taking into account the estimated total number of patients suffering from cancer, only 14.5 % (1988) and 19.0 % (1991) of all outpatients in need of strong opioids were supplied sufficiently with those analgesics.	0.8186706371750905
Comparing the results from the observation period in 1988 with the results from 1991 it becomes obvious that the situation has not changed.	0.7007934117768292
There are different reasons for the insufficiency of opioid treatment: many physicians as well as their patients are still afraid of the side effects of strong opioids.	0.6843887621141865
Therefore, it is necessary to improve education concerning this issue.	0.6868185125000619
The legal restrictions on the use of narcotics and their complexity are another important reason for doctors not to prescribe strong opioids.	0.3572772632181657
In 1993 the regulations were simplified; nevertheless, this has not led to a profound change in the attitude of the prescribing practitioners.	0.5964731194097713
Thus, further changes in legislation seem to be necessary so that the requirements for the prescription of strong opioids do not differ from other drugs.	0.678804567890949

During a mean period of observation of 224 days after the end of ECT 7 patients (35%) relapsed.	0.6115931136414061
The rate of relapse was higher in RG than in NRG patients (57.1 vs 23.1%).	0.6154147320610348
In all cases ECT was well tolerated; 285 applications of ECT did not result in mortality or persistent morbidity.	0.5240543163828634

There is no doubt that a single emergency phone number is desirable, but in contrast to other countries, in Germany different emergency phone numbers and dispatching centers exist for the fire brigade (FB), the emergency medical service system (EMS), and the general practitioners' emergency service (GPS).	0.7517799429607743
Due to this fact, valuable time is often wasted by connecting or transferring emergency calls from one dispatching center to another.	0.3792863592885845
The purpose of this study was to analyse all calls received by the different dispatching centers in the city and county area of Mainz with respect to total number, fraction of emergency calls, and specificity.	0.6692898769034876
Further, the total number of calls potentially referring to a hypothetic single dispatching center with a general emergency phone number (112) was calculated.	0.6598793781534257
During a 4-month period, all telephone calls were registered and related to day, time, and origin of the call (city or county) and classified as non-urgent or emergency calls, calls appropriate to the dispatching center dialed, emergency calls to be transferred, or unspecific calls.	0.6964665633406462
A total of 80 987 calls were received (city area 84.3%, county area 15.7%), most of them directed to the FB of Mainz (33 086).	0.6065010280931734
The EMS dispatching center received 31 286 calls, the five GPS-centers 15 256 calls; 1359 emergency calls that were directed to the police or FB needed transfer to the EMS.	0.4501793201181349
During weekdays the EMS and FB received the most calls, with a reduced frequency on Saturdays and Sundays (Table 2).	0.5561079659419194
Nevertheless, the highest total numbers of calls were received on Saturdays due to multiple calls directed to the GPS.	0.5340216662707115
The FB had the highest specificity of calls; more than 50% of the calls to the GPS were unspecific (Fig.	0.5892975313522002
Of all calls, 4.37% were classified as emergency calls; two-thirds of these came from the area of Mainz during the daytime.	0.6881947109884949
During off-duty hours of the GPS in the city, 51% of the emergency calls reached the EMS directly; 49% had to be connected by the police or FB.	0.6866978524907568
During duty hours of the GPS, the fraction of calls directed to the EMS decreased significantly to 35%.	0.5666330589089497
During duty hours of the GPS centers in the county area, only 14% of the urgent emergency calls reached the EMS dispatcher directly (Fig.	0.5632789257804367
Compared to the multiple-center mode, a hypothetic single dispatching center for all systems would probably be followed by a slight increase in total number of calls due to the fact that the GPS numbers would be answered 24 h a day, but there would be only minimal differences in the total number received on most days; only on Sundays would a decrease be expected.	0.6606904068071657
The EMS area of Mainz, with a total of 13 different telephone numbers for 7 dispatching centers, can be regarded as typical of the German situation.	0.7833878571397768
The high number of emergency calls to be transferred (up to 86% under special circumstances) demonstrated that this weak point in the German EMS system must be eliminated by introducing a single emergency number.	0.5818857246646257
This should occur when a Europe-wide three-digit number "112" will be instituted, probably in 1995.	0.44444656859011544
Additionally, the continued existence of 5- or 10-digit telephone numbers for non-urgent calls may be useful for allowing non-verbal differentiation of calls.	0.6878349173127762
In any case, all telephone numbers, including the latter calls, have to enter one dispatching center.	0.8560685890870908
The main advantage of a single dispatching center would be avoidance of the time-consuming transfer of emergency calls from one dispatching center to the other.	0.6397914299722202

Objective: Elevated levels of interleukin-1 (IL-1) and Interleukin-6 (IL-6) have been reported after cardiac operation, during inflammatory process and cardiac allograft rejection.	0.7816828257414415

Methods: During aorto-coronary bypass operation, human muscle fibers were excised (n=32) and skinned using Triton-X-100.	0.5261927092904226
The experimental skinned fiber model excludes membrane-related factors such as receptor activation and provides direct examination of the contractile apparatus itself.	0.4364341225421964

Force generation, calcium sensitivity, and velocity of force generation and relaxation were measured.	0.5061074199383777
(Experiments were carried out at optimal length, bath temperature 23 °C, and isometric conditions.)	0.43168771792792154
Results: None of the skinned muscle preparations of the human myocardium showed under the given experimental setup a significant change in contractility and relaxation after exposure to IL-1 and IL-6.	0.5479432321524166
Despite using nonphysiologic concentrations of IL-1 and IL-6 (pIL-1/IL-6 10-5M) no significant effect occurred.	0.6186729733745311
Furthermore no difference in calcium-sensitivity of the contractile proteins following addition of IL-1 and IL-6 could be observed.	0.6427432246876684
Conclusions: Thus, there is no experimental evidence for direct modulation of the contractile apparatus by IL-1 or IL-6.	0.6590207858753634

Also, cranial computed tomography for severe traumatic brain injury (GCS < 9) was applied significantly faster in clinic A (after 36 min) than in clinic C (after 62 min).	0.7331706989843041
Delayed diagnoses were defined as the difference between the ISS at discharge and the ISS at completion of diagnostics in the emergency department; this criterion was met best by clinic A with an ISS difference of two patients compared to five in clinic B and four in clinic C.	0.6415423236355354

In Germany the nonionic CM are currently preferred.	0.39569014496394644

However, a cause-effect relationship has not been established to date.	0.787195474921468

This study presents a risk calculation challenging this view.	0.36108256628619284
Three strategies are presented: prophylactic indication on principle (A), elective operation in every second case (B), and operation in case of strangulation only (C).	0.5490626767164214
On the basis of available epidemiological data it is calculated that, for the male German population aged 65 years and over 69 954 (A), 36 292 (B), and 2630 (C) inguinal hernia repairs would be necessary annually; 167 (A), 145 (B) and 123 (C) perioperative deaths would occur, connected with 1702 (A), 1373 (B) and 1048 (C) years of life lost, respectively.	0.5558893310166629

Aim of the study and methods: In the present study the correlation between ischemia induced ventricular tachyarrhythmias and a dynamic behavior of ventricular late potentials was investigated.	0.7806235330754229
In 16 patients with significant coronary artery disease and survived sustained ventricular tachyarrhythmia an electrophysiologic study (EPS) was performed.	0.6926077340296152
Before EPS (t1), at every stimulation interval and after induction of a ventricular tachycardia or ventricular fibrillation (VT/VF) the lactate concentration was measured in arterial blood and in the coronary sinus for calculation of the myocardial lactate extraction.	0.7114166015723402
Furthermore, before investigation, after induction of a VT/VF and after a 10 minute recovery phase an analysis of the signal averaged ECG was performed.	0.6733584099944935
Nine patients showed a so-called "lactate reversal", i.e., an increase of the lactate concentration in the coronary sinus over the concentration of the arterial blood as an expression of ischemia development, during inducibility of a VT/VF (group A).	0.703975463626226
The control group consisted of 7 patients without ischemia related VT/VF (group B).	0.574082737305922
Results: In group A significant changes of the three late potential criteria were found between t1 and t2 (QRS:115.61 +/- 13.86 vs. 126.06 +/- 16.74, p=0.08; RMS: 25.81 +/- 22.26 vs. 13.11 +/- 10.72, p=0.01; LAS: 37.72 +/- 19.26 vs. 50.06 +/- 10.72, p=0.01).	0.6440344795828272
In group B, no significant changes could be measured.	0.8059768050502724
Furthermore, the prevalence of late potentials increased in group A from 66% (t1) to 89% (t2), whereas in group B no increase was detectable.	0.8152924230685274
Conclusions: These data suggest a dynamic behavior of ventricular late potentials in correlation with the inducibility of ventricular tycharrhythmias due to ischemic circumstances.	0.5678185157072703
Therefore the dynamic behavior of ventricular late potentials can be an expression of a modification of the arrhythmogenic substrate in arrhythmia endangered patients.	0.463565555496484
Recent studies and reviews continue to report a high mortality associated with the acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS), which involves a severe inflammatory reaction within the whole lung that is frequently associated with multiple-organ failure.	0.5676013231536332
Important factors contributing to the poor results in severe ARDS are the aggressive procedures required to maintain sufficient arterial oxygenation, such as mechanical ventilation with high inspiratory pressures and high inspired oxygen concentrations (FiO2) which themselves contribute to the progression of the disease.	0.5636272933989814
As no specific therapy that reduces or prevents the general inflammatory reaction is known, current therapy is limited to procedures that minimize peak inspiratory pressures and FiO2.	0.5324934442583695
Therefore, pressure- and volume-limited ventilation modes with positive end-expiratory pressure, controlled hypercapnia, differential lung ventilation when appropriate, positioning (particularly prone), and aggressive dehydration are used.	0.6308278603838646
Should these procedures fail to improve arterial gas exchange, the patients may be additionally treated by veno-venous extracorporeal gas exchange.	0.5556834667343841
To reduce the risk of severe haemorrhagic complications due to high levels of systemic heparinization, systems internally coated with covalently bound heparin, which allow a lower level of systemic anticoagulation, should be used.	0.5978519469939797
From April 1989 to August 1993, 89 patients were transferred to our intensive care unit for treatment of severe ARDS; 52 were treated by combining the described conventional methods without artificial gas exchange (survival rate 88%) and 37 additionally underwent artificial gas exchange (survival rate 57%).	0.612769503006663
The overall survival rate was 75%.	0.5658086310819309
On the basis of these experiences, we conclude that this step-by-step approach may improve survival in patients with severe ARDS.	0.6982518791199913
Cutis marmorata teleangiectatica congenita (CMTC) is a rare congenital vascular disorder of the venous system.	0.7527040157521734
In 50% of cases there are associated anomalies of other organ systems.	0.7157046426111999
Clinical improvement of the cutaneous manifestations is noted in most cases and usually occurs during the first year of life.	0.7651609428422235
We present a patient with CMTC with a band-like pattern following the L3 dermatome.	0.5759224096275022
At the age of 13 years, the skin manifestations worsened, with ulcerations and intermittent claudication.	0.7128980707783232
Angiographic imaging revealed stenosis of the deep femoral artery, and the circumflex femoral artery and the first perforating arteries were not visualized.	0.7178511241214774
To our knowledge, this is the first reported case of CMTC with anomalies of the large arteries.	0.6591280571598255
Introduction: The efficacy of vascular surgery in the treatment of popliteal arterial aneurysms (PAA) and the justification of conservative therapy was investigated in the present study.	0.8190587697300921
Materials and methods: From January 1985 to December 1996, 87 patients were operated on for PAA.	0.611763898873299
The clinical records were reviewed retrospectively and patients were categorized concerning PAA-related symptoms, vascular run-off, and material used for vascular reconstruction.	0.6048782690338655
Patients were examined, and the patency of the vascular reconstruction was checked by palpation and Doppler sonography.	0.7911889879778908
Results: The cumulative survival calculated using the Kaplan-Meier curve was 70% after 10 years.	0.7003427618567447
Asymptomatic patients had the best results and patients with acute ischemia, the worst.	0.9392875580583308
The outcome concerning patent vs. occluded run-off and autologous vs. heterologous bypass material was similar.	0.414381484524184
Conclusion: Asymptomatic and uncomplicated PAA should be treated surgically.	0.45013386090332913
Only PAA with a diameter less than 2 cm, and without thrombus on the vessel walls can be treated conservatively.	0.7246167108752359
Collodion baby is a clinical description for a transient condition of the newborn which is caused by various disorders of cornification.	0.5777486048183195
The majority of cases are due to autosomal recessive lamellar ichthyosis.	0.5054115309388237
In up to 10% of cases "self-healing" of the skin occurs.	1.0685799462605052
We report about a mature male baby who at birth was covered entirely with a shining, collodion-like membrane.	0.41255240200359133
There also were marked ectropion of the eyelids and eversion of the lips.	0.4020291119813861
After shedding of the membrane almost complete clearing of the skin occurred until the age of three months.	0.5821690543222587
In the case reported here skin biopsies taken on the 20th day of life showed discrete and non-specific ultrastructural changes, with no features of lamellar ichthyosis or other cornification disorders.	0.6428807482911423
Past research on the phenomenon of enhanced pain sensitivity in fibromyalgia syndome (FS) revealed evidence for both a higher pain magnitude in response to nociceptive stimuli (hyperalgesia) and a general perceptual amplification of sensations (hypervigilance).	0.579210394024578
In order to distinguish between these two aspects of disturbed sensory processing in FS, cerebral evoked potentials after brief painful laser and auditory stimuli were measured in 10 FS patients.	0.5095823139770634
Results were compared with those from age-matched painfree controls.	0.6339975732404061
Amplitudes of middle-latency (N1) and long-latency (P2) laser evoked potentials (LEPs) were significantly higher in FS than in controls.	0.6405975397006204
Furthermore, laser intensity at pain but not at sensation threshold was lower in FS than in controls.	0.4132364888676083
However, auditory evoked potentials (AEPs) did not differ between groups.	0.5446875688832887
Enhanced N1 and P2 amplitudes of LEPs suggest stronger sensory and attentional processing of nociceptive information in FS, respectively.	0.312209162494373
The concept of hypervigilance is challenged by the failure to find differences in auditory perception among FS and control patients.	0.43497294626384175
Yet, the importance of unpleasant intensities of auditory stimulation, not applied in this study, to reveal abnormal non-nociceptive perceptual amplification in FS is discussed.	0.6277157025950318
In a prospective study, 53 fractures of the distal fifth of the tibia were stabilized by unreamed nailing.	0.7276518949375406
Additional involvement of the ankle joint occurred in 18 patients.	0.6555066446089081
50 patients returned for follow-up.	0.3241237137986129
In 30 patients tibia and fibula were fractured at the same (distal) level; in 20 patients the fracture of the fibula was located more proximally.	0.684957424345275
In 12 patients the fractures extended into the tibial pilon.	0.5438692724083809
Severe soft tissue damage was seen in 24 fractures (18 open, 6 closed).	0.7262690076167484
Ninety percent of all fractures healed uneventfully without further surgical intervention after unreamed nailing.	0.48534269019894005
In two patients the unreamed nail had to be exchanged for a reamed tibial nail.	0.49818716936142166
Bone grafting and secondary dynamization of the nail by removal of a proximal interlocking bolt were performed in one case each.	0.748982855162772
Thirty-one fractures healed in anatomical position.	0.4109582636683698
Valgus or varus angulation of less than 5  ° occurred in 18 patients.	0.5520073969707239
One fracture healed with rotatory angulation of 15  °.	0.3430952861271164
The highest rate of complications (22 %) was seen in patients with distal fractures of the fibula without additional plating (of the fibula).	0.8321093576738716
There was no deep infection.	0.498357122919999
Tibial fractures close to the ankle joint can be managed by unreamed nailing.	0.7087070297517509

Complex mechanisms have evolved in mammalian cells for regulating cellular lifespan.	0.317048508955053
Normal cells demonstrate a strictly limited growth potential and senescence after a defined number of cell divisions.	0.37144619801774764
In contrast, tumor cells often exhibit an apparently unlimited proliferation potential and are termed immortalized.	0.47660396064697774
It has been proposed that the progressive shortening of the tips of the eukaryotic chromosomes - the telomeres - is an important component of senescence and is involved in the control of cell cycle.	0.8545002520155243
The enzyme telomerase adds TTAGGG repeats onto mammalian telomeres, preventing their shortening.	0.3585235698424869
Telomerase is normally inactive in most somatic cells, but detectable in tumor cells.	0.5306718183704032
The activation of telomerase in malignant cancers seems to be an important step in tumorigenesis in order to gain the ability of indefinite proliferation and to become immortal.	0.6337709267918039
This review describes the present knowledge of telomeres and telomerase and their role in cellular senescence and human aging.	0.429346893633492
It summarizes aspects of telomerase in cancer and its function as a diagnostic and prognostic tumor marker.	0.6002408250253793
PCR-based diagnosis of infectious diseases has developed into an important method in surgical pathology.	0.4728400306400752
We summarize our experience in this area based on 3500 analyses performed during the past 5 years.	0.6983089222997141
The peculiarity of material from a pathological laboratory is the risk of DNA fragmentation as a consequence of tissue fixation.	0.5047800022924287
For this reason the assays used must be adapted to this particular situation.	0.5574815941457278
PCR-based diagnosis of infectious diseases, if performed according to appropriate quality standards, is a safe and effective technique with high sensitivity and specificity and results in an etiologically based diagnosis.	0.7594179078721511
The shift of age distribution within the population of industrialized societies has led to an increased need of treating diseases in elderly patients and at the same time in a higher number of patients bearing an increased operative risk.	0.6486555582737189
Today, the development of surgical techniques and intensive care treatment enables us to carry out numerous procedures in geriatric patients.	0.6721314466720212
Innovative surgical techniques like minimal invasive surgery with minor trauma due to the surgical approach changed patient's categories, also.	0.6437847766473653
Taken together with other procedures causing less operative stress indications for patients who were not operable previously have changed.	0.5491256881786941
New developments such as organ transplantation and immunosuppression also generated totally new groups of patients with very distinct conditions for the operative procedure.	0.549696107751182
Vanishing indications or selection of patients as in peptic ulcer disease changed the surgical approach completely: Negative selection has shifted elective operative interventions in ulcer disease to emergency procedures.	0.4928289771979051
Contrasting experiences made in most other countries and especially in the third world, in Germany economic restrictions have not been encountered as of yet.	0.7480028027310782
Economical conditions, an increase in surgical procedures in elderly patients and advances in medical science will continue to change the surgical patient's characteristics profoundly.	0.6973548707418882
From the physicians viewpoint we have to actively participate in this development by personal interaction with the patient, by interdisciplinary cooperation and prompt social and political action.	0.610613332811717

Because of their small size they can be approached by minimally invasive surgical procedures.	0.5117526037465173

Six patients had instant and constant relief (3 years' observation) of their pain.	0.7695334236961956
In two patients a second transcutaneous intervention was successful.	0.5912954104184341
Only two patients needed open resection.	0.5179515261283171

We live in an epoch that could be designated as the post-Gutenberg-era.	0.38525281984039833
Writing is no longer the dominant sign system.	0.5028344924243034
It is replaced by electronic signs.	0.23734599045036317
We consider approximately the year 1950 as the turning-point between these two epochs, because by then, in the years after the 2nd World War the American households were saturated with televisions.	0.6356333619519976
Thereby, the new sign system asserted itself.	0.5968086007673387
The topic of this article is the transformation of our sign system and thereby of our worlds of symbols, the leap from the world of written signs into the world of electronic signs, and the possibility born out of it to create electronic objects, which I prefer to call virtual objects.	0.6496760166401974
The manipulation of object-choice and object-relationships accompanying this change and the role assigned to analysts in this new world will be considered as well.	0.44731918583752317
These electronic signs developed quickly a life of their own.	0.3779123873019162
A totally new class of objects came into being, the class of virtual objects.	0.47942645341426826
These are electronically transformed, completed or wholly electronically produced objects.	0.292949888558001
This procedure is accompanied by an industrialization of object-choice and object-relationships.	0.4850813411232785
The manipulated object-choice and object-relationship is born and, moreover, a displacement of natural objects through virtual ones.	0.4691076904034643
A change of the socio-cultural understanding is also a consequence of this process.	0.6064167006883608
New patterns of socio-cultural understanding develop, that could be described as industrial feudalism.	0.5558662922498588
The goal of this article is to describe the transformation of our world of signs and the connected industrialization of object relationships, and to interprete them according to our present possibilities.	0.6949358139694902

The early complications of the technique are usually minor and late complications are rare.	0.7323974651113407

Users must be familiar with the technique, the indications and contra-indications for the procedure, as well as the complications.	0.6695559409236946

BTX was rated subjectively the best therapy in all three diagnostic groups (median: 2=good effect).	0.5700539701199601

The perioperative morbidity and mortality is mainly influenced by the type and duration of surgery as well as the patient's preoperative state of health.	0.839497680328836
Anesthesia per se, however, may also result in severe perioperative (patho)physiological changes, which may be both desired (e.g.	0.5974341581659547
analgesia, vasodilation in vascular surgery) or detrimental (e.g.	0.4472662301948274
hypothermia, ventilatory depression) and which may differ depending on the anesthetic technique used (e.g.	0.49127639114559624
general anesthesia vs. regional anesthesia).	0.377607803218886
Yet, all anesthestic techniques have in common, that their effects are not limited to the duration of the surgical intervention, but may expand far into the postoperative period.	0.8875666854081553
Therefore, many trials have been performed in the past aiming to compare the impact of different anesthetic techniques on the incidence of postoperative techniques, no significant advantage of one or the other technique has been identified up to now with respect to postoperative mortality or severe morbidity.	0.8213691447126502
This finding may be due to at least three factors.	0.4916612550681196
1) Many side-effects related to anesthesia - due to close postoperative monitoring - are detected and treated early in the postoperative phase (e.g.	0.6800359362521073
in the recovery room), thereby preventing serious complications.	0.5205667518229602
2) Postoperative mortality related exclusively to anesthesia probably is so low, that huge patient numbers would be required to demonstrate any significant differences between different techniques.	0.6108229357964813
3) Besides the factor 'anesthesia', may other factors contribute to the anesthesia related morbidity and mortality (e.g.	0.5517853819933978
the factor 'anesthetist') which are hardly quantified.	0.7413207559164564
The fact that clear advantages for a single technique have not yet been demonstrated must not, however, result in anesthetic 'nihilism'.	0.4897551140292905
Rather there may be good reasons in the individual patient (e.g.	0.5664188950556569
lack of a recovery room), to prefer a certain anesthetic technique or drug over another, in order to lower the individual risk of anesthesia.	0.5955350998883594
Whether the use of a certain technique - e.g.	0.6212942907709439

rate of reocclusion subsequent to peripheral vascular surgery) is presently under investigation.	0.5399540695235892

He took over the surgical chair in Istanbul, Turkey.	0.27591218981854815

Nissen died in Riehen/Basel on 22 January 1981.	0.23266523752031157
Nissen was a critical observant clinician, an efficient and popular physician, a teacher and a speaker.	0.5721575214351247

M. Linehan developed "dialectical behavioral therapy" specifically to treat chronically suicidal borderline patients.	0.3559812355552156
It rests on a biosocial model that assumes a disorder in the regulation of emotions and in tolerance of stress.	0.4088036544581867
The numerous dysfunctional patterns of behavior such as self-destructive behavior, inability to govern impulses or severe dissociative phenomena are regarded as attempts at problem-solving.	0.32222930822981904
This concept of therapy focuses on the continuing balance between the necessity of accepting maladaptive behavior patterns in both an intrapsychic and an interactional context while still working to change them.	0.431573384490968
A comprehensive manual outlines the clearly structured therapy and integrates a wide choice of therapeutic strategies.	0.362688811915714
Parallel to development of the therapy itself, a method also was developed for testing therapist adherence to the manual's guidelines, thus providing a basis for empirical evaluation.	0.6630101495731809
An initial controlled, randomized study demonstrated the significant superiority of this method to methods of unspecific psychotherapy at various levels.	0.5957175873725723
In the current endeavor to develop disorder-specific approaches to the treatment of personality disorders, "dialectical behavioral therapy" is a noteworthy model.	0.7620288609122067

We present the case of a patient with a subdural abscess as a result of a local pin-track infection of the halo device, in whom pathological behavior was the primary clinical finding.	0.8038511625362055

The attempt was made to explain dysfunctions of the motor system - analogical to electronic data processing systems - as a speciality of the regulation part of the motor system.	0.6208516132285676
Thereby dysfunctions can be seen as misplaced variables in the regulation software with not defined or unknown values of afferences or combination of afferences.	0.5098807004220748
This leads to a failure of the corresponding software modul that results in the loss of function which is regulated through this modul.	0.6676474151267292
Especially with changing of afference through manual treatment or through needling, a replacement of the variables can be reached and this leads to normal function.	0.5491172862792243
With this hypothesis all phenomens of dysfunctions can be explained.	0.39109383061839204
Empirical data on costs of care for chronically mentally ill patients in Germany are rare.	0.5111879334224223
There is a lack of cross-sectional studies as well as of any analysis of the long-term course of mental health care costs.	0.7124107328931525
This study combines data from two cost-studies on patients with schizophrenia, conducted in the same catchment area at an interval of 15 years, to draw conclusions about the long-term course of these costs.	0.6641462691960685
The direct costs of comprehensive community based mental health care had increased by 77.0% during 15 years, while the costs of a permanents stay in a long-term ward of a psychiatric hospital had increased by 78.5% in the same period.	0.6910285692677932
This increase was 27 and 28.5 per cent higher than the general rise in cost of living in Germany during the interval between the two studies.	0.6607490667878465
This higher-than-average increase in mental health care costs was accompanied by a much higher cost-effectiveness.	0.5229293512124578
Thus, this rise of costs must be seen as a consequence of the great deficits and the resulting basic improvement of care for chronically mentally ill patients in Germany, which was demanded by an expert-commission of the government in the mid-seventies.	0.7381006701529342

The immunomodulating effect of primary surgical intervention was investigated in 33 patients with squamous cell carcinomas of the oral cavity, pharynx and larynx.	0.5646277463385492
An operation time longer than 7 h was significantly associated with a decrease in lymphocytes, CD4+ T-lymphocytes and CD8+ T-lymphocytes.	0.5632930022875687
The CD4/CD8-ratio as a marker for the down-regulation of the cellular immune response was slightly decreased but was still in the normal range.	0.5953073638612341
CD4-lymphocyte counts increased 7 days after operation while CD8 lymphocytes were found elevated 4 weeks after sugery.	0.45837470668456753
The in vitro stimulation of the lymphocytes was impaired for 1 to 4 weeks.	0.5948462201062731
Interleukins, interferon-gamma and tumor necrosis factor did not show any changes after surgery.	0.5339393003959697
Decreases of lymphocytes, especially CD4+ and CD8+ lymphocytes, were significantly associated with the time of operation and the volume of blood loss.	0.9305859310449025
Extensive trauma, age, different kinds of anesthesia and intensive care interventions were not associated with specific immunomodulating effects, although these factors might be responsible for suppressing cytokine responses.	0.608942743247788
Both preclinical and clinical evidence support the usefulness of antidepressants in chronic pain treatment.	0.5902060102820251
Monoamine uptake inhibitors influence the neurotransmissions of noradrenaline (NA) and/or serotonin (5-HT); their effect on nociception is thought to take place predominantly within the spinal cord.	0.6063715607974256
Antidepressant drugs seem to differ in their properties as analgesics and as thymoleptics.	0.4423663714960386
The present work is aimed at correlating the special mechanism of action of antidepressants in diminishing nocicepetion with the pharmacological profile of these drugs in clinical pain treatment.	0.5633187818526153
From a preclinical, experimental point of view, it can be expected, that mixed type uptake blockers should be superior to selective NA or 5-HT uptake inhibitors.	0.618522123950846
The analgesic profile of antidepressants was established by a metaanalysis of clinical trials on the effect of these drugs, given alone or in combination with other analgetics, in chronic pain syndromes.	0.8023157741804962
57 Clinical trials were separated into 5 groups according to their scientific quality: [1] placebo-controlled double-blind studies with high power; [2] placebo-controlled double-blind studies with low power; [3-4] open controlled studies or studies with historical controls; [5] case reports.	0.7335954695988436
A study was positive if the tested antidepressant was more effective than placebo or the compared drug or seemed beneficial with respect to the interval of its previous absence.	0.5260977029640439
The most effective antidepressants in chronic pain treatment only included unselective monoamine reuptake inhibitors in the following rank order: amitriptyline > clomipramine >= desipramine >= imipramine >= doxepin.	0.7040838542843292
A statement about the appropriate dosage of these drugs in chronic pain treatment, however, must wait for properly conducted dose finding studies which include the measurement of plasma concentrations.	0.6013457902093052
Intensive care medicine for both surgical and medical patients has a common scientific and clinical basis.	0.6273700309442923
In critically ill patients the medical conditions are complex and can be managed only by specialists thoroughly trained in intensive care medicine.	0.5747932524318493
Therefore, surgeons as well as anesthesiologists must have a detailed theoretical and clinical knowledge of intensive care medicine.	0.5104897011784404

In this review article data of retrospective studies on the therapeutic effects of oxygen are summarized and possible indications for this therapy suggested.	0.7189068778936979
Studies in infants with chronic lung disease (CLD) showed that (i) if SaO2 was kept >= 93 % via generous prescription of home oxygen, rates of sudden death were much lower than in studies where this was less generously prescribed, (ii) weight gain was significantly better with O2 therapy than without it, (iii) increasing SaO2 from 82 to 93 % by providing low-flow oxygen resulted in a 50 % reduction of pulmonary artery pressure, (iv) hypoxia could cause a significant increase in airway resistance, and (v) low-flow oxygen reduced the frequency of intermittent falls in SaO2 to < 85 % even in infants who had values of >= 90 % at rest.	0.7743906606817703
These data suggest that oxygen therapy should be considered in CLD infants if baseline SaO2 is < 93 %.	0.6116608534438756
For older infants, particularly with CF, only few data are available.	0.7641781866202323
In these patients oxygen may only be given if SaO2 is < 90 % unless there are clinical symptoms related to hypoxaemia, e. g. pulmonary hypertension.	0.6243001101603785
Regarding the practical aspects of home oxygen therapy, provision of liquid oxygen via nasal cannulae appears to be the method of choice.	0.5937607351734939
Side effects include the risk of CO2 retention, which occurs occasionally in children with CF or sleep-related upper airway obstruction, but has not been reported for infants with CLD.	0.7549317580772674
To identify this potential side effect and to determine the exact amount of oxygen required, performance of a sleep recording of SaO2 and CO2 with and without oxygen is suggested.	0.5012881230839445
In infants with CLD, home monitoring of oxygenation should also be considered.	0.6012554392995298

Acute occlusive mesenteric ischemia is caused by a local impairment of splanchnic blood flow and poses a particular surgical challenge.	0.5261560708092072
Acute superior mesenteric occlusion is a medical/surgical emergency mandating prompt diagnosis (clinical awareness, angiography) and therapy (exploratory laparotomy with possible arterial reconstruction; embolectomy, thrombectomy; and/or bowel resection).	0.5366185392828645
The difficulty of early diagnosis is probably the most important cause of the high mortality which varies from 70 % to 90 % in arterial and functional mesenteric ischemia and from 20 % to 70 % in an acute thrombosis of the mesenteric veins.	0.9792511346397585

The detection of cytokines may elucidate the pathophysiological mechanisms that produce early systemic complications in acute interstitial (i) or necrotizing (n) pancreatitis (AP).	0.5958379133571962
The increase in the level of cytokines in the blood of patients with AP may correlate with the severity of the disease.	0.8551777512738681
In a prospective clinical trial from October 1992 to August 1993, 23 patients with AP were recruited and blood samples taken for cytokine detection by commercially available Elisa kits and C-reactive protein (CRP) by laser nephelometry.	0.5753382530481178
Six of 11 patients with nAP died either early (n = 1) or of late septic complications.	0.5890113208152136
The peak of cytokine and CRP level in the first 3 days of hospitalization was used for calculation.	0.7910360004468431
The IL-6 concentration in the blood reached up to 2600 pg/ml in the 1st few days, depending on the severity of AP, and dropped to almost zero in the next days, independently of the clinical course.	0.646932292016433
The differentiation of i- versus nAP, using a cutoff line of 600 pg/ml, was correct in 20 patients [87 %, sensitivity (SE): 82 %, specificity (SP): 91 %, P < 0.001].	0.7144327448855052
The blood levels of IL-8 reached a maximum of 1381 pg/ml in the 1st few days, depending on the severity of AP, and showed a correlation with the clinical course in the following days.	0.7203306678558097
The peak of IL-8 blood levels indicated correctly the severity of AP in 18 out of 23 patients using a cutoff level of 200 pg/ml (accuracy: 78 %, SE: 82 %, SP: 75 %, P < 0.01).	0.5700277478104083
The CRP levels increased up to a maximum of 535 mg/l and indicated the course of AP correctly in 18 out of 22 patients (SE and SP 82 %, P < 0.01).	0.5485510122472594
There was no correlation between cytokine blood levels and mortality.	0.5260729358822321
In the blood samples of five patients with i- or nAP, no TNF- was detectable.	0.8808721095676281
The blood levels of IL-6, and to a lesser extent of IL-8 and CRP, can predict the severity and early systemic complications of AP.	0.8267976549768501
The excessive rise in cytokines can be explained by the stimulation of immunological cells (macrophages, lymphocytes and endothelial cells) in the course of AP, inducing early systemic complications.	0.5730517792681841
The surface area and the microporosity of bone regeneration materials influence their chemical and biological properties.	0.41570812093648046
Therefore, the size of the specific surface area and the distribution of the pore diameters (pores < 1 µm) of bone regeneration materials were analyzed within this study.	0.6957524522204476
The analyzed hydroxyapatites were of synthetic, bovine, and phytotroph origin.	0.4786583036156746
The tricalcium phosphates and the bioglasses included only synthetic materials.	0.2237411221366833
The gas adsorption of each specimen was analyzed using a volumetric N2/Kr system (ASAP 2010, Micromeritics).	0.34031626630501444
Additionally, for materials with a specific surface area (> 2 m2/g) the pore size distribution was evaluated by the BJH-method.	0.8057719743888377
Two of the materials evaluated astonishingly large dimensions of the specific surface area (BioOss 79.7 m2/g, Algipore new 14.6 m2/g).	0.4619981268522549
A medium surface area was found for Algipore old (4.9 m2/g) and Interpore200 (2.64 m2/g).	0.8045310242066875
All other included materials showed only small sizes of the specific surface area (Ceros80 1.8 m2/g, Ceros82 1.31 m2/g, Cerasorb 1.2 m2/g, Biobase 0.7 m2/g, Endobone 0.7 m2/g, Perioglas 0.6 m2/g, Allotropat50 0.23 m2/g, Biogran 0.2 m2/g).	0.520919348061038
The materials with large and medium sizes of the specific surface area evaluated the following pore diameters: BioOss 2-50 nm, Algipore new 2-100 nm, Algipore old 5-50 nm, Interpore200 2-100 nm.	0.4692508998236045
Pore sizes less than 2 nm were not found in relevant numbers.	0.5137951075374694
The materials BioOss, old and new Algipore, and Interpore200 contain a large interconnecting mesopore system (diameter < 1 µm).	0.5644785957485338
For the materials Biobase, Endobone, Perioglas, Allotropat 50, and Biogran this cannot be assumed.	0.48490789213041163
The materials Ceros80, Ceros82, and Cerasorb evaluated a specific surface area between those and might include only a small part of these interconnecting pores.	0.5426453302530312
An influence of the interconnecting porosity and the different sizes of the specific surface areas on the biological behavior of the bone regeneration materials can be suggested.	0.6805213983518605

Both ill-defined environmental and genetic factors contribute to the development of the disease.	0.5127825295982762
Allele 4 of ApoE is a genetic risk factor.	0.368005970056165
Its presence increases the risk of developing AD.	0.5763636341743886
However, presence of e4 is neither necessary nor sufficient for the disease to arise.	0.538810560357302
Apart from the common multifactorial forms of the disease, there are rare variants which are inherited as Mendelian traits.	0.6114730594425907
To date three genes are known that can be  mutated in these rare forms of AD.	0.4573619570054188
Of these, mutations in the gene presenilin 1 on chromosome 14 are most frequent.	0.47310952857923555
In addition, mutations in the gene presenilin 2 on chromosome 1 and in the amyloid precursor protein gene (APP on chromosome 21) occur in autosomal dominant AD.	0.5127441072468791

In recent years female psychoanalysts provided fertile approaches to an understanding of the mother-daughter-relationship with the conceptions of the 'lesbian complex' (Poluda-Korte), the 'symbiotic illusion' (Halberstadt-Freud), the 'higher permeability of the ego-boundaries' (Rohde-Dachser), and the 'conflict of separation-individuation which has to be resolved again and again throughout life' (Berger).	0.5395177920044968
In the light of these conceptions it is hypothesized that in analyses with both participants being of equal gender (female-female psychoanalyses) a specific intensity and quality of female aggression may manifest itself when certain threshold situations of the pre-oedipal mother-daughter-relationship are revided.	0.4462678270193846

There has been a marked increase in the incidence of pelvic fractures over the last few years.	0.6913030093553415
Associated injuries to the urogenital and vascular system as well as nerve injuries worsen the prognosis.	0.47120204140033717
Over a five year period 126 patients with severe pelvic trauma were treated.	0.5471656351211583
Out of these 39 (30.9%) sustained additional peripelvic injuries and represent the study sample.	0.6461120439977875
Type B injuries according to the AO classification occurred in 16 (41%) patients, type C fractures in 23 (59%) patients.	0.7995812845181566
The spleen, liver and kidney were the most frequently injured organs (58.9%), followed by urogenital lesions (46.6%), nerve injuries (25.6%) and vascular lesions (15.3%).	0.7019384675110719
The most common extrapelvic lesions were thoracic injuries in 56.4% and severe head injuries (GCS<8) in 33.3%.	0.7726392432965019
The mean Hannover Polytraumascore was 35.6 points, the mean Injury Severity Score 27.6 points.	0.7801251356938643
Osteosnthesis was performed in 21 pelvic ring fractures (53%), eight procedures (50%) in type B fractures and 13 (56%) in type C fractures.	0.8509200758384972
In type B injuries the anterior pelvic ring was stabilized with a tension band wiring in four cases, in two patients with an external fixator and with plate osteosynthesis in one case.	0.8751645580370331
In type C injuries the external fixator was applied as the only stabilizing procedure in six patients.	0.6627507968006955
In four cases the anterior ring was fixed with tension band wiring or plates and the dorsal aspect of the pelvic ring with sacral bars.	0.5900048627925456
Three patients had their additional acetabular fracture plated through a anterior approach.	0.41386608990706836
All surviving 28 patients were followed up for an average of 18 months (range 7--59 months) after the trauma.	0.8845067148585505
The patients were classified using the pelvic outcome score proposed by the German Society of Trauma Surgery.	0.6995251096976359
53.4% of the type B fractures showed a good clinical outcome, 47.6% a poor outcome.	0.8468450102934144
15.4% with type C fractures presented with a good outcome, 84.6% with a poor outcome.	0.8821998699347554
80% of the type B and 23% of the type C fractures had a good radiological outcome.	0.8717566729969787
20% of type B and 77% of type C injuries had a poor radiological outcome.	0.959000075558859
Five patients (12.8%) sustained persistent urological symptoms.	0.6784291718434052
Three of these had urinary dysfunction, two used permanent cystotomies due to their severe neurolgical deficit after a head injury.	0.503185108910188
Ten patients with nerve injuries at the time of trauma suffered long term neurological dysfunction of the lumbosacral plexus.	0.5538357500267279
The mortality rate was 28%.	0.6060925407938496
Seven patients died in the emergency room due to uncontrollable bleeding, four in the intensive care unit from multi-organ failure.	0.5900666246944766
The management of complex pelvic trauma consists of fracture treatment and interdisciplinary treatment of the associated injury.	0.5847503868809948
Lesions of the abdominal organs or of major vessels must be addressed first if hemodynamic instability is present.	0.5235921690891305
Injuries to smaller vessels can be embolized percutaneously.	0.28228356923308856
Urinary bladder ruptures are treated as an emergency, urethral lesions electively after four to six weeks .We recommend external fixation of the pelvis in the acute phase for control of both the osseous instability and control of haemorrhage through external compression.	0.7103148113609177
The treatment of choice for the anterior pelvic ring is tension band wiring or plating.	0.6442087917413608

Patients and methods: 41 children with a mean age of 9.6 (3.7-16) years with recurrent atrioventricular nodal reentrant tachycardia (AVNRT) refractory to medical treatment (n=38) and recurrent syncope (n=3) underwent electrophysiologic (EP) study.	0.7434110655959935
In all patients dual AV-nodal physiology could be demonstrated during EP study and typical form of AVNRT (mean heart rate 220/min) could be induced by programmed atrial stimulation.	0.6566302185905794
A steerable 7 F ablation catheter was placed at the inferoparaseptal region of the tricupid valve annulus close to the orifice of the coronary sinus with the intention to record a late fractionated local atrial electrogram during sinus rhythm.	0.5259858489224698
Starting at this point radiofrequency current (500 kHz) with a target temperature of 70 °C was delivered with the intention to ablate the slow pathway.	0.6133531750015047
If a slowly accelerated junctional rhythm (<120/min) occurred during energy discharge, programmed atrial stimulation was repeated.	0.6006088023970264
Otherwise radiofrequency current was delivered step by step up to a septal position next to the tricuspid valve annulus.	0.4342163488605599
Slow pathway ablation was defined as lack of evidence of dual AV nodal pathways during repeated atrial stimulation.	0.48085609003163393
Slow pathway modulation was defined as maximal one atrial echoimpulse after ablation.	0.36809263403252895
Results: The number of energy applications ranged from 1-19 (median 6).	0.7219643561306166
In 35/41 patients slow pathway ablation could be achieved; in six patients the slow pathway was modulated.	0.5918697313151726
In none of the patients permanent high grade AV block was observed.	0.6153332393541764
During follow-up (mean 4.1 years) two patients had a recurrent episode of AVNRT after slow pathway modulation.	0.8476099816422735
All other patients are still free of AVNRT without medical treatment.	0.5543230953014774
Conclusion: Selective radiofrequency current ablation/modulation of the slow pathway is a safe and curative treatment of AVNRT in young patients.	0.5238922625301469

Spontaneous rupture und false aneurysms of the non-arteriosclerotic aorta are rare.	0.30836906061558517
We report on a 53-year-old patient with false aneurysm due to covered rupture of the thoraco abdominal aorta following sarcoidosis initially repaired by semicircumferential aortic end-to-end anastomosis.	0.5091245554470042
After 6 months local recurrence occurred and the afflicted aorta was replaced by autologous arterial graft, transferring the right iliac artery as aortic patch.	0.4749442391250249
The iliac reconstruction was performed by PTFE interposition.	0.5771855907480657
There was no specific therapy for sarcoidosis.	0.5913896677016526
At 1 year follow-up there was no recurrence and the patient is free of symptoms.	0.9027518331031611
In this biomechanical study the implanted Unreamed Humeral Nail (UHN) has been tested concerning bending and torsional stiffnesses.	0.4832079565198381
In literature other intramedullary implants have been critisized for insufficient rotatory stability especially in transverse and short oblique fractures of the humeral shaft.	0.4237484593795469
This study examined, whether the implanted UHN, as well as the UHN implanted with interfragmentary compression through a specific compression device, is able to augment torsional stiffness significantly.	0.6060810909312891
To evaluate bending and torsional stiffnesses, the UHN has been compared biomechanically to the Russell-Taylor humeral nail (RT) in paired mid-shaft osteotomized cadaveric humeri.	0.5127585135365512
Identic paired comparison has been performed with the UHN without and UHN with interfragmentary compression.	0.47294124231145446
In anterior-posterior, as well as medio-lateral direction stiffness under four-point-bending is significantly higher in stabilizing with the RT.	0.429499641857202
Under torsional loading with moments of 4 Nm, 6 Nm and 8 Nm the UHN reached more than the double torsional stiffness.	0.4586883290147357
The RT, which is only dynamically interlocked, owns a high initial "play" between bolts and nail itself.	0.5085176858836855
Through additional interfragmentary compression stiffness of the UHN under four-point-bending in anterior-posterior, as well as medio-lateral direction augments significantly.	0.36020136810276543
Also under torsional loading with moments of 4 Nm, 6 Nm und 8 Nm torsional stiffness increases with interfragmentary compression significantly.	0.39581944677527026
In comparison to other biomechanical studies of different autorship it is clear, that this statically interlocked intramedullary nailing of the humeral shaft is superior to non-statically interlocked types of nailing concerning their stabilizing potency in torsion and serves especially for fracture types, which are critically under rotation, as transverse or short oblique humeral shaft fractures.	0.616478005155984
While the different national health systems merge structurally, cost expansion in health care is a global challenge.	0.4878046054122417
Structural reforms have been developed during recent years in the USA which can be summarized as "managed care".	0.655824790472306
They are characterized by the evolution of an economically orientated system, in which units of medical therapy are generally handled like conventional economical goods.	0.6451713776096939
In managed-care models, patients are deliberately directed to the most economic forms of therapy.	0.6541505838325545
The spectrum of medical interventions as well as diagnostic or therapeutic patterns are predefined by a system of contracted guidelines, which lead to a standardization of processes.	0.6113719800338676
Financing and medical executive responsibilities fuse.	0.218969953572789
The autonomy of medical decisions is clearly reduced to enforce an integrated and economically oriented steering of the health system.	0.4401690281691276
Leadership is no longer primarily confined to doctors or scientists.	0.44884078412459
It is progressively shifting to financing institutions, managing directors or insurance companies.	0.2684769938478864
Structural changes currently are expanding rapidly in the U. S. and have meanwhile led to marked regional reductions of medical costs.	0.43418910388541126
Nevertheless, the US model is still far more expensive compared to the German system.	0.7035952642858719

On the subject of natriuretic peptides there is a great deal of controversy, and intensive research efforts have been made studying their effects on electrolyte homeostasis.	0.7604881300597716
In the early 1980s, a peptide that caused diuresis, natriuresis, and had a relaxant effect on vascular smooth muscle was discovered independently by several groups.	0.6780028226673076
This was the breakthrough for the identification of natriuretic peptides, followed by the characterisation of the amino-acid sequences of several species.	0.509472778766439
Synthesis of the peptide, cloning of the encoding gene, identification and characterisation of specific receptors, as well as the development of antibodies and radioimmunoassays were rapidly accomplished.	0.5313301970118602
Research on the immunohistochemistry of cardiodilatin/atrial natriuretic peptide (CDD/ANP) and the regulation of CDD/ANP gene expression led to detection of the peptide in extra-atrial tissues.	0.5939737385773199
Later on, two new peptides were discovered brain natriuretic peptide (BNP) and C-type natriuretic peptide (CNP).	0.5400677602108406
These peptides share structural features with CDD/ANP with regard to their 17-amino-acid-exhibiting loop bridged by a disulfide bond.	0.40833487584246886
Another recently discovered peptide is urodilatin (URO), a renal-borne new member of A-type natriuretic peptide.	0.4793273489678735
URO was isolated from human urine and consists of the same sequence as CDD/ANP, containing the 17-amino-acid residue loop of the circulating hormone with 4 additional amino acids located at the NH2-terminus of the peptide.	0.5140428173134481
Regarding physiological actions, data strongly support a close association between URO and urinary sodium excretion.	0.40786168827613295
The application of URO in animals revealed a stronger diuresis and natriuresis with a lower influence on arterial blood pressure compared to CDD/ANP-99-126.	0.4656405837321323
These results were encouraging for the use of URO in clinical trials as a tool to prevent acute renal failure (ARF) in patients following heart transplantation and for treatment of incipient ARF in patients following liver transplantation.	0.6961671848712934
Summarising the results of these two studies, URO represents a new approach for not only prevention, but also for treatment of ARF following organ transplantation.	0.8359882312180511
This opens up new possibilities for the treatment of ARF of other origins in intensive care medicine.	0.42144595236227356

Introduction: Bile duct complications after laparoscopic cholecystectomy occur twice to three times more frequently than after an open procedure.	0.5181150900269423
Four different types of lesions may be differentiated by the Siewert classification: postoperative bile fistulas (type I), late strictures (type II), tangential injuries of the bile duct (type III) and defect lesions (type IV).	0.6635144197820348
The diagnostic and therapeutic management is demonstrated in relation to our own experience and the literature.	0.8953429065819982
Methods: Eleven patients (median age 43.8  +/-  17.2) with bile duct complications after laparoscopic cholecystectomy were operatively treated between November 1993 and December 1998.	0.7260272176395426
Nine patients (four type-II lesions, five type-IV lesions) were referred from another hospital; 2 defect lesions out of 410 laparoscopic cholecystectomies (0.5 %) were documented in our own patient group.	0.7192540402774564
Results: Four patients with late strictures were operatively treated with a hepaticocholedochostomy (n = 2) or hepaticojejunostomy (n = 2) after 14.3  +/-  8.4 months and were discharged from hospital after 10.6  +/-  3.8 days.	0.822121230857223
In both cases with type-IV lesion and a short defect, an end-to-end anastomosis was successful (hospital stay 11.6  +/-  1.0 days).	0.7623478299902025
However, a retrocolic Roux-Y end-to-side hepaticojejunostomy was perfomed in all cases with a larger defect (n = 5; hospital stay 14.8  +/-  2.0 days).	0.769014795154708
The two defect lesions in our own group were detected by intraoperative cholangiography and immediately treated after conversion either with hepaticocholedocho-stomy or hepaticojejunostomy (hospital stay 11.2  +/-  0.6 days).	0.6177110874186539
Conclusions: The incidence of bile duct complications after laparoscopic cholecystectomy might be kept down by anatomic preparation, selective intraoperative cholangiography and early consideration of conversion to open procedure.	0.4995547363517753
The clinical course after biliary tract injury can be positively influenced only by a standard diagnostic and operative procedure and by an early transfer to a specialized center.	0.5951706111757012

The mortality of perioperative myocardial infarction is still high and according to recently published data amounts to 17 to 42%.	0.5463467125289067

However, in the perioperative situation thrombolytic therapy remains to be problematic in most cases because of expected severe bleeding complications.	0.6476256852968918

Up to date no data are available concerning the effect of acute-PTCA on mortality of perioperative myocardial infarction.	0.5629581051737393
Nevertheless it can be assumed, that acute-PTCA will lead to a considerable reduction in mortality of perioperative myocardial infarction.	0.7378839217337001
Therefore, in patients with significant perioperative myocardial infarction immediate coronary angiography and, if indicated, acute-PTCA should be performed.	0.8456391655570163
In principle, thrombolytic therapy is considered to be contraindicated in the intra- or postoperative situation.	0.6743058976208608
However, if coronary angiography and PTCA are not possible, thrombolysis might be taken into consideration, in particular if the expected bleeding complications are small in relation to the expected benefit of thrombolysis.	0.774273821719833
Since acute-PTCA has been shown to remarkably reduce mortality in patients with cardiogenic shock after acute myocardial infarction, this group of patients should be especially considered.	0.6760214736673734
